Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: guestfromlanghus
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel. Didn't look clean because of coffe stains on the floor. Great location and a Wagamama right across the street. I wouldn't pay full price at this hotel if I go back. And it wouldn't hurt the staff to smile and handle one customer at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok rooms and not helpfull at all stuff”
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo G
Reviews.Content: I arrived and asked for a room facing the street which I did not get. The rooms are big but some of them have see through showers which is not nice if you go with a relative or family. The location is just perfect, close to everything and the concierge service is very good as helpfull as well. The front desk people is not nice and they are not willing to help. I requested someone to help me with the luggage and they said to was not the standard procedure, eventhough they said yes, I waited for at least 10 minutes and nobody came. The price is not low, they charge for internet access, and charge a lot, as well for the mini bar. The restaurant is expensive. And the rooms are not properly cleaned. I would say the only remarkable thing of this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lopbuli
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers quality standards. The reception staff is professional, smiling and helpful. The location is absolutely perfect in the very centre of Amsterdam, 20 meters away from the '9' and '14' tram stops. There is plenty of cafes and restaurants around. We were assigned with a room with a glassy toilet (divided by a glass wall only). We asked to change it with a room offering more privacy and they satisfied our request without any problem. The negative part is that our room was not cleaned for two days (on a total of three nights stay) nor the tea/coffee making facilities were refurbished. We complained at the reception and the room was cleaned immediately after. The safe deposit box got locked, and after two days (as it was the weekend) the staff managed to unlock it. I would definitely recommend it, anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Functional if you need a bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: IainBrighton
Reviews.Content: Needed to book a hoel at the very last minute and found this hotel on Laterooms.com. At â‚¬109 for the night, it was fine for a quick one night stayover. Room was clean and fine in size for one person. Overall, I would say the hotel looks a bit tired but surprised to read negative reviews about either the state of the room or the reception staff who I thought were professional in their customer service. As this hotel is just off Rembrandt Square, make sure you get a back room (mine was) which helps keep the noise down, especially when so close to a really busy square. whilst ataying at this hotel, make sure you go to 'Lo Stivale D'Oro' - Italian Restaurant over the road - seperate review written. To get to the hotel, the no 9 tram goes past the front door - get off at Rembrant Square and follow the tram line (past the Azax Exhibition on the corner) and you will walk directly to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4th stay! Still love it! 5th will be here also!”
Reviews.Author: Reiss S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the only one to use. Bang on Rembrandt square, which is the top end of Amsterdam but also close the shops and museums etc you want to see! And the lights! Took my girlfriend and 2 buddies. Came home late, was still served a beautiful steak, ordered breakfast after hours no problem, checked out late no hassle! The type of place you want when your trying to squeeze so much into a short stay! Treated like a king! Love it, definitely recxoment for family's for a quiet one as well as the lads as its 2 mins from the bars! It's not too close though so you don't hear a thing once your back! Make sure you book the Hampshire, Eden is just as nice (sister hotel) but hampshires a star up! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Two in One??”
Reviews.Author: DandJNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Booked Eden Rembrant Square but found we were in the conjoined Hampshire. Upgraded to executive room so very pleased with the comfort and facilities of the room, dressing gown and slippers always a nice luxury. Reception staff very pleasant and helpful. Can't of course comment on the Eden other than the modern foyer and helpful concierge. Eden does look out onto the canal, a big plus but from the outside the windows look shabby. Hampshire has no view other than directly into an open plan office suite. Either hotel very well located just off the lovely Rembrant Plein. The number 9 tram from Central Station stand A takes you to Rembrant Plein. Our first conductor had run out of one day tickets (best value) which made the short trip on a one hour ticket more expensive â‚¬3.60 each. If doing the very doable walk to the hotel go left out the station, cross road and head up past Newmarket. Very picturesque by the canal, very Amsterdam. If you go straight over the road from the station as you may be inclined to do as it signs 'Centre' you go up the main drag to Dam Square. Not so picturesque because of long term road works and not in view of canal. Either way Amsterdam is all very walk able and a great, entertaining city. Sitting under red lights made some interesting photos! As ever the drunk groups of Brit men an embarrassment but to be fair they gather in the most obvious places and clearly enjoy! Just don't travel DFDS ferry with them, that's another story. Flying KLM was perfect, short, easy flight, great times and airport connections. Tip: hire bikes, it's the only way to travel

Reviews.Title: “Money no worth it”
Reviews.Author: GioGio_11
Reviews.Content: Horrible rooms and not cleaned If you book a standard room your room is just in front of the tram track with a lot of noise People at the reception not polite and ugly Bathroom dirty and dust everywhere in the room Is this a 4 star hotel!?! Come on!!! Location only make sense but there are plenty of hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, OK service.”
Reviews.Author: zee_bbee
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, within walking disatance to eveything. The hotel itself was very clean, our twin room was the perfect size. The glass bathroom was a bit awkward as there was minimal privacy. The staff were OK but if there was a problem they were not eager to help. Also, the pushbikes were not available and there was no option to reserve. Hotel did feel secure though and that's what counts.

Reviews.Title: “What it Says on the Tin”
Reviews.Author: littleoneleahmcb
Reviews.Content: I had looked at this hotel before as I have been to Dam many times but it was always a bit pricey for me so when I got a great deal on Travel Republic I jumped at the chance & booked two nites B&B in late Feb. Check-in was a breeze in fact we arrived 3 hours early & still got our room on the spot. Credit card imprint was taken to cover any use of the mini-bar etc but this is standard practice in any decent hotel. The rooms were fabulous, not massive but had everything - spotless white linens, mini-bar, tea & coffee making facilities, free safe, big flat screen on the wall need I say more? The bathroom was very cool with a huge, built for 2, glass shower which backed onto the bedroom Whoa! and all the usual lovely smelly things that you could want. The breakfast in the morning was from 7-10.30 and even at 10.00 it was fab. Fresh fruit salad (no tinned muck) fresh baked breads, danish & french pastries, selection of hams, cheeses, smoked salmon, bacon, sausages, scrambled/boiled eggs, 3 types of fresh juice kept cool on crushed ice, cereals, yogurts.... need I go on?? Even when we checked out at 12.00 they held our luggage in a locked room until 6.00pm & even offered to order us a taxi to the airport. I loved this hotel & its not very often that I would go back to the same establishment twice but I would with this hotel. It is in a great location and a no. 9 tram from Stand A at the train station will drop you off 50 metres from the door. I experienced none of the negatives that some other reviewers seem to. So go on take your partner & enjoy a morning or evening shower together!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Emz247
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights in feb 2012 and for the price I have to say I was dissapointed. Firstly the snobby male at reception asked us for an extra 100 euros for a deposit and said something about it being due to us being English (we're welsh). The receptionists then turned to eachother and started to speak dutch in front of us (they were speaking english before we came to the desk) which seemed quite rude too. The bedroom was clean enough, although the double bed we requested turned out to be 2 single beds pushed together. After 2 nights staying here we came back to find some womens tights on the floor in our room =/. The shower head was broken and it took about 30mins to run a bath because the water comes out so slowly. We tried putting our 'do not disturb' sign up but it was taken away on the second night and going to ask for another would've meant dealing with the snobby staff who can't even smile back at you in the corridor. Our room was at the front of the hotel and it was really loud during the night. For a 4 star hotel I don't think it's too much to ask for a clean room and polite staff. This place is a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RonOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Really chic hotel with a very nice design concept. Room was very clean and comfortable with a very nice and interesting bathroom. On that note, if you're one for complete privacy in the loo you may not like the trendy bathroom with frosted glass doors and wall. The hotel is in a really quiet part of the city with lots of nice bars and cafes close by. The staff is kind and helpful. I recommend it and do not understand the negative posts. This is a 3 star boutique hotel, it is not a boring full service mega-hotel like the Marriott and doesn't pretend to be (which is exactly why I chose it).

Reviews.Title: “you want four star well book four star ya pikeys”
Reviews.Author: bonkersmoronico
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel no idea why anyone would connect two different star hotels together. I read the reviews and expected a problem - there was not one. Perfect hotel and location. The problems obviously occur in the three star bit and people should take no notice of them. As the title says you want four star book 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room with good location”
Reviews.Author: shateq123
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was not too big but it's sufficient and clean. The location of this hotel is not situated too near to the red light district but it's within walking distance. Being situated away from red light district also makes the hotel much more quieter, safer and cleaner. I would definitely come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: splinter49
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at this hotel and I was pleasend suprised ,because I did not know what to expect , the price was very goodfor Amsterdam. The reception was pleasanrt and fast check in, only problem was that the minibar was locked when I wanted to use it , otherwise no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: atyam
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend of my birthday with my husband in Amsterdam, and we stayed at this hotel. The location is perfect; walking distance to most of the sights and the main pedestrian/shopping streets, with plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants. Also well communicated by tram to the train station and the museums etc. The hotel is nice and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. We got a voucher for a drink at the hotel bar because of my birthday, which was a nice touch :) The room we got it was clearly a single room with a double bed (only one set of towels, one hanger for the towel, one pair of slippers..) but it was spacious enough. We asked to change rooms because the windows didn't close properly so it was very cold every time we arrived to the room, and very noisy at night. We got a room (again a single with double bed) facing the inner court, and it was perfect! Breakfast was also very good. The only "complaints" would be the beds, which we found way too soft, and that there is no wifi in the rooms, only in the lobby.. but then again, not a big deal. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not worth the money considering its 4star”
Reviews.Author: baljit s
Reviews.Content: I went to dam on new years day for 4 nights. Considering I was paying Â£150 for the 1st night & Â£97 for the other 3 i expected a lot more for my money. The location was fab. The room itself was clean - ish. The huge stains on the carpet floor were abit alarming. The mini bar was locked. Every soap dispenser or rail fell off with the slightest touch. Considering the room was main road facing it was actually quiet. Room Service was quick & very good. Considering all the money spent on room the breakfast was not included & would have been an extra! There was not enough information about the hotel facilities. The hotel is very modern with basic needs met. I feel that I should have got more for my money considering my friends were staying in a b&b for Â£50per nite which included a full english breakfast with the same amenities. I was disappointed as last year we had stayed at 3* rembrandt classic and as we upgraded this year I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Roket
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Amsterdam and loved this hotel. Reception staff were very helpful and friendly. The room itself was very large and we were surprised by the size. The bathroom was fine also. Location wise it was great as its away from all the major action but close enough to get these areas. There was no noise at night time which I know can be an issue in Amsetrdam. The bed itself was huge and really comfortable. My only complaint is that the soap dispenser in our bathroom didn't work and was empty and we asked a few times for this to be filled but it wasn't. There is also free WIFI in the foyer but we were able to get this in our room which was a bonus. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel I Would Reccommend”
Reviews.Author: Linzie81
Reviews.Content: Location wise this hotel was perfect, you are a short walk from all the big sights but at the same time far enough away from it all if you fancy having some peace and quiet. The hotel was clean and modern and we were pleasantly surprised as we got a good rate and therefore were not expecting much. The room was rather cold and we could not figure out the heating but this was not a big issue. Staff were very helpful and friendly, however this was let down by the receptionists who seemed unable to crack a smile or look you in the eye, their service was very robotic and inpersonal. I would also agree with an earlier review regarding the cleaning staff whom if you did not put the do not disturb sign ont he door would come in at all hours, but then again with the sign on they do not bother you. Overal I would reccommend this hotel, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “What amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: CazWittering
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location to all the bars and restaurants on rembrandt square. Their staff were exceptional, especially concierge. Nothing was too much trouble and they were so proactive that they arranged taxis and reservations before youd even thought of it. This was our 3rd stay at the Eden and we probably will always stay there again on our next visit. Ive noted a lot of negative comments from others and I have to say that you get what you paid for. it's a great location, very friendly staff and definitely a great base. There is free wifi in Pippas bar, so you can't grumble at that. Thank you Eden, for making our stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Me
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my husband. Hotel is lovely, really clean and in a good location. Rooms were huge and extremely comfortable. Bathrooms spacious and sparking. .Nice strong shower. Lots of wardrobe space. Good location literally just off Rembrandt Square and a one minute walk to tram stop. At the back entrance you can have a nice walk down the canal. We didn't book breakfast here as it was too expensive but there are lots of little restaurants and cafes around to choose from. Staff were professional. Concierge was so helpful with directions, places to see etc. Loved it, would definitely stay here again and would recommend to friends :)

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, understaffed, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by the planners of a business trip, had it been a personal trip I would have checked out immediately. It's important to point out that this is one of the rare hotels that DO NOT have wireless, except in the lobby. You have to pay for the internet in the rooms, which is wired, or use their free, incredibly slow one-day internet pass. I arrived at around 5am, totally exhausted and wanting to sleep. However when I get to my room and pull back the covers, I find small, dark hairs all over the sheets. Not only that, the sheets looked ancient and even had a hole in them. Reception finally sent someone to change them. Things got worse, however, when in the light of day I realised that the bathroom was filthy. There were soap smears all over the shower tiles and glass, as well as the sink. Some of the stuff in the room was thick in dust, it was very obvious that the rooms were not thoroughly cleaned and that, judging by the state of the bedding and the broken soap dispenser in the bathroom, the hotel was penny pinching. The fruit salad at breakfast was discusting, but the rest was plain and relatively unoffensive. Breakfasts were packed though and they couldn't clear quick enough for arriving people to sit, it seemed very understaffed. To top it off, my window was next facing the tram line and so I heard loud rumbling all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Niffer10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in September. The location can't be beat. You are next to Rembrandt Square and a number of restaurants and bars and an easy walk to tourist attractions! The room was nice, except for the stains on the carpet which were a little disturbing. If I were the owners I would invest in some new carpeting because other than that the rooms are very nice! The one complaint I'd have is the noise from the street- it may not be that way for the whole hotel, perhaps it was the location of our room- right over a street with a number of bars/clubs- but it went on all night. That being said, I still think it was a great deal and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Whats Wrong with People .....”
Reviews.Author: Whitebriefs4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam with friends and stayed at the Eden Hotel . The hotel was great much better than we expected from the reviews on here . Bed was so comfortable . Sheets clean .. Bathroom was a little dusty but nothing to complain about . Breakfast was great , Choice of continental , Pastries. Scrambled eggs bacon , Sausages . fruit salad , smoked salmon .... etc etc ...... Location was great only a few miniutes walk from shops and a 20 min walk to train station . Would recommend this hotel and definately use again

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and unclean room, expensive minibar but a great location.”
Reviews.Author: sara123
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny. A small room with dirty carpet (whether it was mud or faeces I couldn't tell) and I found that rather disgusting. One of my towels didn't look particularly clean either. Charged 5 euro for 500ml bottle of water from mini bar (gulp!). Positives were that the bathroom itself appeared clean, although the container holding the nice shower gel kept falling off. Great location, by the Amstel river, near some nice restaurants and cafes, walking distance to the flower market, dam square and the rijksmuseum. Not sure I'd return to this hotel when in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beammeupscotty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night in October. We came across on DFDS from Newcastle and booked this hotel at their recommendation. I have to say it was very good. Staff were delightful and the room was very comfortable. Breakfast was also good. I would have no hesitation in staying here again. My only wish is that we had stayed another night or two.Our room overlooked the canal and it was nice to sit and watch the business of the city go by.Not that we spent a lot of time in our room as we had so much to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming, glorified Travelodge.”
Reviews.Author: part_time_iller
Reviews.Content: This is one level above a Travelodge or Holiday Inn but twice as expensive. We paid 188 Euros for a room with no minibar, television only available for a 12 euro premium, a window that looked out onto a rubbish-strewn internal rooftop covered in pigeon excrement and a bathroom where both soap and shampoo dispensers came off in your hand when you tried to use them. We were told to leave credit card details as a deposit against the mini bar too! Staff were generally helpful but the decor was tired. Friend's room was on the first floor above a noisy bar. The hotel needs to pay more attention to the details. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “East of Eden - by some way”
Reviews.Author: Roobiscuit
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location. Rembrandt square 1 mins walk. Idea for tram stop. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Negatives: Room 374 had bad stains on carpet, really in need of replacement. Toilet plumbed in too close to the wall. TV quality poor with picture colour and sound variable when playing movies and regular TV. High speed internet access (Euros 22/day with movies) is slower than my old dial up. Movie/TV system clunky and painfully slow. It does not have a fast forward/rewind function. The double bed was barely wide enough for us both. Maybe that's why there is an arrow above the headboard to "help" you stay on your own side !!! Housekeeping is variable to say the least. Some days they came, some days they didn't seem to bother unless you called them. Summary Well I really like Amsterdam, but when it rains and it's cold I tend to spend more time in the room. It's a shame my room was in the Eden Rembrandt. Tip If you do come here ask for a top floor (5th) room. On the 3rd floor the tram noise is still intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underperforming”
Reviews.Author: pH14
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic view from the window of our "executive" room. But...no working ventilation in bathroom (were told it could be looked at 2 days later); 15' waiting queue at checkout (for 3 people in front of us); one choice of breakfast (17 â‚¬ self service); magnetic card keys mostly not working and requiring "remagnetising".

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlliB23
Reviews.Content: Have visited this beautiful city many times and always stay in a 4 star large hotel. We were apprehensive before our stay as we had read some concerning reviews about this hotel (bad ones always stand out!) Firstly the location is perfect for visiting many tourist spots and you can walk everywhere. There are some lovely bars nearby and canal walks, restaurants and the lively Rembrandt square is on your doorstep(as the name suggests) dam square is 5-10 mins walk away too. If you are not to keen on walking everywhere there is a tram stop very near the hotel. The hotel is large and does everything in my opinion you need hotel on a city break to do....... Receptionists we met were helpful and friendly. We had a problem with our first room and we were changed immediately and upgraded foc so I can't really complain! The hotel has a lovely bar called the piano bar which is really nice to relax in at the end of the night. Our room was large clean and really modern and the bed was nice and comfortable. The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom doors which were frosted glass- I prefer a little bit more privacy! All in all the most important thing I think on a city break is that you have a hotel in a great location, clean room and a good shower oh and friendly helpful staff and this hotel ticks all those boxes........ Would I stay here again- possibly. Would I recommend it- definitely!

Reviews.Title: “V.Good Amsterdam hotel, with excellent service from staff.”
Reviews.Author: LondonPippo
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler returning to a city, it is always nice to have previous years good impressions beaten by a better stay. The Eden Rebrandt square hotel while not been brand new, (your in an old city!) has been refitted to a high quality, all the public areas are well looked after with a very good selection of bars and restaurant. I'm not quite sure on the over all styling of the rooms with arrows and all, but the bathroom was very well laid out, functional and felt very clean. In a service industry the most pleasing aspect of the hotel was the excellent standard of service provide by ALL the staff, I only wish people could be taught this level of courteous behavior. Negatives, Again your in Amsterdam, the tram line on the front, or is it the back could either keep earlier to bed sleep, or late to rise customers awake, (again your in Amsterdam!) the water systems when the showers are used, can cause enough noise to wake a light sleeper!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Eden Rembrandt Hotel, Amsterdam, The Netherlands”
Reviews.Author: keppat
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in the center of town, close to restaurants and public transportation. The hotel food was a little expensive, but it s nice and clean if a little bit drab. We stayed two days waitning to get on our cruise that left from Amsterdam. We were satisfied with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Classy Clean and Great location”
Reviews.Author: FireKat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent and we'd definately stay here again when we travel to Amsterdam. The value was really good for the clean, quiet room with super COMFY beds and a beautiful bathroom. We stayed in 3 different rooms at this hotel in August, each time the room was quite different. One room had a shower that was glass on the other side so you could see the person showering from the bed. Very sexy to watch your partner, but I couldn't imagine what it would have been like if I was there with my family... lol. However the other 2 rooms had a private shower. Once we got lucky with a really big room with a HUGE bathroom. I was so impressed I took some photos (attached). I think it just depends on your luck, as the 3rd room was quite small, but we didn't need a big room, just something quiet, clean and comfy. This hotel was perfect. It was also nice being so close to Rembrandt Square, with live music and lots of places to sit. In the morning we'd go to Albert Hein, and the nearby cheese shop to pick up some breakfast to go and eat it in the park. We didn't pay for the hotel breakfast as there are a lot of restaraunts around the square and it's pretty easy to find food around there. It's also easy to get to from the train station by taking the number 9 bus. I wouldn't attempt walking it again with heavy bags, though. Hmm.. one other thing is that if you can climb stairs, I'd recommend the tour of the Westerkerk Tower- great views from up there! Well I hope you have a great time in Amsterdam, and I hope this review was helpful to you:)

Reviews.Title: “Correct place, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: HengDoheem
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with reasonable price. Breakfast is too expensive (17,50â‚¬). Single rooms are small but well furnished and nice bathrooms (also rather small in the single room). But very good place to stay close to all attractions, lots of pubs and restaurants within short walking distance,parking in the area is expensive. We use this hotel regularely for business stays

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY. DIRTY, OVERRATED AND OVERPRICED”
Reviews.Author: HH83
Reviews.Content: Dirty, overrated and overpriced hotel. Avoid it. Not convinced? Read the rest. We are not people that just loves to complain. This is the first time that we have experienced anything like this! And we have been in hotels all over Europe. And the first time we actually complained in a hotel. We got a room with a dirty bathroom at check in. Water stains and pubic hair in the bathtub and around the toilet. Dirt and stains on the floor. We complained, and a person came with a bucket of soap water, and cleaned the bathroom when we were in the room. WHAT REALLY SHOCKED US, IS THAT HE USED THE SAME WASH CLOTH TO CLEAN THE BATHTUB, TOILET, SINK AND FLOOR!! Disgusting! We confronted him with this, but he did not understand English. Later that night, we found toothpaste residue in the toothbrush glass in the bathroom and water stripes on them. Cups and spoons had water stripes, clearly indicating that they clean it with at wet cloth... The same wash cloth as they clean the floor, sink and toilet with?? They don't bother change the cups and glasses when new guest arrive. Also really disgusting! We got some tea spots on the floor on the bathroom the first day when we threw the used teabag. Those visible spots stayed there for 4 nights, after showing the spots to the cleaning supervisor several times. Indicating that they don't bother clean the floor properly at all. Complaining every day is not funny, and ruins some of the vacation. And it drains you for energy. Pre paid room is not a good idea here, then they don't care at all. They did try to compensate, by giving us free breakfast the last two days. The only stupid is, that they tried to charge us this breakfast at check out. But too be nice they said, they gave us the "free" breakfast for free once more. Thats just annoying! The managment dont bother to give us a reply after sending them an e- mail. When you experience a hotel stay like this, then the dust all over the room, the holes in the pillow linen and towels also is noticeable. Amsterdam is full of nice and clean hotels. This is not one of them. Do your self a favor, stay another place! It is vacation after all :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SunSpangles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big surprise - we weren't expecting much but when we got in the room it was amazing! And the BED! It was the best bed I've ever slept in. Ideal location. Ignore bad reviews, it's fantastic and we are definitely going again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Delightful Staff !”
Reviews.Author: beckaj01
Reviews.Content: Having only 2 1/2 days in Amsterdam before our cruise, we wanted a Central City location. The Eden Rembrant met that guideline & much more. While the hotel was not a beautiful place, it was very clean & the staff was kind & helpful. The location was perfect for us situated just on a canal in central Amsterdam so walking to shops & sights was easy. Also within a block or so the canal tour boats were located for easy accesss. All in all, I would stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, bad service...and no WIFI in room!”
Reviews.Author: Medinski
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is ok, but why stay at a ok hotel when there are so many other to choose from? What we didn't like: 1. We arrived at the hotel at 19:00, just to find out that our junior suite wasn't ready yet. So we waited. No excuse from the reception. 2. Shelves in room dusty 3. When we used the in-room NEspresso machine, houskeeping didn't refill the capsules. 4. Housekeeping did only a minimum in the room. Thrash wasn't removed if it wasn't in the thrashcan...I mean, leaftovers on the table won't be eaten after two days!!! Cofee cups weren't changed. 5. It was Canal Pride and when we tried to enter our hotel on Saturday afternoon, the bellman rudly said the hotel was only for guests. He could have asked if we were guests. 5. We found something looking like lice in the room. What we liked: 1. The shower. Summary, we paid for an expensive room, and got crap.

Reviews.Title: “We think this is a Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsclarnet
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times now and am just about to book my fifth. This hotel is located close to all ammenities right on Rembrandt Square,however this hotel has two sides to it do not get them muddled up because the other side has a lower rating and is not supposed to be as nice.I used to stay at the Barbizon Hotel near Centraal Station which is a beautiful hotel with a beautiful price ,but after being unable to get a reservation one time a friend of mine that works for Business Hotel Service International suggested The Rembrandt Square Hotel since then i have never looked anywhere else this is a modern ,clean and inexpensive hotel great for city breaks

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wholenewworld
Reviews.Content: Superb Hotel, fab position and outstanding staff 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great venue, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Umbrafurtin
Reviews.Content: Was concerned about our visit given some of the previous reviews however was not let down. Room 485 fantastic, large and quiet, well serviced, spotlessly clean. Reception were good and friendly. Location dead centre of where you want to be - ten minutes walk to everywhere important for tourist. Will definetly book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good room”
Reviews.Author: Lesleycm
Reviews.Content: Our weekend to amsterdam was booked last minute (and a surprise for me) so we were a little concerned to say the least about some of the reviews. However our experience was of a lovely room A centrally based hotel so great for walking anywhere. Comfortable bed clean spacious bathroom tv with British channels (handy as it poured down one day!!) all in all I couldn't fault it and would stay there again. The area around the hotel is lively and for the youngsters but we didn't experience noise and as I said centrally based for heading out to different places

Reviews.Title: “nasty receptionist”
Reviews.Author: bzhang
Reviews.Content: the room was very small, but that's not the biggest problem -- the receptionists were. the wifi at the lobby was very slow and the receptionists didnt even know how guests can log on (user name, password and patience required). but the worst was a french-speaking tall male receptionist who was extremely rude and made it very clear that he didnt like being asked about how to connect to the internet. he made condescending remarks in french about american tourists (and i'm not even american!). the carpet is filthy and so is the hotel's surroundings -- noisy, crowded, and the street is disgusting after rain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: madsiluk
Reviews.Content: For the money we paid for a 4 star hotel we are not satisfied. The air conditioned was broken and there was no attempt by staff to even offer an alternative. They didn't even have the courtesy to let us know that the air conditioning on the floor was broken when we checked in. Did they think we wouldnt notice??! Once we brought it to their attention, they simply gave us a small and ineffective fan. A very uncomfortable stay in summer and only the beautiful city of Amsterdam saved our holiday from being miserable. I will not be recommending this hotel to my friends or business colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “No way this is more than a 2.5-3 star hotel, MAX!”
Reviews.Author: JShooman
Reviews.Content: I rolled the dice on this hotel, and I lost. I read all the poor reviews, and read on many different sites. My husband and I have been to Amsterdam before and so we knew the area we wanted to stay. The Eden fit the location and seemed to be in the mixed review category. I used credit card points for the hotel and since I did not have many options, I gave the Eden a try. First, we were told when we checked into the hotel that the only room available was two twin beds pushed together. The beds constantly moved and even swallowed my camera, after a frantic search, separating the beds made the camera drop to the ground. The dirty stained ground. The carpet was filthy, not just dirty, we are talking filthy! And there was NOTHING in the room. No pen, no paper, not even a "do not disturb sign". Every morning I was forced to call the desk and request no service for the day. On our last day the staff ignored our wishes and came into our room (luckily we use the safe, but what if we hadn't?) and made the bed. They did not pick up towels off the floor, or replenish them for that matter (which they were supposed to hang on the door). They did not do anything but break my privacy so they could make the bed. The desk had the note in the system and no explanation why the staff ignored the request. The thing none of the reviews mentioned was the club located right outside my window. I have lived in NYC and have never been bothered by noise, but this was LOUD!!! It lasted until 3-4am on Saturday. The icing on the cake were the soap/shampoo dispensers, as in public bathroom plastic soap dispensers in the rooms. The fact that a 4 star hotel would dare to put dispensers in the rooms is offensive enough, but then to add insult the one in our room was broken and we could barely get anything out of the dispenser before the front would fall off. Do not stay here! The staff ignore your requests. The rooms are filthy. The only redeeming factor is the location. But there is no way anyone would consider this anything but a 21/2-3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was that human excrement in my carpet”
Reviews.Author: grawar10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 1-8 July 2011. I stayed on the first floor (if I remember it was 177 or 107. I'm not sure. This hotel wasn't bad on paper, but the experience was anything but glossy. Firstly I was given an accessible room (for a disabled person). I did not request this and I was not warned at the time of check-in. I found the disabled customisation of the room rather offensive. Moreover, the carpet was a damn fool mess. What looked like smudged chocolate and chocolate sauce imbued the carpet throughout the room. I dared not walk bare feet. In parts the filth had caked and cracked away from the carpet itself. I reported this to the receptionist, who told me that they were aware of the state of the carpet. In my opinion, that room was not ready for occupancy by a guest. They did not offer an alternative room. I am sure that some manager will reply on tripadvisor to apologise, like these managers tend to do. I feel that the duty of the manager is to resolve these issues by taking the appropriate action whilst the guest is occupying the room, rather than constantly expressing remorse publicly. The only endpoint on which judgment should be passed is that the guest stayed in that accessible, filthy room and nothing was done about it. In Wales we say: 'Dylent i fod Ã¢ chywilydd.' Germans would call this quite frankly 'unverschemt.'

Reviews.Title: “Good location;nice, confortable rooms,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mihaela11
Reviews.Content: Our agent in Jordan booked us a room at this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of rooms and services. The location is near Rembrandtplein; we got a room on the 5th floor overlooking the city and the Opera house. The room was very nice and clean, with elevated bed and confortable pillows, flat tv,tea and coffee making facilities, minibar,safe, internet( free),modern bath with shower .In the hall there is an icemaker. You can also use the computer in the lobby, but practically there are so many things to do in Amsterdam that you don't have much time to spend in internet. Around the corner there is the famous Amsterdam's Ice Bar; also in Rembrandtplein there are many restaurants, coffee shops,souvenirs shops, cheeseshops, supermarkets,casinos,cinema,tram station... All atractions are within walking distance from the hotel. The breakfast buffet is well assorted and nicelly decorated. The staff at the reception and concierge are very nice and helpful; the safe in the room had no english explanation how to use it and immediatelly the reception sent someone to help us. All the room are non-smoking. We had a great time in Amsterdam and we enjoyed our stay at Eden Rembrandt Square hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conference and Family Trip, Comfortable and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: siven
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Apartments 892 and 893. Just outside the main hotel. 2 rooms, separate toilet and shower. Small balcony / terrace to wash and dry your clothes. I Double bed in master room and a pull out sofa bed in the other room which doubles up as living room / Kitchenette. Convenient access to Albert Heijn Supermarket close by to get simple supplies. Bedding and linen clean. Bathroom / Toilet very clean. Carpets old and can do with a spring clean. Beautiful view of the canal and the boats. Quiet enough. Sleeping no problems after tiring walks around the city. House Keeping good. 512Kb wired ethernet internet free. Wireless free in the hotel lobby. Hotel concierge helpful. Outstanding reception staff. Elvira helped us after a long long flight to Amsterdam. Arrived early hours of the morning and we had checked in 1 room the night before by phone. She was very courteous and very very helpful. Reception made up for any other shortcomings. Apartments are separate from the main hotel entrance and had a steep staircase to negotiate with luggage. No elevators. Plenty of nearby restaurants of all flavours. Tram stop handy and canal boats nearby. 15min stroll to Central station and everything in between easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Wheelchair accessable Hotel near the "Action"”
Reviews.Author: Bubber8
Reviews.Content: We found our room the be of nice size and bothe the room and bath were easy to navigate in a wheelchair. The beds were compfortable and the room were nicely appointed. The staff was most helpful with directions and other touristy information. The food in the restaurant's food was quite good with a nice selection. We would recommend the Eden Rembrandt Square as our stay was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: nettyspaghetti
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this hotel was truly worth every penny! Staff were super friendly, we weren't supposed to check in until 2pm but we stolled on down at about 1:15pm just to check whether our room might have been ready and the chap on reception was so polite and helpful. When we got to our room, we couldn't believe how amazing it was!! I have never stayed in a place like it, gorgeous power shower, self -demisting mirror in there too. Stay away from the mini bar though...unless you are rich and super lazy lol. It is a bit noisy at night but to be honest we were either too drunk or too stoned and went straight to sleep anyways haha...we ended up having a twin room with the two beds pushed together...only became a problem if you were hoping to have sex :-D It is in a perfect location to just sit inbfront of a bar in Rembrandt Square and watch the world go by. Truly beautiful place and the people are so friendly! We got a train from Schipol Airport then justr walked down at our leisure...it is an easy enough walk down to the hotel but we did only have a handluggage case each and were in no particular rush. Gives you a chance to take it all in :-) All in all...fab hotel, fab city and fab people...didnt want to come home! xx

Reviews.Title: “not even close to 2 stars.....”
Reviews.Author: davinadrianne
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the entrance of the hotel, we noticed it was rated as 4 stars. Not even close. We had luggages and boxes (as we were on a conference as well). There was no porter to assist us and we had to single handedly place all our items on a larger trolley and push it all the way to the luggage store room (as our room was not ready). When the room was ready, we also had to bring our luggage to the rooms ourselves. First impression of the room: Bad. There were stains on the carpet (quality of a 4 star hotel?). The air conditioner thermosat could not be adjusted. There was only 1 set of towels and also no rug for the toilet floor. We called reception and they asked us to check all the cupboards to see if the extra set of towels are there, before agreeing to send an extra set to us. (we checked and there truly was only 1 set of towels). The bed was very soft and there is only 1 pillow for each of us. Which provided no neck support at all. At night, we can hear the next room showering (water running very loudly) and we are fairly light sleepers. The hotel does not practice what they preach in terms of being eco-friendly. They changed our towels daily despite us hanging the towels on the rack to indicate that we do not need it changed. The last straw for us came on the 2nd last day when we enquired about payment of the hotel bill. Our bill would amount to 800++ euros and we were allowed to pay in cash. However to our horror, the hotel says they cannot accept 500 euros note.....no reason given. The receptionist did try to provide a solution by asking us to change smaller notes at the bank. However, the bank charges a 1% commission for every transaction. Why can't the hotel accept our note, when they have a fraud machine to check the validity of the notes? This display of service is totally unacceptable and is not in the tourists best interest. Very disappointing. the only saving grace of the hotel is the location. it is a 5-10mins walk to dam square. fairly convenient. For the amount eden charges, dont even consider.

Reviews.Title: “Room too hot, asked for aircon to be fixed twice-nothing done about it.”
Reviews.Author: TheFergiesOnHols
Reviews.Content: Walked into room. Far too hot. Aircon broken. Asked immediately for it to be fixed. Nothing happened. Asked again that night. Nothing. Mentioned again at check out and got an apology. Not good enough for 150 a night. Sadly even though location is great it did frustate us. Anyway had a good weekend but got to be honest about that ba service that let this place down

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: joanne112564
Reviews.Content: We just stayed overnight at this hotel. This hotel has very modern amenities with rooms that are bigger than normal in Europe. My daughter and I were very comfortable in the room. It was easy to find and very accessible to Tram 9 - probably just a minute away from the tram stop. The hotel is located in Rembrandtplein and has all sorts of restaurants in very close proximity. Would stay at this hotel again next time we visit Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “The concierge was nasty to work with”
Reviews.Author: BobnCindi
Reviews.Content: On Monday June 13 my wife and I stopped the concierge to ask for help to find a canal boat trip. He basically blew us off telling us to leave the hotel and go right.a few hundred meters. Of course, there is not a canal boat statiion there. We walked around for a while and came back to the hotel. I asked a guy at the desk about finding a canal boat ride and he suggested asking the concierge. I told him of our issues with him and he looked at me and said "What do you want me to do? Do you want me to talk to him? Again not the best service in the world. I would not recommend your hotel to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Three nights of interrupted sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: lougoodwin
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam around midnight due to plane delays and we had reservations at the Hotel Eden in Rembrandt Square. The lobby definitely is tired, but the restaurant stayed open for us so we could have a little snack prior to heading to bed which was very nice of them. The room itself was modern and spacious - the carpets need cleaning. However, at 3 in the morning for the next 3 nights we were awakened by hooting and hollering from people pouring out of night clubs and bars as well as horns honking in the streets.. It went on for about 2 hours each and every night much to our chagrin. At first we thought our windows were open, but it appears that it has single paned glass. When we asked to move, they said the noise was bad everywhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Radubradu
Reviews.Content: Even I am a trequent visitor in Amsterdam, this was my first time in Eden Rembrandt hotel. However, I am sure it vwas not the last one! It was a very pleasant lexperience: excellent location, excellent service, good fish restaurant. My only critique: a too repetitive breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - trouble is they stole form me!”
Reviews.Author: KickassJen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful, clean and staff are very friendly. There is a lovely bar area and the rooms are decorated well with a modern feel to them. The beds were very soft as were the pillows - had wonderful nights sleep. I thought all had gone really well and was looking forward to leaving a positve review. HOWEVER they asked for my card details to put against my room incase I wanted to put drinks on the room etc. They said this was a must. When i checked out they told me everything was settled as I had pre paid ( we didnt put anything on the room so we knew we wouldnt owe them anything) They charged us city tax of 20 euro's - never heard of this but we paid it in cash. I got back to the UK and found they had taken Â£49 out of my account without my authorisation and for no known reason. They refuse to speak to me about this and I have had to ask my bank to try and get the money back for me so BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: TheJKsofManchester
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good location. We arrived as a party of four couples, having walked from Centraal Station (it's only about a mile away), at about 11:00. The reception staff were very efficient, helpful and friendly and allowed us to leave our bags until the rooms were ready at 15:00. Inside, the hotel was clean and pretty well decorated. The air-conditioned rooms were very nice and the beds (two singles pushed together) were very comfortable. One night was a little noisy, so all we did was close the window! The only comment I would make is that the coffee/tea were not replenished on the second day, which you usually get, but not a problem for us. There's a nice piano bar in the hotel as well as the main bar, neither of which were overly expensive. The continental breakfast was good, and included bacon, scrambled and boiled eggs. The restaurant can get a bit busy though at peak time, but you can go anytime between 07:00 and 11:00 at weekends. The location was really good, within easy reach of shops, markets, bars, trams etc. Would I stay there again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic stay great 4* hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: Brockham
Reviews.Content: Husband and I had great romantic 3 day stay in this hotel, which we found to be fantastic. The hotel was kind enough to upgrade us to an executive room as it was my birthday. Room was amazing couldn't fault it. Loved the hotel bar lovely large quiet area to chill out after walking around all day. Free wi fi in hotel bar as well as use of computers. The hotel was in a fantastic position next to great bars and restaurants. RECOMMEND this 4*Hotel to everyone. Great art deco restaurant 1 min away - L'Opera loved the stair case!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, comfortable and conveniently central”
Reviews.Author: MonoUK
Reviews.Content: The service was a little brusque upon arrival and the concierge never seemed to be available for the luggage room but these were the only two minor downsides on a very pleasant stay. Possibly the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept upon and a room that was absolutely silent even wit the window open. Delightful shower and a very pleasant modern decor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: anneca7
Reviews.Content: Our room was quiet, cool and dark at the back of the hotel.We slept very well each night. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and more bathroom supplies than we could use. The staff were friendly, helpful and always ready to be of assistance. The double bed was huge and very comfortable. I have no complaints. Having read previous reviews, after booking, I was very anxious. I should not have watsed my time and energy. Someone once said you can't please all the people all of the time- True. It is close to all amenities, without being overwhelmingly touristy, and is a 20 minute walk from Centraal Station. I plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: one_knee
Reviews.Content: First the negatives, the room was a little dark because of the small window that looked over the hotel next to us and the double bed was two singles pushed together. The positive, the location is amazing with most of the major attractions within walking distance. The rooms and modern and spacious with a really good bathroom. The staff are friendly and helpful. We never tried the breakfast, favoring a coffee shop 10 meters down the road. If I was to visit Amsterdam again I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: RamiIsrael
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in a perfect spot, the room is big with good bathroom. you also get free internet getaway. don't eat breakfast there, it's crowd & noisy, you will find a lot of choices for breakfast around Rembrandt Plein. The cleaning service is awful, we stayed for 7 nights - each day there was a problem with the towels and you would expect from 4 star hotel to fill your shampoo & soap witch was never done! It's OK but not a great value for money

Reviews.Title: “big room, dark, noisy, terrible outlook”
Reviews.Author: DA_Wanderlust
Reviews.Content: Nice big room, especially by European standards, with a clean modern finish. But the window was a tiny little thing in the corner with bars across it looking over a pile of discarded cigarettes. Not quite what they show in the pictures! It was also incredibly noisy, the room shakes from either the trams or metro, I don't know what and you can absolutely hear everything that's going on as people thunder by on the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Not typical Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegAndrea
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find in Amsterdam. Has a very nice boutique hotel feel too it. An extremely large lobby area connecting two hotels, a restaurant and a lounge. Rooms were very chic and looked new. Nice bathroom with lots of shelving space, Complimentary Rituals products! Beautiful shower with wand and rain showerhead. Beware - frosted glass on both sides (to toilet and bed) which is open on top. Looks great, but could be uncomfortable if sharing the room with someone who you have yet to share the bathroom with! The only fault I found was that the carpet was badly stained in several areas. Location is on the far end of Rembrandt Square. Has the potential to be loud at night as there are many nightclubs in the area, but on Sunday night I had no complaints. Hotel was a little far from the shopping strip. Easy to get there, but not exactly convenient for bag drops. Very close to tram stop though. Coffee and snack bars surround the square, and a Wagamama is opening across the street. Many dining options in and around the square.

Reviews.Title: “great location, free use of pc's with internet for guests, large room”
Reviews.Author: erlac
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam for 4 nights with my partner. Great Location - 25 mins to Anne Frank house, 15mins to Van Gough museum Large Room (by Amsterdam Standards) Free use of many PC's in the bar/reception areas - this is a big plus for me. We didnt eat in hotel but we did have tea's and coffee's in the bar - nice area to relax. Only negative was the bedroom carpet - the room was very clean but there were stains on the carpet, it really needed to be changed - however that is my only negative comment. Would definately stay there again. Also if you're going to Amsterdam go to the Jordann - really nice area, lots to do, not commercial, way nicer and funkier than e.g. Dam square, lots of vintage shops

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not very clean”
Reviews.Author: oversees
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Rembrandt Square for 3 nights. It had mixed reviews, but a fantastic location so we decided to give it a go. Firstly the location is perfect. We walked everywhere and there was really no need for us to use the public transport system (but if you did there is a tram and metro station in the area). It's just off Rembrandt Sq but becuase it's down a side street, you get none of the noise from the square. I often think on this site that people complain about many things that really, aren't deal breakers but for me a clean hotel is an absolute - whether it's a 1 or 5 star hotel. In this respect, this hotel falls way below the standard. On arrival, our room had been made up but there was dirt on the duvet cover - I assume that someone had been standing on it. A pair of the last guests socks were under the bed and remained there for the duration of our stay and a pen on the bathroom floor that also never moved in 3 days. Our room was serviced each day but on the first night we made tea and the used cups were not removed, nor were the tea and sugar replaced. Also in the hall ways were dirty, probably from not being vaccuumed very often. The staff were very friendly and helpful, except for 1 lady who we dealt with on check out (I presume it's the same person that everyone is talking about in this thread). Also, breakfast was delicious with lots of variety and very fresh. I'm not sure how this place got a 4 star rating. It doesn't feel like a hotel of that standard and we've stayed in much better hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lim0r
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night only but it was a good stay. nice, clean, very nice staff and very central location. would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jimmythegiant
Reviews.Content: All of the staff were great - very polite, friendly and always happy to help. The location was fantastic, rembrandt plein is 50 yards away with trams links and restaurants. The flower market is a 5 minute walk and all of the major attractions are within a 10 minute tram ride. The bathroom in the room was excellent, very clean and we were impressed with the room - the bed was comfy and a real savour having walked our socks off everyday! They allowed us to check in early on the day of arrival which was a real bonus and we couldn't hear other people staying in the hotel. The only problem was the noise coming from the street outside the hotel. Trams run quite late into the evening and are noisy so can keep you awake if you want an early night and several nights we were woken by rowdy people around the rembrandt square area in the early hours of the morning. That aside the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “rude unhelpful receptionist”
Reviews.Author: pukkka
Reviews.Content: i stayed here a few years ago and thought it was lovely so decided to return this year with my daughter and friends. On arriving the rude woman on reception took one look down her nose at our group and informed us that they wanted a deposit of 450 euros for our stay! We were prepared for city tax but nowhere in the booking could we remember it mentioning a 50 euro per room per night deposit! With city tax it was 500 euro they wanted off us on top of the 800 euro we had already paid to stay there! As the rooms were no cancellation we had to stay there and the horrible woman decided she would accept 300 euro. The group i was staying with are young people who saved hard to afford this trip and if they had paid this deposit they would have sat in the hotel day and night as they couldnt afford to do anything else!Fortunately i was able to pay it or we would have been staying in the cheapest hotel we could afford while our paid rooms went empty because we couldnt pay an unreasonable deposit. Ill be writing to the hotel to complain about the woman, her predjudice behaviour and the fact that we witnessed several people check in after us and no deposit was mentioned! Just be warned if you're staying at this hotel be prepared to be judged and discriminated against! Needless to say we wont be returning to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not very clean.”
Reviews.Author: alice133
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and great location. Big bedroom but didn't feel particularly clean. Certainly not hoovered during three night stay and the carpet was badly stained in places. Bathroon however was spacious and clean. Dismayed to see a mouse scurrying towards breakfast buffet on last day! When mentioned to staff, they reported they have alot of mice in Amsterdam! I am sure this is true but you wouldn't expect to share your breakfast with one in a four star hotel.Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service BADLY lacking”
Reviews.Author: EricOcean188590
Reviews.Content: 1st off, the Reservations dept. didn't read / process our E-mails correctly, causing the reception te be confused on checkin. Next, they didn't take our bags from us, we had to bring them to storage ourselves. After waiting for far to long for someone to let us in, He wanted to help the people who had just arrived, instead of us who had been waiting. Long lines in general, with a lot of people seeming to walk around instead of helping. The toilet paper hadn't been restocked. The coffee cupt for the nespresso maker hadn't been correctly restocked. The shower flooded the bathroom. Despite having booked a suite, there were no bathrobes or slippers, we had to make do with two measly small towels. They had problems keeping the breakfast replenished and tables cleared.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moody2blue
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the other reviews that say this is a basic hotel, it certainly isn't. It's a 4 star in my book, the rooms were excellent and very modern... all you'd expect from this type of hotel and price. The location is really good too, perfectly placed to get around and do your sightseeing and nightlife. The only negative was that we didn't get a proper double bed, it was 2 singles together.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel in Vibrant part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AFR_999
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfectly placed for both travel and entertainment on the edge of Rembrandt Square. It is within very easy walking distance to everywhere in Central Amsterdam, but sufficiently on the edge for it to be quiet at night. It has a first class seafood Bistro if you wish to eat in. It's main clientele are business and corporate, which should tell you a lot about the overall quality and respect this hotel has. This has been my hotel of choice, even when travelling privately to Amsterdam with family.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: amyp123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with a friend. The location is very good-right on Rembrandt Square. Lots of bars, restuarants and coffee shops within a 3 minute walk, and Dam Square was about a 10 minute walk. Firstly, the lady on check in was just rude, and not helpful at all. The room was tiny, and overlooked a side street. The bathroom was also tiny, with no amenities apart from soap. The beds, however, were the most comfy i have ever slept in. BUT, the room was soooooooo noisy. Walls were paper thin, and we could hear noise all night. The hotel has a nice bar area for evening drinks. Breakfast was very good. Nice selection of pastries, cheeses, hams and a good cooked selection. Overall, an adequate hotel, but I personally wouldnt go back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Simmo169
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Feb 11-13th..for the money its very difficult to knock. The rooms are modern and clean (there are some stains on the carpet but nothing much) The service was very good thou drinks at the hotel bar a little pricey. Location wise brill..no.9 tram from Central Station and you are at the hotel in 5 mins. Dam square about 15 mins walk but loads of place to stop off for a drink on the way. Went to the Little Buddha on Sat night..highly recommended! All round very good

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average customer service”
Reviews.Author: viks23
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent. Its 5 mins from the Waterlooplein metro station and hence easily accessible. Room service was mediocre - the staff came to clean the room once in 3 days in spite of a reminder. Hotel rooms were of good size.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet little hotel close everything”
Reviews.Author: nzdiaspora
Reviews.Content: Location: Next to tram station and centre of town without the centre of town noise (we had a room facing the courtyard) can walk to all amsterdam attractions. Make sure you ask for the hotels city map which is very helpful Room: Modern decor with comfortable bed, weird arrangement of furniture with a desk, lounge chair and coffee table crammed into the middle of the room which left little space for suitcases. Large very nice modern bathroom Service: Very good service great restaurant recommendation from the very very very tall man at reception

Reviews.Title: “Location of hotel was excellent for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: mvdwpdb
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very comfortable, complete and good of size, but: - bed (mattress) was to soft (not so good for back) - Warm during the night (heating was not turned on by us, but still it was warm, and very dry (it should be more ventilated -> only way to do this, is by sleeping with an open window, but then it could become noisy) - Enough basic channels on tv, but no flemish ones. I find this very strange. In Belgium you will find dutch channels in most 4-5 start hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Trevor1471
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 nights and the hotel was exceptionally clean ,comfortable and in a great location. It is so important to choose a good hotel ..it can make or break your visit ...Definetely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Suzi650
Reviews.Content: I was well impressed with the Eden Rembrandt Hotel. We got a great price on the rooms and out of 18 of us, not one person complained about their room or the location. It is situation near Rembrandt's House and the Flower Market and is only a few minutes on the tram to the centre of Amsterdam. I liked the way it was off the beaten track and not right in the centre. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful with maps etc. The only downfall is the excrutiating bar prices but there's so many other places to drink in that it's not a big issue. I am extremely fussy when it comes to cleanliness and the rooms were spotless although a double room was two beds pushed together which can prove dangerious as one of our group did fall through the middle! :D All in all a great hotel and great staff. We didn't eat breakfast there as it was â‚¬17.50 per person but there are loads of places to eat breakfast especially the Turkish cafe just down the road and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Took the trouble to make our stay extra-special”
Reviews.Author: laurasplog
Reviews.Content: On booking with this hotel, I said it was my partner's birthday and anything they could do to make it extra-special would be appreciated. When we arrived, we found they'd upgraded us to a Junior Suite, which was lovely, and also given us vouchers for two free drinks at their bar. Staff were very helpful when we needed guidance with how to use some features of the room (though a manual explaining how to operate the TV, heating etc. would have been appreciated and would have negated the need to contact staff). The hotel was about a mile's walk from Centraal Station, and if you don't fancy the walk, there are trams readily available. The room was beautifully designed with a Nespresso machine and a lovely big bath... in fact it was so cold outside, we definitely made the most of the facilities at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with 2 star service”
Reviews.Author: Agoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on good reviews bout the room. The room was clean, I'll give it credit. But few issues, firstly it's noisy. Each night I can hear the people partying late into the night outside. Secondly someone tried to get into my room twice, once successfully but luckily I was in, so nothing happened! Lastly, they hv this sensor for the stuff in the minibar in the room. Slightest movement of the pringles or nuts will render an additional â‚¬10 charge minimum! Because theres a charge of 5% of ur room rates on top of the price for the packet of nuts! So if it says â‚¬2.50 for the nuts expect to pay additional â‚¬10!! so key note is NEVER TOUCH THE STUFF! when i was dismay by the surprised city tax the receptionist was less than helpful n in fact borderline annoying or rude! For service, I'd say poor, giving it a little credit for the helpful concierge for helping with our luggage storage. The price of â‚¬100 per night for double bedroom is not worth the money. Got a much better hotel in the Hague with free Internet! Yes this hotel DOES NOT provide FREE Internet

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Issues”
Reviews.Author: MarkWijman
Reviews.Content: Arriving around 6PM - speedy check-in, going up to your room finding the hallway completly full with garbage bags and other housekeeping "stuff" (blocking your room door) - having to move those garbage bags... Not a very nice welcome. Checking the room and finding that the bathroom has not been cleaned properly: unacceptable. Reporting both at the front desk, staff response - "well we need to clean the rooms sir" - yeah but that much stuff at 6PM? and not very good in cleaning.... No excsuses are offered, but the receptionist gives me a new room key and a "nod" - what is this? I ask "I give you another room, this one is a little bigger as well"... Things like this could be handeled so much better... Rooms are nicely appointed and over good sleep quality. Location is right in the middle of the old city center. Breakfast for â‚¬17,- is also on the high side considering the location and the many options around the hotel - continue this and you can close your buffet very soon. Very good food at Restaurant Flo next door, BTW. Upon check-out another little surprise where I was told to pay city tax (the reservation online mentioned this was included in the rate) - but I was told this was wrong and needed to pay anyway. Upon contacting the hotel about this one day later, I was told to receive a response: yet this is still to arrive (two weeks). Overall: probably better places in the city, definately with better staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for your short break to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: thebackpacker12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, easy to get to (about 15 minute walk from central station) and right in the corner of Remembrandt Square. The rooms were clean with a modern design, very nice bathroom too! The reception staff were helpful, and you have access to the internet on 5 computers although on some the connection is slow. If I was to go back to Amsterdam I would stay nearer to Dam Square as I think this is more central to most things (night life, red light district, train station, slightly nearer most attractions too including Ann Frank's house). Cafes are all over the city so it doesn't matter about them, there are many within walking distance wherever you are.

Reviews.Title: “Have seen cleaner rooms in a hostel , I'm actually writing this review in my room as I can't warn Travellers quick enough , see”
Reviews.Author: Sabresharp
Reviews.Content: Please look at the photos of the dirty ro floors you can expect, between myself a friend we have had 4 different rooms in 2 days, carpets are disgusting in all 4 ,my first room had no heating , and suspicious stains ground into the carpet which looks like it never has seen a Hoover ! You could not walk around bare footed. 1 room u might not think it a general problem but 4!

Reviews.Title: “a very nice and comfortable hotel - Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lisag83
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel with my husband for his 30th Birthday and when we arrived i was very suprised at how nice it looked.. Reception stafff were ok upon checking in and we stayed in thier sistewr hotel Eden Hotel. Room was very smart and we were given a canal view..Shower is great and the bathroom was very nice. I will say their beds were soooo comfy... Had the best night sleep!!! When we arrived back from the hotel the next day after sightseeing the hotel had put a voucher on the bed for my husbands birthday to have two free drinks in the bar at the hotel.. Thought that was very nice... I would certainly recommend this hotel!!!! Concierge was very nice upon leaving, booking us a taxi and helping us with our bags...Dont be put off by other reviews I never noticed nothing what other people were complaining about...Had the best weekend away..Amsterdam is fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Martin the Mouse”
Reviews.Author: colm18
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were told we would be in an 'apartment' and not in the hotel building until normal check in time. When we returned to reception at 3pm as instructed they looked at us like we had 2 heads, saying we had agreed to stay in the apartment for the duration of the stay. This was untrue but we're easygoing so whatever. BIG MISTAKE. The apartment was a nightmare. We felt like the guy living upstairs was in our apartment as his every movment was very loud. The dog in the apartment next door loves barking. Beware of that! But as we were only there for three nights and were doing a decent amount of sightseeing etc we agreed to persevere. That was until a small black furry little creature ran out in front of us after night 2. And after I got him back into his hole he came out again with the boldness of an animal that had definately had previous human interaction. The receptionist reacted with the unsurprised look of someone who had heard this complaint many times and was not only unhelpful but very rude. Only when I stressed my point many times did I get any satisfaction so be ready for an argument with someone who is either stupid or pretending to be so she didnt have to do any work. She said no other rooms would be available until 3pm, and I reasoned with her that the rooms don't automatically self clean at 3pm and that she could call me when the first one was available which she agreed to but obviously didn't do. One other receptionist was nice but the other guy must only be a receptionist in his spare time and a supermodel/billionaire/celebrity the rest of the time as he was so arrogant and ignorant about any small request I had. Don't stay here if you feel your stay SHOULD be appreciated. Don't stay here if you dont like mice. Don't stay here if they try to put you in an apartment. Stay here if location is everything but trust me its not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “YOU CANT KNOCK IT”
Reviews.Author: spursaway
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in 6 hotels in amsterdam over the years,and many hotels/b and b's in England over 20 years working away. i can honestley say this hotel is bang on the money for location and cleanliness.the buffet breakfast was also good.and if you cant sleep because of the noise from the bars outside the FRONT of the hotel,get a room at the BACK.or smokeys coffee shop is underneath the hotel and for Â£10 they will give you some weed that wiil make you sleep like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location...”
Reviews.Author: millenniumperegrine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a chance, got a very decent rate but was uncertain of how high a standard to expect, but ended up delighted at the choice. The location was easy to find on foot from the station, and located in an area close to sites and tourist facilities. Assisted throughout by a very helpful concierge who gave us detailed help on navigating the city. Even though a noisy location, we were not disturbed at all. Left luggage service before check-in and after check-out was complimentary. The rooms were small (but we only wanted it as somewhere to sleep, so not a problem) and the area probably isn't very family-friendly, though great fun otherwise. Only sour note was the necessity of leaving a credit card (which I did not have) as the room deposit, but was swiftly sorted by the management. Overall, a great stay, would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service and dirty room”
Reviews.Author: DohaPetitPrince
Reviews.Content: I did not like the service of the hotel. I found the room outdated with dirty floors. I also found leftovers from the previous guest in the mini bar. I had to asked the front desk to remove it twice. The first time they still left some food in the mini bar and also did not clean it although it was really filthy and sticky. The staff was rude. The location of the hotel is good, centrally located and this is why I choose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne0340
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new: has a nice decor and friendly staff. However, the rooms are tiny ! Now this is quite normal for Amsterdam, but the room I had (double bed) hardly had any space for luggage. Still I recommend this: very central location, yet quiet and extremely comfy beds: good price / quality !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Chonner
Reviews.Content: Based on the previous recommendations, we decided to try this hotel. The location was fantastic, it was very close to a train station and felt like I was in the central part of the city. If we had to, we could've walked to the Central Station (probably .75 miles or so) but the public transportation is easy to follow. We were satisfied with the room. The bathroom was fairly nice and the room was decent, nothing great and nothing horrible. But the customer service was unacceptable. They were NOT welcoming at all and I felt like I had to plead for any type of service. Two examples come to mind: 1. Late Check out by 30 mins: I had to catch a train and wanted to sight see during the morning so I asked for a 30 min late check out the night before. The man at the desk told me it was impossible and they were extremely busy without looking at his computer. I called back the next morning and it wasn't a problem, they had availability and apologized for the night before. It took the same man 15 mins to find fresh towels when they forgot to replace mine during the day. 2. Maps: We asked for only ONE additional map and received attitude from the front desk. It was to the point that we offered to pay for a single map so that we all did not have to share ONE. It wasn't a large request and they had a stack of them available. Overall, it may be worth the stay but if I go back, I'll try another hotel. The location wasn't worth the attitude.
