Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Munkey_Tennis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip. Hotel is nice, rooms clean with a nice modern bathroom. Breakfast is buffet style with wide choice of hot and cold food. Location is great, large number of restaurants and bars nearby so good choice for meals and evenings. I'd recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdamtastic”
Reviews.Author: DanKathyScotland
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, in fantastic location, got train from Schipol to Central station then number 9 tram to Rembrandt square, hotel 100m from tram stop on left hand side. Rooms extremely comfortable and very contemporary, bathroom 5 star. Concierge very helpful with directions. Rembrandt square had a winter wonderland that was beautiful. We shared some mulled wine with our friends at 2am and it was magical. Mini bar very expensive but we took our own and local mini markets secons away. Would definately recommend and return again. Danny & Kathy, Cumbernauld, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rembrandt Square for a 3 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: jimbird
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to book this hotel b/c of some unfavourable reviews on here. Ended up booking it anyways b/c of the location. (was close to the Tushinsky Theatre where I would be attending the film festival) Firstly, yes, the carpets in SOME areas are spotty and stained... Not dirty, stained. I don't care... If you care, and you think a stained carpet will ruin your trip, don't stay here. Secondly, a lot of ppl said that they didn't have anything from the mini bar yet they were charged for things that they never had! (everything from the mini bar is hooked up to a device and basically if you touch it, you buy it) Knowing that before hand, I didn't touch anything, so I wasn't charged for anything. The hotel is in Rembrandt Square which is a fabulous location and we were close to everything. The main room and washroom are very modern looking, we always had lots of towels, and the bed was extremely comfortable! If you can find a good deal for this hotel, I'd say it's worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother looking for another hotel - this ones perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Meregy
Reviews.Content: So let's start from the beginning: The first thing I saw upon arrival was a very easy to find, modern clean lobby with friendly and efficient reception staff who very kindly upgraded my room (for free) from a double room to an executive suite. They will ask for either a credit card number as a security deposit of 50 euros cash. The room was incredible. Very well furnished and finished with complimentary tea, coffee and Nespresso machine. The bathroom was massive and had a very spacious bathtub and shower and even a wall mounted bottle opener! All the fittings were top-notch and it felt we were in a truly 5 star setting. Only a couple of drawbacks - the cleaners tended to only make the bed and not much else i.e the bins weren't always emptied, the mugs and cups weren't always cleaned and the tea and coffee wasn't re-stocked very often. Also rather than having a double bed we had two single pushed together which wasn't ideal but they were still very comfortable and luxurious. Aside from that this place is a dream and brilliant value for the money we payed. I get the feeling that even the double rooms would be to a similar standard to the one I had. Location wise the Eden Rembrandt is a 20 second walk away from Rembrandt Square which hosts a number of vibrant clubs, restaurants and a brilliant coffee shop. It also has a tram stop which gives you very, very easy access to all of Amsterdam with Tram 9 taking you straight to Dam Square and Centraal Station in minutes for next to no money (especially if you get one of the all day tourist passes). This gets you to pretty much anywhere in Amsterdam as most of the tram lines pass through Dam and Centraal. Don't forget the city tax that gets charged at the end of your stay:- it's not much. We got charged just under 20 Euros for three nights stay for two of us All in all a brilliant experience at a great hotel. Would definitely recommend it and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: natters56
Reviews.Content: when we arrived to the Hotel we were so pleased with what we saw, modern upto date hotel and was very clean, with friendly helpful staff to greet you.We checked in but couldnt be in our rooms till 3 but there was a luggage room where we could leave our bags which were securely locked up and with number tags on so bags werent given to wrong people. When we did get into our room we were so happy with the room, it was well above what we expected, clean, lovely big bed and a lovely clean bathroom, also good locking system on the door so you knew your belongings would be safe. We did have to pay a 50 euro deposit by card but was refunded back when we checked out but was given back in cash (euros) there was also a small fee taken out for the 2 nights as well, which is somet we didnt know till we arrived, the minibar in the room is electronic so when you take a somet out it automatically goes onto your bill so be aware as we took all the drinks out and put some beers in the fridge and didnt realise till after that we would have been charged. The hotel is so central to everything, it is defo a place to stay as you dont have to keep paying fares on trams etc. Drink and food can be expensive but if you look around carefully you can find a good cheap pub. I do recommend a noodle bar called Wok and Walk it is so nice and reasonable price too. We went to Anne Frank house too but took us a while to find it as we were walkin round in circles but it was worth seeing. Such beautiful scenery and places to see. We did go red light district which was an eye opener but we spent most of our time round there cause it was a good athmosphere and plenty of bars, we did drink alot in a pub called Exalibur but there is so many to choose from. We will defo go back as there is so much to still see and do. You will enjoy i promise you that :-)

Reviews.Title: “around the corner”
Reviews.Author: dreamsnatcha
Reviews.Content: Stayed a long weekend here..... After such a vast amount of hotels and reviews in the city to be honest i just took a chance. I was impressed with what i found this Hotel was in a great position in the city Trams out front canal boats out back located at Rembrandt Square five mins from Dam Square. The hotel was great value for money yes there is the odd carpet staine and no wifi (wired is available) in rooms but the bathroom, bed and staff were all great and very helpful. Thus I would recommend this hotel and return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: DIY_Dave74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April, and was very impressed, we had actually booked the 3 Star Eden Hotel next door (hotel lobbies are linked and they appear to share reception staff) but upon arrival we got a free upgrade to the 4 Star Eden Rembrant! hotel is in a very central excellent location and within walking distance of everything there is to see.

Reviews.Title: “Awful rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: Totally unimpressed with this hotel. Stained carpets, cobwebs in the corner of the room, uncomfortable beds with insufficiently sized quilts, surly reception staff who did not even enquire as to whether I had a pleasant stay. No Wifi - not just no free wifi but actually no in room Wifi AT ALL. Only positive is the location which was handy for the metro for getting to the office and would be good for tourists also. I wouldn't stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: LeedsKizza
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a two night break, I took my boyfriend as a surprise for his birthday so was hoping it would be good, now there was mixed reviews on trip advisor but i took the risk. It was actually really good, definitely a 4 star. The staff were just great, when we arrived checked us in straight away and because it was my partners birthday they upgraded us to a lovely apartment, 1 out of 4 which are part of the hotel. So we had our own living room, kitchen bedroom and bathroom. This is easy to get to, so great loaction the tram stop is just outside the hotel and because it's in rembrandt square: loads of bars, coffeee shops restaurants. You can't go wrong with this hotel, if I go to amsterdam again I will stay here, Its worth the money .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: planiggy
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, and the staff were really good. I made a mistake by getting a taxi from the train station to hotel which took 5 minutes and cost Â£20. The number 9 tram drops you off right by the hotel so use that. The only downside was that breakfast was very expensove but there are a lot of other food options locally. I noticed one of the other comments said the floors were a bit dirty, I would agree with this but overall the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value”
Reviews.Author: STaylor82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel this past summer for two nights. The room was clean but could have used a little face lift, it appeared there were coffee stains on the walls and floor but other than that the room was just fine. The concierge assisted in arranging a pickup to the airport for the following day. The Rembrandt was connected to the Eden Hotel Amsterdam hotel (pretty sure that was the name of it). We went and watched a few world cup games in the bar of the Eden Amsterdam and despite being next to a few major bars, had no problems falling asleep. Heard the vuvuzelas of course but we were beat from walking around the city the whole day it didn't take long to fall asleep. There isn't much the hotel can do about that anyways. The location was great and easy to get to the city center, we only took transportation to and from the airport. The Rembrandt had a public computer in the reception area that appeared to be on a dial-up connection and took forever to load just a simple email. The bar at the connected Eden had four or five more computers which were either frozen or used carrier pigeons to send the data packets when they worked. I needed to access it only to confirm my flight was still on time etc and it took probably 5 minutes rather than 30 seconds. Considering the cost of the room (fairly cheap) its a great value for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Eden Rembrandt”
Reviews.Author: FirstCoastTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have been at the Eden Rembrandt for four days, and it has been an excellent choice. The rooms are contemporary...comfortable beds with nice linens..very friendly and responsive staff. We would gladly stay here again when we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: KegsyCheshire
Reviews.Content: We have visited Amsterdam 3 times and found the hotels to be wuite expensive and not really up to much. We have just had a weekend in the Eden Rembrandt and would say this is the best hotel we have stayed in in Amsterdam. It is good value for money, the rooms we had were large with a very comfortable bed and everything you needed. There is minor wear and tear but only what you would expect from a busy city hotel, the hotel was clean and the staff were very pleasant. The hotel is in an ideal location for walking around Amsterdam. If i go back to Amsterdam i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: silverbells31
Reviews.Content: As a newbie to Amsterdam I had no idea where to stay. After reading various reviews of hotels, prices, locations and proximity to attractions, I selected the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel. I was happily surprised - excellent location! So close to all of the quarters of town, canals, museums and more! Plus pleasant staff, quiet and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort”
Reviews.Author: wordbird00
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Eden Rembrandt last November. He was there on business and I was there just to hang out. We both felt that the hotel was well located for our needs, especially since Amsterdam is such a nice city to walk around in. I was really impressed with the quality of the hotel. A little small comapred to American hotel rooms, but not by European standards. Very comfortable and well maintained accomodations. A modern aesthetic suited for our tastes as young travelers. Room service was expensive! But there was a great breakfast buffet and a small market near by that I used mostly for meals when we weren't out sight seeing. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: timetraveller007
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well placed in the centre of Amsterdam, close to attractions and shop. unfortunatly the hotel was was not upto scratch. Carpets were filthy, paint on walls were scratched, the whole place just seemed more like a students dorm than 4 star hotel. Smell of place reflected this to. Upon arrival reception staff were very polite and helpful, however once we complained about the state of our room and asked to be moved there mood change and they became rather aggresive, saying the carpets may be stained but they were clean. I didn't put my bear feet on the carpets for duration of our stay, in need of hotel slippers!!! Want what it says on tin, of Kent.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, find somewhere else to stay......”
Reviews.Author: CSAK
Reviews.Content: Bad sewage problems in this hotel which also makes part of it very smelly It was also mainly staffed by agency personnel who forgot to change our towels or clean our room for several days. When they did clean it they left the rubbish in the bathroom sink and there was little evidence of cleaning. Breakfast also very poor. The hotel is nicely placed to explore but nothing else good to say about it. We would never stay here again nor recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam holiday experience”
Reviews.Author: teddles19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel while visiting Amsterdam. We can find nothing we didn't like about the hotel. We asked for a quiet room, which we got. We didn't even hear the nightlife at Rembrandt Square! The room was spotless, and cleaned daily, to a high standard. The Concierge was extremely helpful, as were the front of house staff. The only thing we could say is that the FOH staff should learn to smile more. They are very efficient and polite, but a smile would go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn but nice location”
Reviews.Author: greenNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden Rembrandt Square for a total of 7 nights in August - the first four were paid through my partner's company, as she was there for business, the last three were paid by me, and because I had made a separate reservation, we switched rooms for the last three nights. Now, I didn't try to stay in the same room, so I have absolutely no issues with having to move rooms. In fact, it was welcomed, as our first four nights were spent in a room that had windows onto an alleyway that was incredibly loud every morning at about 3am. I guess the bar/coffeeshop patrons start to spill out into that street at that time... Our first room had stains on the carpet and holes in the bedding - a bit worn, but not unbearable. The bathroom had a tub, but only half a shower door - a design I'm not fond of! It makes for a bit of a flood every time you shower, especially with the rain feature - unless you consciously take care to not move around too much. The second room was a little smaller and didn't have a tub, but had a full door to the shower, so that's a plus. It was also much quieter - a welcomed relief at that point. My only gripe about the second room was the layer of dust on all of the shelves - the ones in the bathroom, the ones in the living area...dust! Overall, though, the beds are comfy enough and the staff were nice. The breakfast was ridiculous for 20euros - offered nothing special for that. I did really like the location of the hotel - Utrecht Straat is just out the door, where there's plenty of nice restaurants and cafes, and the market "Marqt" is just around the corner as well, where you can pick up fresh munchies/produce. Also, there's a coffee company next door, for your morning caffeine fix. One more thing that can balance out the negatives is that there's free internet in the room. If you can plug in with the ethernet cable they provide, it's free for the lowest speed. They charge for "faster" internet, but honestly, I used the free internet the whole time and had absolutely no issues loading pages. So, in the end, I'd recommend the hotel if you can get a decent rate for the stay and don't mind that it's slightly worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MissS80
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two nights stay here. The staff were more than friendly and were happy to advise where to visit and provide maps. The room was excellent, tea and coffee provided and the usually cosmetics that are provided in hotel rooms. The rooms are cleaned daily, and you can place a do not disturb sign on the door if you are not an early riser!! The location to this hotel truly is great. With two entrances at either side of the building both taking you right into the heart of Amsterdam. I found the hotel very clean and tidy overall and there was always someone on hand to help no matter what time. I did not eat here, as there were plenty of great restaurants near by, however speaking to other guests who ate here there were no complaints!! I would recommend this as a place to stay when you visit Amsterdam. And I will defiantly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design”
Reviews.Author: maria_swe
Reviews.Content: Amazing bed and very nice bathroom - especially for couples. Very good location, close to many bars and restaurants. Check out the design in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Hole in the wall... literally”
Reviews.Author: jk232
Reviews.Content: we expected a lot more from this hotel than what we received. After booking, I felt confident that we would get a nice room, bathrobes and slippers included, for the price we paid (around 400 euro for 2 nights). We were met by very helpful and courteous staff. On arrival in the room we were shocked! The room lacked the amenities that were promised, and to add to the scene, the bathroom had a hole in the wall where a drain should be. The walls were 'well used' and the view was of the building next door. In terms of value for dollar, we have searched on the internet, and have concluded that there are many other options for travelers that would be searching for some small increases in luxury for a reasonable price. The hotel is located in a very convenient location to many areas of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: Codlin
Reviews.Content: While in Amsterdam my wallet was taken out of my hand bag. The staff at Eden provided me with a staff member, a computer and a telephone to help sort out cancelling cards and obtaining new cards as it was the firts day of our travels. The next day as we were checking out the manager came to us to make sure we had money to continue ore travels.. The room was very nice and very clean,.great view of the city. The included breakfast was very good. All staff were very courteous and efficient. I would stay here again anytime. Highly recommend this conveniently located hotel while in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany2727
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were notified that we had been upgraded, always a bonus! We were taken through the hotel to the back entrance where we stayed in an apartment over looking the canal. We were pleasantly suprised. The aparment had a good size kitchen and lounge area as well as a balcony. The only down side was that it was a bit shabby (carpet stains etc), but we really didn't worry about it; the bathroom, toilet and bedroom were clean and that's all that we cared about! Great location, about 10 mins by tram 9 (& only 3 stops) from Central Station - the trams are fab for transport. Really friendly staff for check in and out & the concierge was useful for information (when we could find him! ;-) ). Would definately go back, although we have been spoiled now and we would have to have the apartment again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfy bed!! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: fran119
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the comfiest beds I have ever slept in! Our room was large and very roomy. Housekeeping was good, room was very clean and tidy. Location of this hotel is great, Close to rembrant square, full of shops, bars and restaurants, 15 minute walk from the red light district. The only downside I found in this hotel is, There was no milk in our room to make tea and the coffee/tea tray was not refilled by housekeeping at any point. Also I found to the breakfast to be very expensive, So we went elsewhere in the square to eat breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent-Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nisha-Minesh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in location, it was close to all major landmarks, the hotel staff were very friendly and attentive. The rooms did suffer from wear and tear however it was bearable, the staff in the hotel really couldn't do enough for you. I would recommend this hotel for young couples for sure, you want to be close to bars, shops and restaurants galore!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a paint job”
Reviews.Author: moneypenny78
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be around cafes, restaurants and night-life. The tram stop is across the street and all sights are within walking distance. The room was decent but the walls had scuff marks everywhere. We also had a towel that had two huge rips in the middle of it. If you can stay at this hotel for a good price, then we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Little More Care”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonKiwiJo
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just summer in Amsterdam. The Eden Rembrandt could be a very good hotel, but just right now it's barely cutting average. The location is excellent, the Clef D'Or concierge really nice and the bed completely outstanding. But the housekeeping is poor; the carpets need a good clean, the vacuuming intermittent and a lick of tidy up paint required. It's also a hotel that would clearly benefit from an Express Checkout service - trying to check out two co-joined hotels (the Eden fronts the canal, the Rembrant off Rembrandtsplein) through three checkout staff on the busiest weekend of the year (Gay Pride Festival) lead to a queue 20 minutes long. More attention to detail and it could be a very good stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff, great ground floor but very, very tired.”
Reviews.Author: CastleJack
Reviews.Content: It didn't help having to pay Â£140 more than the what 1800hotels had taken before they went bust! (We found out at the front desk.) The front desk staff were very patient and very helpful, thank you both. (Other guests also praised them for helping with their holiday arrangements and understanding Amsterdam in general.) The ground floor was a shining example of a modern hotel but once behind the public area the hotel showed itself to be in need of some TLC. Carpets were dirty, stair and corridor lighting was gloomy, paint work was chipped. The room we had at the last moment was a good size but we overlooked windows (rooms) of the building a few feet away so the curtains remained closed throughout our four day stay. The beds were comfortable but there was no breakfast or kettle let alone a fridge which I would have expected for the price we eventually paid. Daily cleaning was excellent, although I didn't appreciate having the door knocked on at 8.45 a.m. Overall it was OK for a short stay but I wouldn't recommend it at the price - our original payment would have been fair but there are much better deals to be had elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good location comfortable corporate hotel characterless & lacking natural light”
Reviews.Author: steveissy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break in Amsterdam, nice hotel in a central location, very modern & boutique style, good sized room big bed but quite soft if you like a supportive mattresses. Room was very dark with hardly any natural light & no view of the outside world except a tiny window in the far corner which looked at a wall & fire escape. Could hear the trams at times. Nice bathroom with bath & powerful shower, hairdrier. Toilet was high off the wall & not a great height for comfort if you know what i mean shorter people would have their legs dangling in the air. No free wifi in the room only in the lobby. Overall have stayed in nicer places & wouldnt have said it was a 4 star. But a great location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “location, clean, tidy, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: MateaMostar
Reviews.Content: - First thing is the location, no need for public transport, we could walk from hotel to anywhere. - No need for the expencive hotel breakfast 'cause in the walking distance of 20-50 meters on the Rembrandt square there are cheaper places to eat. - We got a deal in the hotel and got one night for free. - In the same walking distance- on the rembrandt square- there are couple of clubs. I remember one was awesome, one was terrible, and in the third we couldn't enter, the tickets were sold out. And there is a great coffeshop just by the entrance of hotel :D - Very clean, tidy and a safe hotel for reasonable price. -I'm definintely sleeping there again and recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Fabulous location. Food prices absolutely crazy!!”
Reviews.Author: RCWILLIAMS100
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite quirky, differing in size and layout. They are clean and beds are very comfortable. We chose not to eat in the hotel so I cannot comment on the food, however with breakfast running at 15+ euros each person or 17+ euros if you just turn up in the morning. The location is excellent for tram stops, and an abundance of restuarants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: derbycouplet
Reviews.Content: Well located as central but being on a side street not as noisy as the nearby main square. Room looks tired in places with scuffed walls and stained carpet. Room was however well presented. Large bathroom ( wtih large deep bath) with quality complimentary toiletries, hair dryer etc but let down by poor qualty toilet paper. The adjoining Michelen star restaurant was busy but did not eat there, so can not comment on food. Felt let down in that could only have limited drinks of tea/ coffee due to limited powdered milk and coffee satches. Overall would go again due to good location and comforatble stay.

Reviews.Title: “didn't seem worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JenneG
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights in early may. I didn't pay attention to other reviews but I wish I would have. The location is convenient overall, but really loud and full of 20 somethings (great if clubs are your thing) on the weekend nights. I was street side, the window would not fully shut (did call to have staff try, but no luck) and the sound was quite loud. there were no other rooms the first night, and i was too unmotivated to change by the 2nd. For the price (Euros 315 Sat, 89.25 Sun, 128.25 Mon) i wished for more. I stayed at hotel krasnapolsky a few nights later, and it was worth the extra money. I vouch for the overall un-cleanliness mentioned in other reviews, tiny rooms (no way to fit 2 at once in bathroom) the elevator system was a irritant (2 side by side that did not respond to the same call button, and could not press down from my floor, so took the chance of having to go another story up), no breakfast included, bed a bit too soft for me (my mom loved it) and they ran out of umbrellas by noon :( Getting around by foot is so easy, so next time I will stay somewhere with a more quaint setting, probably getting much more for my money.

Reviews.Title: “my fave deal in AMS”
Reviews.Author: georgex999
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Amsterdam. I've stayed in this hotel probably 10 times. (or in the sister hotel connected to it). It's the best value by far that i've stayed in the city. The rooms are very clean and the staff has been very friendly and accommodating. Some rooms are very very tiny but i dont spend a lot of time in my room. The location in the Rembrandt Square is perfect and very central to everything. The only complaints i would have is the elevators....one of them was not working whillst i was there this past week and also the cost of the food is way too high.. better to just get better/cheaper food in the city. I try to stay there whenever i visit AMS - about 4 times a year. Great Value.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned its ok but not if your fussy”
Reviews.Author: jillh10
Reviews.Content: They stung us for 2 bottles of water and an orange they said we had from the mini bar I have no idea what they are on about but got fed up of arguing about it, the city tax kinda caught me unaware. The walls needed cleaning but hey, would you notice after a few picks off the menu at Smokeys coffee shop...and dont eat there you are looking at 25 euros for a burger and fries... view was of a roof and some kind of steam outlet from the kitchen I guess. Watch out for this because they charge something like 1,500 peak times to stay there but..because we had what we thought was a deal where you get a room cheaper for booking in advanced...we got the crap room lol and, look out for the shower and toilet behind a glass wall. (bit awkwards I thought even though there was some frosted glass) The cleaners were all very polite and bent over backwards to please cutomers, but we didnt find the management helpful at all. For a fun 4 days, if you get it cheaper than we did...and you take cleaning equipment, its not too bad and it was fun coming back late at night from Smokeys or Barneys through the revolving doors OH and I forgot to say..you have to pay to use the wifi in your room and to watch TV unless you want watch the few free channels (they give the impression its free but its not) Tram numbers 4 and 9 go to the hotel but a number 9 will drop you nearer

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL!!! WE LOVED IT!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Apples05
Reviews.Content: We actually booked into the Eden Hotel (not Rembrandt Square), but our friends booked into this one. They are both in the same building! The Hotel gave us a free upgrade so that we could all stay in the one part!! Really lovely hotel!!! The drinks / food appeared to be very expensive :( We ate in an Italian place around the corner, it was very reasonable and delicious if you don't mind a cat sitting at your feet!! WOULD DEF RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Travelrate
Reviews.Content: We booked a Standard Room. Standard Rooms DO NOT have real windows. Just a dark small sight to a light funnel (and other rooms). We were "offered" an upgrade for EUR 25,- per night (which was without tax, what they did not tell us). We took the upgraded room as the other one was unbearable. The new one was at an average rate of EUR 150,- per night (of course without breakfast). Extremely dirty, thick speckles on the carpet in the room, dirty plastic spoons at coffee maker were just put back for next use, all wooden parts were nagged and damaged. Unfriendly personnel. Should be many places with better value! We as well as other guests were harrased that we opened the MiniBar (electronically noticed) and not believed that we (as well as the others) did not take out things. Time-consuming check-out. Cannot recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Niallobyrne
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eden for two nights 24/3 to 26/3. I found the location of the Eden superb for walking around Amsterdam. The hotel was clean, my only gripe was that the room was a bit small. But you spend so little time there, it worked out fine. We had a problem with our shower which was sorted out within minutes. My biggest compliment was for the Concierge, he was very helpful and professional to everyone, who asked him questions and he is a great asset to this hotel. I would definitly stay in the Eden again and have no proble in recommending it. There is also a handy bar where prices are not too bad for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: lindseyloves2travel
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel we were very impressed, the staff were friendly and helpful and even upgraded our room for us! The room was very spacious, clean and modern with a fantastic bathroom. The bed was massive and there was an LCD TV and mini bar, although watchout for the pringles, they are not free, lol! The hotel location was perfect, within walking distance of all the main attractions and tram routes. The hotel was in rembrandt square which was very pretty and not at all boistrous or noisy, it had an outdoor ice rink in it at christmas time. Opposite the hotel is a cafe, if you stay here you MUST buy a hot chocolate from there, we have not found better anywhere in the world yet and would go back to Amsterdam just for this hot chocolate!! 10 minute walk and you were in Dam Square and a little further was the red light district. We actually got a 3 day travel pass at the trainstation which allowed you to travel on the trams around the city, this was the easiest way to travel, or if you are feeling energetic grab yourself a bike. Would definately recommend to anyone wanting to visit amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey room, unhappy staff, breakfast con trick, world's slowest lifts, pricey internet”
Reviews.Author: DarkGlobe
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eden as it was recommended to me by a colleague as being practically next door to the customer I was visiting. And it was, which was nice. It is located about 20 minutes walk or a short tram ride from the centre of Amsterdam but is still in a fairly convenient area. Plenty of shops close by, a canal across the street, nearby coffeeshops (if thatâ€™s your thing), flower market, restaurants & an excellent Zushi just a few doors down. But enough of what I liked, this review will be primarily about what I did not like as thereâ€™s so much more material there. Firstly, I booked the hotel through a travel company and pre-paid 90 Euros per night including breakfast. Not a bad rate for Amsterdam. When I came downstairs hungry for my free breakfast I was directed towards the bar area where I saw no evidence of any food. Somewhat confused I approached the bar staff and as I approached, two croissants and a pot of jam took shape in the gloom. Naturally, I assumed these were decorative and asked for my breakfast but they just offered me the decorative pair of croissants! Me: â€œWhat? Nothing cooked? Not even cold meats?â€� Staff: â€œAhh, if you want that breakfast, thatâ€™s in the restaurant, but itâ€™s not freeâ€� The girl explained to me how the hotel served two separate breakfasts in two separate rooms. The room I was in served the twin-croissant-pot-of-jam peasant breakfast for...wait for itâ€¦12.50 Euros!!! The other room, the one where the cheese, cold meats, scrambled eggs, bacon & mini sausages lived, served breakfast for the kingly sum of 19.50 Euros. Alas, the â€˜freeâ€™ breakfast was the 12.50 pair of croissants and Iâ€™d have to pay the difference if I wanted to eat a half decent breakfast. I say half decent because even at 19.50 it was hardly something to remember. It was barely worth the difference, let alone the full 19.50! As if the rip-off breakfasts & â€˜Freeâ€™ breakfast con trick wasnâ€™t quite annoying enough, the hotel also charges top whack for internet access, 15 euros for 24 hours or 7.50 per hour. Jesus. When I checked out, my breakfast upgrades for the two nights and my, approximately, 3 hours total internet use landed me a bill for an additional 37.50 euros. This place is a complete rip-off! But thereâ€™s more, and this next one I hadnâ€™t picked up on initially but I got chatting to another guest on my second day at the hotel. He complained that the staff were unfriendly but after Iâ€™d thought hard about my interactions thus far with the staff I realised he was onto something. I wouldnâ€™t say they were unfriendly though, I would say they were unhappy. They were polite every time I spoke to them but there was no warmth, not between myself and the staff, not between the staff and each other. A stark contrast to the Owl Hotel I stayed at the week before where the staff are all so happy and so friendly you enjoy stopping for chats with them. Anyway, back to the Eden if we must. The layout of the hotel is pretty confusing which is ok if the signs are adequateâ€¦but theyâ€™re a bit hit & miss and I struggled to find my room initially. I also made the mistake of using the lift to get my case up to the second floor and man was it slow, it was more like waiting for a tram than a liftâ€¦it was just as slow when I used it again to check out 2 days later (I used the stairs in between because there are better things to do in Amsterdam than wait for lifts at the Eden). There are so many better hotels for around the same money. The only thing the Eden has going for it is its surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Bad quality hotel - dirty and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ralph8477
Reviews.Content: I am very disapointed by the level of service when checked in. My first impression when I got out the elevator was not really good until I got into my room and i saw this dirty white wall and that broken windows which makes the atmosphere even colder. Despite this, the staff only propose me a new room without any upgrade! what a joke... i do not recommend this hotel to anyone. I am travevelling to several countries and have experienced all type of 4 to 5 star hotels. Believe me, this hotel is not a 4 star hotel at all, but more like a 3 star to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: JengaB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break to amsterdam, we booked it through last minute.com as a package. we were a little dubious about the hotel after reading the reviews on here, but can honestly say we enjoyed our stay here. We stayed in a standard double room, which was a decent size, admittedly the view was just the back of the adjacent building, but the room was quiet so no complaints there. The bathroom is mainly glass with a frosted middle panel, which was fine, but I could imagine would be a little embarrasing if you were sharing with friends. As to location, it is situated right on the square, so places to eat and drink are very close. Trams from central station go straight past the hotel, which is really handy if you are catching a train from the airport to the city centre. When I looked on the hotels website I saw that double rooms are normally around Â£120 per night, but as we booked through last minute ours worked out at about Â£60 per night, for that price I thought the hotel was excellent value for money, but would probably have expected a higher standard if I had paid the normal rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star - Dirty / Unclean and not value for money”
Reviews.Author: JimmyKLondon
Reviews.Content: I have made a serious complaint about this hotel under the "Summit Hotels and resorts" umbrella. The Hotel is this one, The Eden Rembrandt Square in Amsterdam. This hotel should NEVER be a Preferred Hotel, and neither should it be a 4 star. The walls had visible damp, the carpet filthy, room dirty and dusty, noisy outside, not to mention two different people complaining in reception as we were checking in! What is going on with this Hotel? I fully photographed this experience and am awaiting the outcome of my complaint. I am very concerned that the description of this Hotel is misleading. This hotel completely questions what is a "Summit Hotel" and it will be interesting how the summit group responds. AVOID THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not functional”
Reviews.Author: Minifalk
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Expensive breakfast. Hopeless bathroom with doors made om galss and a big galss wall between the bed and the shower. Good service, and helpful people in the reception. Good area with metro and trem nearby.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tourorganiser99
Reviews.Content: I had used this hotel on a previous group tour (in 1994), so chose it again. I had good memories previously, but unfortunately the standards have slipped since. Front desk staff didnt go out of their way to assist, in fact I felt we were an interruption to their day. The standard rooms we were allocated were VERY small, almost "dogbox" size, and could best be described as adequate. Our group breakfast served in the bar consisted of 1 croissant, jam and coffee. After complaining we were moved to the normal breakfast restaurant where the buffet b/fast served was a big improvement. Location is great with the adjacent Rembrandt Square full of restaurants and bars. If you have to stay here ensure you request Superior ( ie larger) rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It was good not great”
Reviews.Author: jvegas3008
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a long line at the reception when we arrived, so I thought it would be a lively hotel. It really wasn't though. The carpet was awful, but the room was spacious and comfortable. Yes, the bathroom door was just frosted on the middle third. Didn't even know there was a bar downstairs until a couple of nights into the stay. Location was good. Rembrandt square seemed to be the trendy spot to go out even for the locals. Smokeys was there and a couple of lounges and probably the largest club in town, Escape. We walked to the red light district, museums, and leidseplein. We went to the van gogh museum and walked through the anne frank huis. They are a must. Heinekin experience was okay. At the end, you get to hang out in a bar and it is fun. The place is very touristy and not original at all. The walk was a little long to get to those places, but an enjoyable city to see on foot. Amsterdam was fun. I don't know if I have any other recommendations on places to stay. This area was pretty good. Ate at wok to walk everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: 19Bumblebee
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel in a good location. The bathroom door in the room was bizarre - was glass and only part frosted. Fine if you're on you're own but not so great when you're sharing a room. There are some things that really should remain private.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, great location but carpets in need of cleaning”
Reviews.Author: owenmyles
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel; thought reception staff could have been more welcoming. We were allocated a large room on the 4th floor. The access corridor seemed in need of painting/cleaning and there was a large yellow stain on the carpet adjacent to the bathroom. Glass doors separate the bedroom from the bathroom; these provide almost no privacy and there is no masking noise. I had some concern that one door might fracture if not carefully opened/closed. The room on our facade was directly opposite an office so anyone working in the office could look directly into our room (so we left the blinds closed). We had a reasonably "quiet" room but the occupants of a pub generated a lot of noise into the early hours (up to c. 6 am). The concierge was helpful, took care of luggage and organised a taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KonstantinosD2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a great location near the canals and the town center. We've got a free upgrade to a superior room, clean and tidy. No free wifi, but free internet at the lounge. Reasonable price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Faux-Fancy and Too Clever for its Own Good”
Reviews.Author: BearsEatSalmon
Reviews.Content: If all you are interested in is a bed and a close proximity to the lively section of Amsterdam, this is an excellent choice. However, if you are price conscious, or demand some class and good accommodations for your money, I would look elsewhere. Overall, the hotel tries very hard to appear expensive, but comes off as cheap and overpriced. When I arrived on Friday, there was water dripping onto my head in the lobby. When I left on Sunday, the water leak was still not repaired. The rooms are small but serviceable, but no more. The large beds are really two smaller beds pushed together, with separate bedding on each. Each room has a very small desk with a small, uncomfortable chair. Above each bed, on the wall, is painted a very large arrow pointing to the bed, in case you are unable to find it. In fact, you may be unable to find the bed if, like me, you let the door close before turning on the electricity in the room. In order for any electric device to work - all lights included - you must insert your room key into a slot inside the room near the door. However, to see the slot, you must hold the door open at the same time! There isn't even a tiny night light above the slot to help you if you happen to let the door close, leaving you to fumble around until you open the door again or figure out where the slot is. There is free Internet access, provided via Ethernet. Short but adequate cables are provided in the room. If you want wireless access, you will have to rely on being lucky and picking up a signal from an establishment outside of the hotel. My room had several strange, bright orange stains on the carpet. The heating system was very weak and took a lot of time to bring the room to a reasonable temperature. The walls were very thin, and it was easy to hear what others were up to on each side of me. The bathroom. My nemesis. Someone decided that it would be fun to make a fancy looking shower, I suppose. The floor drain is right in the middle of the tub; I kept stepping on it accidentally and closing it, causing the tub to fill with water. It took me a while to figure out where the handle was to open the drain up again - there are no markings. The emergency drain is the key here, but I opted to simply pull the plug out entirely, since I kept stepping on the thing. Instead of bar soap, a liquid soap dispenser (similar to the kind you would find in a typical restroom) is placed inside of the shower and near the sink. This is a great idea, but poor in execution. The amount of soap dispensed with each push is minuscule; much of my soap also was caught inside of the enclosure, due to improper soap nozzle alignment. A word of warning before turning on the water in the shower: Turning the nozzle one way is for the bath, while the other is for the attached shower hose. No indication of which direction is for which device, or that the dual-function even exists. The shower door only covers half the length of the shower. I am not sure why. If alone, this is obviously not a problem, but if you are sharing the room while one showers and another shaves, for example, do not expect much in the way of privacy. Heated mirrors prevent condensation during showers. A very nice and unexpected touch. You will hear what is going on inside of the Square. It can be quite noisy, long into the night, and every night I heard at least two ambulances nearby. If noise bothers you and inhibits your sleeping, DO NOT under any circumstances stay in this hotel! However, the curtains in front of the windows are absolutely incredible, and block out nearly all outside light.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: from_moscow
Reviews.Content: ERSH is a perfect hotel situated more or less in the heart of Amsterdam. Shopping streets, Red Lights District, Dam Square are easily reachable by feet. Central Railway Station is situated a bit far from the hotel, but it takes 5 minutes to get there by taxi and it costs EUR 7.50. The hotel itself is not posh, but is really nice and comfortable. Superior rooms are big enough, and bathroom is really huge! Moreover, we had no complaints about cleanliness and staff. Room service is excellent. The only bad thing is with Wi-Fi. In case you don't have laptop you may get an Internet access only in the lobby. It is impossible to connect to the Internet through iPhone. From one hotel side you may have a window view to Amstel river, from the other side to dirty street, but it's a matter of luck. The other minor dissapointment was the absence of the bathrobes in the room, but that is not too important. So, I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: Angel-D-08
Reviews.Content: My FiancÃ© and I visited here the 2nd wk in February with friends, I booked it as a treat to myself for my 21st birthday. We didn't do much research into accommodation as we were travelling with 2 other couples who had booked before we decided to go so we just booked this to be with them. This is a fantastic hotel, so easy to get to by tram from the main train station. Every1 speaks brilliant English so there are no problems asking for directions. It is a stones throw from Rembrandt square which is the hub of activity at night. I didn't sample the breakfast in the hotel, I thought it to be a bit expensive so we went to the bar/restaurant next door which worked out almost as bad. The rooms are spacious enough for 2 people, the beds are cosy. If you were to stay here with anybody but your partner it could be a bit awkward because the door of the bathroom is frosted glass and isn't a full door, it's very hard to explain but it leaves your feet and head exposed when standing if you can visualise that. I didn't find it a problem though. The staff are friendly and are helpful should you need them, one staff member managed to get us a taxi to the airport for a very competitive rate on our last day. It wasn't too busy when we were there so we had no problem arranging a late check out. I would definately stay here again and would have no problems recommending it to a friend. If you like shopping the main shopping area is only a 10 min walk from the hotel and it's pretty easy to find your way everywhere in Amsterdam. Absolutely beautiful city, so laid back and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alexvest
Reviews.Content: On their website they claim to be a four star deluxe hotel, but the service they provide lies closer to a two star. If you enjoy the following please choose this hotel: - Dirty rooms with carpet burns and dirty walls - No toilet amenities - Cheap and small towels - Unpleasant and rude staff (At the sunday check out - all the staff where busy dealing with complaints) - Hidden taxes (be aware of a 5% city tax, charged at the end of your stay) - Expensive breakfast - No bathrobes (tried to order them three times) - Thin windows (to a noisy street) - Expensive late checkout - 40 euros The only positive I have to say about his hotel is its central location and kind concierge. Please don't leave your money in this hotel, they seriously don't deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, conveniently located but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: giannifr
Reviews.Content: Eden Rembrandt Square is a good hotel at a very central location. You can walk to most of the attractions in Amsterdam, or take the tram at Rembrandtplein. Apart from the location, the Hotel itself is nice, the staff is friendly. The rooms are new, I was there about 10 years ago and they definitely renewed the rooms since then. My carpet was a bit dirty, but than can happen, other than that the room was clean - not super clean, but good enough. The rooms are a bit small, but then again, it's a city hotel. I can imagine that there are better hotels, but for the price, Eden Rembrandt Square is a great place to stay. There are free internet stations available, which is a nice thing. The two things I did not like: There is no gym and the hotel is noisy, you can hear people talking in the the hallway or when someone opened the door to their room, you could mistake it for someone opening your room.. this is kinda bad. But all in all, I liked the experience, I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel - Don't believe the Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: TaraM_86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a quality hotel, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the cleaners even work on a Sunday to clean your room, and the rooms are lovely. After reading the bad reviews detailed about this hotel, my husband and I were very concerned when we arrived at the hotel, however, we were shocked when we checked in. We had booked a twin room, as we were on a budget holiday (long weekend) and as we were checking in the hotel assistant informed us that we had been upgraded to an executive suite. We were absoutely amazed, the room was lovely and the bed was so big we were a mile a part. The only thing that we were dissapointed with was the cost of the breakfast. We did not eat at the hotel due to the prices, but after a few trips around we realised an English breakfast was very expensive everywhere. We would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family, you will be suprised at what you read compared with what you experience. Amsterdam is a lovely place and we will be visiting again soon, and definitely staying at the Eden Rembrandt again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but expensive food”
Reviews.Author: Cumbria_James
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned and the rooms are comfortable and clean. However for normal British people the cost of breakfast is extremely expensive. At present it is â‚¬19.50 for a 'Full English' or â‚¬12.50 for croissant and drink. There are cafes in the square which offer breakfast at more reasonable prices but most don't open till around 10am. Our friends found a place across the bridge near the flea market which opens earlier.

Reviews.Title: “clean modern and central”
Reviews.Author: lesley_m_99
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights for my boyfriend's birthday and enjoyed hotel.was very clean spacious and great location.tv was big plasma one perfect for watching movies if you are staying in.had mini bar in room and we didnt realise that we were automatically charged when taking out each item.we took out everything to make room for our own drinks etc.the receptionist seemed annoyed at this on checkout but it was soon rectified.would recommend it for being so close to night life and shops yet still being quiet enough for good nights sleep.restaurant was also one of the best in the city even though was very busy the night we went and tables were bit crushed together,great food and wine

Reviews.Title: “Better off elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room facing the main street. Room is a bit small for 2 huge suitcase. The bed was comfortable enough, the carpet a little dirty with stains and it had a slight musty smell in the room. They were fully booked and so we could not change to a different room. We left the window slightly open but it was noisy with the drunks and the tram outside. The bathroom is okay, I am sure the cleaners can do a better job. We also noticed on the sheets there were stains of blood (probably the cleaner had a cut or something on her fingers)! Did not notice it the night before as we were out all day and were only back in the room at night. The breakfast at the hotel is expensive. There are cafes and restaurants nearby (Rembrandt Square) where you can get breakfast for a cheaper price. The flower market and the shopping area is a short walk away. But if walking is not your thing, you can rent bikes and scooters. Some of the staff are friendly but like the comments from other TA members, they just couldn't care less! There is free Internet in the room, it is a little slow but you can choose to pay for a faster connection.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay, beware the reviews I think may be a mixup with another Eden Hotel branch”
Reviews.Author: neofytos
Reviews.Content: There are many reviews speaking of terrible experiences, they mirror the ones I had at A DIFFERENT EDEN BRANCH (the Eden Hotel Center Amsterdam one, on Nausakade street). This hotel is nice with a very nice breakfast although not a massive choice for sum, its fine for me. The bed was very comfortable and Internet free with LAN cable supplied at a good but slower speed than the paid ones, WiFi is chargeable. Staff were helpful, shower nice. There were plenty of stains however on the carpets and walls. Overall, im pretty satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrip_Fan_UK
Reviews.Content: Well sized room, decorated to a high standard, clean throughout. Very comfortable bed and good bathroom. Smallest window I've ever had in any hotel room - might as well call the room 'windowless'. On the flipside, it was extremely quiet which suited me well. Aircon didn't work and couldn't be fixed for the duration of my stay - got me 1 free breakfast. About half of the staff I dealt with were friendly and helpful, the rest couldn't care less and certainly never thought about the essence of 'client service'. Some were bordering on being downright rude. A shame - this attitude can easily destroy the otherwise positive impression. With some reservation, I'd still recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: matt78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Rembrandt Square for a three day city break between the 28th and 30th August 2009. We are really pleased that we chose this hotel as it satisfied all our needs perfectly. All we wanted was a hotel which was located close to all the city attractions, although not too close to the Red Light District, near to nice bars and restaurants, comfortable and not too expensive! This hotel ticks all the boxes! The location of the hotel is ideal, about 100 metres from Rembrandtplein (Rembrandt Square) which is (or will be once the refurbishment is complete) a lovely square with a variety of bars on three sides and plenty of outdoor seating for you to watch the world go by! 200 metres in the other direction is the Amstel River and the famous Skinny Bridge. Just across the Amstel River from the hotel is the nearest Canal Bus Stop. The Canal Busses are a great way to explore the city (and the canals), the best value ones seemed to be the hop-on hop-off ones which are reasonably priced at 20 Euros per day. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from Central Station. The quicker option is to get the tram which goes right past the hotel. The hotel is quite modern inside and has free internet in the Lobby and a nice lounge area with non stop football on the television! The hotel staff (when available) were both friendly and accommodating, although we did have to wait until 3.30pm to check-in! If you are with the other half, Iâ€™d recommend asking for a double room. They tend to give you a twin room otherwise! Thereâ€™s no point in wasting your money on the hotel breakfast which costs over 17 Euros when you can get something cheaper from one of the numerous cafÃ©â€™s in Rembrandtplein. The rooms are small but perfectly formed. They have all the necessary kit including a safe, air-conditioning, flat screen TV, hairdryer, overpriced mini-bar and a small but very comfortable bed! The bathrooms are very nice too with shower heads you can actually get under and plenty of hot water! The rooms on the Amstelstraat side of the hotel are apparently noisier than on the canal side but itâ€™s not that bad, just the occasional tram and the many drunken people!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fatosRochesterNy
Reviews.Content: Eden Hotel is nice. It has one entrance on Rembrantplein and the other side opens onto a canal. I didnt spend much time in the room but it was clean albeit oddly shaped. You have to put your card in the card holder to get power. you get some tv and cable channels in the room and there is a coffee pot in the room and a safe. pretty basic. price is based mostlry on location. good walking distance to all the main attractions in centrum and easily can get anywhere else in 10 minute walk or bike ride.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, close to Rembrandtplein”
Reviews.Author: TDmize
Reviews.Content: Located within 200 yds of the Rembrandtplein Square. We were assigned to a room and upon arrival the room was noisy as hell due to loud music from the gay pride parade going on that day/night. The hotel staff was very accommodating in getting our room changed to a more quiet room. Overall the room was very nice. It had a great LCD tv, VERY comfortable beds and an interesting bathroom. Our bathroom had a full shower and bath tub. There are also two coffee houses within a minute walk just east of the hotel if you are there for the coffee. Other than that, the location, staff and comfort of the room would make me recommend this to a friend or for myself next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Remember to take a sink plug”
Reviews.Author: Docvic
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel but didn't arrive until 11pm ( as notified) to be told they were overbooked & we would be put in the Eden, Amstel, which is the other half of the Rembrandt - the two enterances are seemingly 2 separate hotels. We were told that we were being given an `executive room' with a canal view. Well, the view was great and is the only reason we stayed on. The room was small, with a small bathroom with a glass door. There was no minibar ( which was a blessing) but the safe didn't work. I reported this & later was able to use it, whether by luck or because it had been seen to, I don't know.. I found out that the Eden is onl a 3* hotel, whilst the Eden Rembrandt is 4*, which may acount for the poor service - they failed to take away my used coffee cup & admitted it was hotel policy not to clean the rooms every day but merely deal with the towels, which brings me to another point. The bathroom ( with its glass door) had been refurbished. Whoever was responsible should be taken out & shot. They have a very small towel rail, which could hold a single hand towel, but not 4 towels. Worse still, it had one of the `fashionable' small recangular washbasins on a glass plate supprt, leaving little room to lay out toiletries, shaving kit etc. Worse, there was no plug. I phoned eception only to be told that there was no plug in any room - `the designer thought iit would spoil the concept'. Firstly it caused problems for a wife who rinses hard contact lenses * doesn't want to see them vanish down the plughole. Then there is the terrible waste of water in a country supposed to be eco conscious. That said, we didn't breakfast in the hotel ( their prices) but went a couple of doors away to a CoffeeCompany place for a 4 euro coffee & croissant. The staff however, were very friendly & tried to be helpful & the location was good - nowhere is more than a mile away & Rembrandtsplein is ful of lively bars making for an enjoyable evening. I can't really comment on the Eden Rembrandt side, but understand that the two hotels may once more become one. However, there is no way I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but I want to find others for my next visit”
Reviews.Author: OS9999
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel, since it has vacancy in the best season and the price was the most reasonable ( hotel price in Amsterdam was very expensive in high season!!). My room was situated in the 1st floor. View was bad. And dark. Bed was big and high, so available space was small. Room was clean. Close to trum station. And also can walk to central station (but can't with suit-case). Walking distance to flower market and good landscape area. Close to restraunt areas ( It was in the festival season. So too noizy to sleep. But I think it depends on season or day). Since I prefer space and sunshine, I will stay at different hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: Aussiejohn_9
Reviews.Content: I only found this site a few days ago and really wished I had seen it before I picked this hotel. The rooms are tiny and dirty and the staff are some of the rudest I have come accross. I am not being a snob, I often stay in backpackers and would rather sleep in a dorm then return here. Breakfast is 20 Euros as is the wireless internet, even though the hotel it is said to be free on the hotel website. Far better places to stay in this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, dirty carpet...”
Reviews.Author: Anandita
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I booked two rooms in this hotel for a quick trip to Amsterdam. We chose it due to its price (about 100 euros a night) and its location (which is very good - close enough to all the major sites, but not loud, and a few yards from public transportation). I have mixed feelings about the hotel. Our room was not spacious, but not tiny. The bed was really comfy - except, of course, that the "king" was two twin beds pushed together. I actually fell in between the crack one night and the beds opened up around me. Creepy. The bathroom was clean and the shower/bath was spacious and good. The bathroom soaps/shampoos, etc, were really nice. Rooms also had free Internet access. So, what was bad about it? Well... it was just run down. Which was odd, because it looks like it was renovated and decorated very recently! Everything looks really modern - but our wall was filthy. The bathroom tiles had scratches and stains on them. And the icing on the cake was the room's carpet -- full of brown stains EVERYWHERE near the entrance and the fridge. Worse yet, when I stepped on them - they were still wet, as though someone had tried to clean them (and failed) very recently. Umm... then they should have given us anther room. It makes me think of all the various things that could have caused those large brown stains... gross! Basically, the hotel is fine and has some nice aspects - but they need to do a better job of maintaining it! It's grubby. I think that next time, we'd try a different place due only to this fact - but if other places were booked, or too expensive, we would go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing Location”
Reviews.Author: cupcakelady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent trip to Amsterdam. The hotels in Amsterdam go very quickly, due to the large amounts of tourists the city sees in the spring/summer. I was traveling with a co-worker and her husband who bookded only 1 day before I did, and their hotel was no longer available. Sooooo, I looked for a hotel that was close to the Rembrandt Square area and stumbled across this one, which to my joy, still had room available for my 3 nights stay. The hotel was 186 dollars a night, so it was well into my budget. I had the HARDEST time finding this hotel. There are other hotels with similar names to this hotel so when I asked the locals where this hotel was located, I got a various assortment of answers. I finally found another 'Eden" brand hotel (which was this one's sister hotel apparently) and there I was! The front lobby staff was okay, not overly joyful, but I was able to leave my luggage until they had a room available. Once I got my room, it was decent inside. The bathroom was very modern and clean. Lots of grays and black and blue arrows all over the place. Toiletries were good. The room was super tiny, but hey, you're in Amsterdam. It's not like I am living in the room 24 hours a day. I'm out sightseeing so who cares...it's just me! The bed was comfortable. It was really two twin beds placed together to look like a standard bed. I would say there was quite a bit of funiture in that tiny little room. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, and the location was great because it was near a lot of shops, clubs, and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Amsterdam - Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: cultv
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for a short break of 4 days, but had to check out after only one with no refund! They promise you a double bed, but give you a room that barely contains a single bed. The walls are really thin and you can hear the person in the room next door cough. And worst of the entire place has terrible bed bugs; I woke up with a rash all over my arms and back. I could go on and on, but rude staff complements and terrible stay at a horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - This Hotel is a Rip-Off!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: othermaster
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night, but when my wife and I check in, after having to queue for an hour, was given a single bedded room! We went back down after another 20 min queue and were given another single bedded room! After a lot of fuss and speaking to the manager explaining that we had booked a queen bed. They had the check to say that a single bed was a queen bed in their hotel! To cut a long story short, very rude staff lied about the hotel being full so they could not move us, then when we found you could book a room online, they said we could "upgrade" to a room with a double bed for 300 euro!!! Confirmation was given that the hotel was half empty that night, then the reservation manager lied about the hotel being full all night the following day. She also tried to fob me off with a story that Queen means single in Holland, but 5 other major hotels in the area said that was rubbish. Walls are paper thin, so you can hear everything from the street and the room next door, the room is tiny (Even by London standards) and I have a nasty rash after sleeping in the bed. Avoid at all costs....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Larenz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel main lobby is located in the back of the Rembrandt Square, but it also has an entrance to the street that will take you to that Square. With a canal just outside the street (on the other entrance), it has a great view. Friendly neighbourhood, with a little bit of everything that Amsterdam has to offer you nearby. The Hotel has a bar open till 1 a.m., serving a nice cold Grolsch pint to cool you of the city's intensity! The rooms are normal size, with a LCD TV Screen, but the bed are extremely soft (and therefore, uncomfortable). The bathroom door is made of glass, which I didn't like also. Wi-Fi in the lobby and in the bar (crowded!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: GideonJerubbaal
Reviews.Content: Well, there are many good things to say about Eden Rembrandt square and hardly any negative observations come to mind. First, the location is as good as it can be. It's a wee bit off the crowds near Railway station but the tram which stops right outside gets you there in no time, so you can continue to Schiphol or whereever you want. If you are fit you can walk to most Amsterdam attractions and enjoy the nice routes along the canals. (You need to keep an eye on the cyclists to avoid collisions and be alert on the pedestrian crossings and other crowded places where pickpockets are operating). It is very convenient that the Eden has an entrance from the Square and another one from the Amstel (river) side. Inside the hotel seems to be large though I have no idea how many rooms it has. The room I had was on the 2nd floor facing a wall of another building, it was quite outside. As often happens the room doors were heavily springed and banged loudly each time someone enters a room in the corridor, so guests returning late at night kept waking me up. Inside the room was small as all Amsterdam hotel rooms are I gather but cosy and clean. There is a kettle and some instant coffee and tea bags available. The bathroom is shiny and a nice set of shampoo, creams and wahtever is waiting for you in a transparent airport-security-friendly plastic bag. The shower is a high tech affair which gave me some trouble to master. I did not use the cafe on the ground floor or Internet so can't comment. Breakfast is not included, damn, but naturally there is an abundant choice of food at the Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsDallas
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in The Eden...Thought we'd give Amsterdam another try, as we previously went on our 2nd wedding anniversary, and The Belga Hotel was a nightmare... We did much prefer this location just off Rembrandt square, lovely place good atmosphere, and not to far away from all main attractions, coffee shop just up the road so you can't get lost lol, All in all staying @ the Eden was a good experience room was clean comfy enough... We will be back:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough rooms, good location, a bit noisy, it'll do.”
Reviews.Author: ABLJ
Reviews.Content: The goodâ€” 1. great location 2. Rooms are modern and clean, furnishings are well kept, clean, crisp, modern. 3. Attached to the hotel is a Brasserie Flo. The service is really lousy but the food's pretty good and it's convenient. 4. There's Internet in the rooms for a fee. The bad: 1. Noisyâ€” Across the street there is a construction site. The dump trucks start at about 6 or 7 am, late night party types pass by, or come home drunk and loud within the hotel. 2. Good luck Trying to reach housekeeping or front desk by phone. My neighbor's room service tray remained in the hallway for a good 24 hours. 3. Rooms are crammed in tight. not much room to put your stuff. All in all, it is what it is. I'd stay there again on my own for business, but the place is slightly dumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Best feature: Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: piccolita
Reviews.Content: Design wise, hotel is quite simple and minimalist with simple lobby and check in area. Does not have that homey feel, but it doesnt really matter since it is clean and quite central in location. A few feet away from Rembrandt square. The hotel also connects to its sister hotel, so you can exit the property another way, by the river. What i like most about the hotel is the bed which is really comfortable! One of the most comfortable hotel beds i've been on. Its the soft sinky type. So are the pillows. Since it was winter, it made me not want to get out of bed. Uh oh. Room size is ok, typical european size- just right, not really that spacious. Design is a tad dreary cos of the use of mostly grey colors. (i guess its more masculine) Room had a small funcional table where you can plug your laptop and/or use as a make up table. Bathroom is simple but nice with good kind toiletries, a Dutch brand i forget, and all other usual amenities. I did not have breakfast since it was too pricey at EUR20.00 This hotel is good but i kind of regret not staying at American Hotel (which i could have gotten for only 10EUR more) since it looks much nicer from the outside and Leidsplein seems a better location. But oh well, it wasnt a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeffky
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel. I thought the hotel was nice, although I wouldn't rate it 4 stars. Like everybody else says, its in a great location. The 4 and 9 tram stop is 1/2 a block away. The Canal Bus pick-up is just across the canal behind the hotel. I thought the staff was friendly and somewhat helpful. I say somewhat because they wouldn't print my flight boarding passes the day we left, even though they had a computer and printer in the lobby. They even had a sign on it stating that it couldn't be used to print e-tickets. You would figure that if you just spent several hundred dollars to stay in their hotel, they could at least print boarding passes. Having the PC and printer sitting in the lobby just added insult to the injury. The other negative on the staff, was that they tried to charge me for 3 items supposedly missing from the mini bar. Interesting point is that we had the "do not disturb" hanging on the door the whole stay and we never had them clean the room. When did they inventory the mini bar? Anyway, I told them that we didn't use the mini bar and they removed the charges without question. We didn't mind the frosted glass door on the bathroom and shower as some of the others have commented. In fact I thought the frost glass shower was kind of provocative view from the bedroom. Although, couples with children or non-intimate friends might be a bit uncomfortable. The free wired internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 4* I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: PhillipP
Reviews.Content: Top location, within walking distance to every part of the city - it's between 10 and 20 minutes' leisurly walk to the museum quarter, centraal station, bistros, restaurants, bars, cafes... you name it. Fantastic access nearby both by metro and tram. Rooms were extremely clean and well kept. Only minor "fault" is that the bathrooms are not terribly private due to the glass panels, which even though probably not a problem if travelling with a partner, it might make travelling with friends a little bit uncomfortable. I didn't find it noisy like some other guests pointed out which I guess might vary depending on room location. Top marks for me and would most definitely return! Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel with modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: foohan2001
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night and didnt spend much time in the room. Its Amsterdam for goodness sake! :) The room was modern with a very comfortable bed. Location was very good. There is a tram station right outside. The noise from the tram may bother some people. Good value and one of the better hotels that I have stayed in in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zaria123
Reviews.Content: This is a decent Hotel, but not sure if it is really 4 star standard? Everything was very clean, but the reception had a very clinical and cold atmosphere / decor. The rooms are very modern, white and chocolate brown, very monotone. The bed was two pushed together with a gap in between, not something I am keen on. Nice morden flat tv, tea nd coffee making etc. A nice touch was free regular speed internet. The room was ultra clean, had nice toiletries, and was all very well kept. Not sure why they leave their housekeeping trolleys in the corridor all day, full of stuff, didn't give a great impression. The breakfast was a bit expensive at 18 euro each, as we could get a better choice and selection close by for 8 Euro each. We would definately recommend the Hotel, plain, simple, and nicely kept, just lacked any real luxury feel you migh expect from 4 Star. We are going to return Amsterdam but would also look for somewhere very slightly more central, closer to the shopping, restaurants etc, but overall quite a pleasing place.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, but SO noisy at the moment!”
Reviews.Author: niamunna
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, couldn't have been more central. The tram stop is a 2 minute walk and there are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Also within walking distance of many of the main attractions in Amsterdam. We had a superb deal too - the hotel has a price guarantee on their rooms, but I found a deal cheaper on Expedia. This meant we had our first night free (which saved us 150 Euros!) Look on the hotel's official website for details of this. The room was lovely, clean, modern and bright with the most comfortable beds ever!
