We paid for a superior room, but I don't think it would have been worth paying so much extra if we hadn't had the price guarantee deal. Only slight drawback was how noisy it was. Our room looked over a busy tram route, but to make matters wors there is a lot of building work going on just over the road at the moment in a building called 'The Bank'. On one day there was drilling and really loud mechanical hammering going on all day long. There are also two of the biggest nightclubs in the city on Rembrandt Square too, so this made the Saturday night noisy until the very early hours of the morning. Also, if you are checking in and paying with a card, be aware that the hotel take an extra 50 euros to cover costs (which is no problem), but then refund it to you in cash when you check out. It meant I had to either spend my euros on my last day or bring them home. We'd definately reccommend it though and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lillyvalley
Reviews.Content: What can I say.... the location is perfect for exploring Amsterdam, close to Waterlooplein, where the flea market is, and the flower market and right by rembrandt square where the restaurants are. and a min walk to the tram which takes you to the dam and train station. I booked the hotle for Valentines day in which we stayed for 1 night only. It does say that check in is by 3 pm but we arrived in Amsterdam a round 11pm and by the time it was 12... we thought we try out our luck and see if we can checki in. To our surprise... we've been told we were upgraded, as all the rooms have been fully booked. I thought we were uprgaeded to a larger room, but instead the conceirge walked us round the back passing through their 3* hotel and turning right and we apparently had a flat to ourselves with the view of the Amstel river and the city hall! Myself and my husband was of course very happy with flat which had a small but cosy living room, seprate kitchen and loo downstairs.. whilst upstairs had a double bedroom and bathroom. The place was superb.... and we was just around the corner from the Ice bar! We found the service to be good... but during Sunday 15th when everyone was checking out.. they only had 1 person running the front desk, and so a long queu was building up, whereas the sister hotel which was a 3* had 2 people in the front desk hence people were checking out faster. The only downside to our flat was that you can hear alomost everything... as by night the road by flat... got busy, and with bars and a club a round the corner you can hear a few drunk people on the street. I even heard someone hoovering twice.. so didn't sleep too well at night... but I do love the location and the flat... will definetly stay here again if I'm back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: anneloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rembrandt last weekend and had a great time! The location of the hotel is great being on a side street off Rembrandtplein with another entrance leading out to canal side of the Amstel river...couldnt be more central. Check in was so so, we arrived early and were told we couldnt check in until 4pm (an hour after the check in time no biggie) we just went out for the day! It was easy to walk all over Amsterdam from the hotel location. The staff werent very friendly but that could just be the language barrier, no big deal Our room itself was lovely! After reading reviews I was rather aprehensive but had no need to be. Room 584, very spacious for a two day stay with wardrobes, flat screen tv and a huge bed with a memory foam mattress, lovely! Even the bathroom was a surprise, big open plan bathroom with a separate rain shower and a bath too, in fact we had 3 showers in our room! We also had a separate toilet which was great. I can see why people are put off by the frosted glass but really it isnt a big deal it covers your decency! We had a window which opened out over the roof tops and yes it looked out onto a building site opposite but who is in their rooms long enough to be bothered? No noise at nite was a bonus, giving you a great night sleep (this is high on my priority list when booking a hotel) ! Room also had the other standard requirements, mini bar (expensive and you cant put anything in it to store as its electronic) and tea/coffee (not enough!) We didnt have breakfast as we were room only (croissant from a local bakery was enough!) but the restaurant looked lovely Only complaints would be there was not enough tea/coffee for the room, we kept having to ring down for more and also the rain shower tended to flood the bathroom/toilet but it sooned dried up. We checked out at 12.00 and as our flight wasnt until 9pm we stored our luggage and had another day out, great service provided by the hotel! For the two days we stayed there I would be loathed to find any faults with it, for location, price and comfort I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but bring some earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Bea80
Reviews.Content: I and my partner stayed here for 1 night, and thank god it was only the one night as we had a really sleepless night. We had a room on the third floor that faced out on to Amstelstraat. This is the main route for the trams - which we barely heard but what did disturb us was the constant noise from late night revellers in Rembrandtplein. It didnâ€™t go quiet until around 6am the next morning. We had a superior room which was large and very spacious with a mini bar, tea/coffee making facilities, flat screen tv and internet access; the bed was extremely comfortable which was a god send for a sleepless night! The one thing that I did find un-nerving was the partially frosted bathroom door - not great if you get stage fright. The bathroom itself was nice and modern with hairdryer, bottle opener and a phone! The shower was great and I really liked the Villeroy & Boch bath. We didnâ€™t go to Flo but we did have drinks in Pippa's bar before dinner. This was very cosy probably the quietest part of the hotel. The hotel is in a good location - right next to Rembrandtplein and is easy to get to via tram numbers 4 & 9 from Centraal Station. There are plenty of bars & restaurants in the vicinity so there is no need to go far. I might be tempted to stay here again if i knew I was going to be given a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chriswick614
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. There is a tram stop within two blocks and an excellent coffee shop (non-hash) a few doors down. The Rembrandtplein, with all of its cafes, bars, and shops, is only two blocks away. The central location of this hotel will enable you to explore most of Amsterdam on foot. The hotel staff was nice enough to check me in early on a Friday morning. Each room does have free internet service but mine did not work and was not fixed until the following Monday. The front desk staff did not seem to be in any hurry to get it fixed and all they would do is write the service call in a book at the reservation desk. The room itself was really small but the bathroom was very adequate. I had a single bed and it was really small. The television worked well and had two English stations. The housekeeping service could be very late in the day and sometimes did not come until 5 p.m. The front desk staff were professional but certainly, in now way, outgoing or overly friendly The best quality of this hotel is definitely the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Good room with no bathroom door!”
Reviews.Author: Bashky
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights over New Years and it was.......OK. The hotel is just off the Rembrandtplein which has plenty of bars, restaurants and souvenir shops and good transport links via the 4 and 9 trams to Centraal Station. The lobby and reception area are clean and tidy and the check in was fast and easy with the friendly staff. We were allocated room 172 which was on the first floor facing the street where the tram passes by. My first thoughts were that we would be kept up by the passing traffic and rowdy revellers but it was only a minor irritation as we were too tired from partying each night to care. The room itself was on the small side but well decorated and had the all the things you would expect in a modern hotel room: mini bar, flat screen tv, safety deposit box and an exceptionally soft double bed. All the things you would expect apart from a door on the bathroom. We couldnâ€™t figure out if this was because of the style or it was actually missing for a reason but either way it wasnâ€™t nice for the person not in the bathroom when nature called. If you get stage fright when using the loo you will definitely miss your cue in this room. Iâ€™m sure not all rooms are like this as I had a look through some of the pictures on trip advisor and thought that all rooms had sliding frosted glass doors. The room was quite cold at times as it was freezing outside and there was no radiator in our room. We managed to warm the room by turning the air con to its maximum temperature of 28 degrees and that was fine. Would have brought slippers if Iâ€˜d known. The maid service was good and we were given towels when we needed them and the bed sheets were changed when we requested. We didnâ€™t eat at the Flo restaurant situated near the lobby or go to the bar so canâ€™t comment on them. Overall this hotel is fine if you donâ€™t expect anything over and above a standard hotel. Nothing luxurious and nothing unpleasant apart from the awol toilet door. Quiet enough and comfortable enough for a peaceful retreat from the sometimes hectic Amsterdam streets. Would I return? Probably not - considering the price we paid in relation to the room size but it was New Years after all. If there was a next time I would definitely go for the superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel in Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirl830
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel. We just got a standard room and the room was plenty big for us. There's two types of shower heads - rain shower or regular. I was also really amazed at the kicking night life all around us. However the hotel is on a quiet side street so we didn't hear anything in our room. We were a bit of a walk from the red light district but close to the museums. The only complaint I had is that there is no alarm clock. We had an early morning flight back. The front desk forgot to call our room and we nearly missed our flight. So be sure to take an alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and fantastic”
Reviews.Author: blkice06
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded on arrival, they even had a box of cookies and a card from the manager for us in the suite on arrival. We were also given 2 free vouches for free drinks at the hotel bar. Superb location, stunning room, overall we will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: red kop
Reviews.Content: just stayed 2 nites at this hotel,great location,2 entrances one on rembramt sq,one on the amstel river,2 stops on the tramfrom centraal station,if arriving early enough use the tram from the station,only thing that spoiled our trip was taxi driver charging us 24 euro when the tram is under 2!!!!back to the hotel, must compliment the staff there, have been all over the world following my team liverpool and reception + bar staff are some of the most helpful we have encountered........would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Hollydaze57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased with the size of our rooms, nice clean comfortable beds and pillows. The beds are typical of those in Europe - 2 single beds pushed together. This not only gives a nice large bed, it also means you don't have to fight for the duvet as you get one each. We'd booked the deluxe rooms and they were a reasonable size, at the back of the building and were very quiet. The bathroom was a good size too. The rooms were clean, but the housekeeping after that was not very good. We had to ask every day for extra tea/coffee etc as the amounts left in the room were very frugal, especially as the weather was so cold (we had snow) and wanted to warm up with hot drinks. We were only given one robe and no slippers. We requested them at reception twice, but they never appeared - very frustrating when you've paid for a deluxe room! On the Sunday we had a picnic breakfast in the room with our friends (not too many places open for breakfast on a Sunday in November, & breakfast at the hotel is extremely expensive) so there were quite a few crumbs on the floor. They were still there after the room had been serviced (even this was not done till 5.00pm). The concierge was very helpful and attentive. The hotel is well placed for exploring both the canals and the architecture. We had lots of long walks, even in the snow. There are plenty of very good places to eat, or sit and have a drink and watch the world go by. We'd still stay at the hotel again, as everything apart from housekeeping was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean, lovely rooms & V Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AddictedAndy
Reviews.Content: Booked via Booking.com â‚¬140/Â£110 + â‚¬6 City Tax on arrival. Ideally we wanted something much cheaper, but with a month to go before the trip it was hard to find somewhere without a minimum two nights stay that met my most important criteria. The place had to be clean! When we walked into the reception we were greeted by a lovely lady who was very friendly and helpful. When we opened the door to our room we were extremely happy. A very large and very comfy double bed, modern decor and a flat screen TV on the wall with lots of English Channels. The bathroom is great too with big bath and very powerful shower. The location is great. 5/10 min walk from Flower market, right on Thorbeckplein which is a buzzing area with nice restaurants and cool coffee shops. Didn't have breakfast as it wasn't included so this may not suit those on a real tight budget. I would recommend this hotel for those persons who don't mind paying that little extra for a professionally run hotel with and excellent standard of clean accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: cdeb007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 4 nights. The location was excellent. It was not located in the middle of the overcrowded, cheesier, dirtier areas. It felt a little quieter and secluded. However we only had to walk 1/2 a block to feel like we were in the middle of everything. The staff was extremely nice and helpful, answering our questions, accommodating our requests as best they could. The concierge was EXTREMELY helpful with everything, from recommending excellent, non-touristy, restaurants with amazing food, to helping book tours or events. The rooms were small but very clean. The bathroom was very modern with a really nice shower and water pressure. Everything was new. Flat screen tv (although only 1 or 2 channels had english, but we watched soccer mostly). The hotel was what we needed for the trip and judging is one of the better ones for the price. Make sure to bring an alarm clock or a phone with an alarm as there are no alarm clocks in the room. You can get wake up calls though. There is free internet access at kiosks in the lobby as well as free printing which was a big plus. I honestly can't think of a better location. It was on a beautiful street (front entrance), accessible (within a half block of trams, rembrandt square, restaurants), but quiet enough to sleep at night. Negatives: small rooms, no iron, no alarm clock, restuarant is expensive. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - location central but tacky”
Reviews.Author: kittykat1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend. We booked it, partly based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, but we were slightly disappointed. The hotel itself is fine, the staff are friendly, it's clean etc. The rooms are very modern. it's a bit like an airport hotel, however, very identikit. We booked it off klm.com and got a good price, 260 euro for two nights. Our first night we had a bit of a problem as our bed was actually two single beds pushed together, which I found pointless and annoying. We were exhausted from travelling and had unpacked so we just left it like that but requested a double bed for the next night, which was no problem (however we had the hasle of repacking etc the next morning which we could have done without). The location is very "central" but it was pretty tacky. A bit like Leicester Square, lots of tacky bars, "cafes" and dodgy looking clubs. Five minutes walk away you are in the Southern canal belt, however and it is easy to access all parts of Amsterdam from Rembrandtsquare. If I was coming back to Amsterdam, in order to soak up the atmosphere of a place, I will stay in an old style hotel (a canal house) somewhere in the southern or western canal belt - definitely wouldn't return here, although there was nothing definitively "wrong" with it, just lacked style and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EW_SM
Reviews.Content: Was taken here for a surprise weekend away. Room was a good size with modern, clean decor, well-laid out bathroom maximising limited space. Comfy bed and limited noise from other rooms. If you're a light sleeper ask for a room on the canal side. We had a room on the tram side and while initially worried about potential noise we didn't actually hear a thing sleeping for about 12 hours each night. Didn't bother with breakfast at the hotel (continental 9 euros at the bar, 17.50 euros in the restaurant) as found some fantastic cafes just down Utrechtsestraat (head south from Rembrandt plein) - would recommend the one with a wooden painted sign of a pink spotted teacup - great coffee and fantastic bagels served by friendly staff. Easy to walk anywhere in central Amsterdam from the hotel - the tram will take you to Central Station in about 7 minutes but it's only about a 15-20minute walk. If you're on a budget this probably isn't the place to stay but if you're looking for a good quality hotel in central Amsterdam then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: dally100
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely well located hotel and we didnâ€™t find the rooms to be that small â€“ Iâ€™ve stayed in MUCH smaller elsewhere. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. We arrived early but one room was ready (we had booked 2) so we were able to leave our bags in there while we went off to explore We didnâ€™t have breakfast there as it seemed pricey and we found a very good cafÃ© down by the flowermarket that had something to suit all of us for much less. All in all - a good hotel in an excellent location and more than sufficient for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent - price excellent”
Reviews.Author: Glasson1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and found it to be very central and a nice modern hotel. The rooms were a little small but cosy and the breakfast was fine. It was only 200m from the lively Rembrandtplein and a stones throw from all the main attractions. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TheAnswer
Reviews.Content: Me and a buddy stayed here for a couple of nights. As nice as this hotel was though, there was nothing about it that justifies its pricetag of a staggering â‚¬170 per night. The same room, amenities, and service can be had in the US for less than half that rate. Why it was worth it: The location of the hotel is excellent. It is offset one block from Rembrandt Square which helps shield it from noise. The rooms are extremely clean and very new in appearance. There are no cracks, stains, and miscellaneous damages often indicative of older properties. The stone gray paint and bathroom tiles coupled with modern furniture and light fixtures made for a visually appealing experience. The twin beds are comfy, but maybe too comfy. My back hurt from the mattresses being too soft. But the pillows are the softest I've slept on in quite some time. The windows span an entire wall and offer an interesting view of several office floors whose decor was obviously taken right out of an IKEA catalog. Other features of the room also include a flat-screen LCD tv, electronic safe, work desk, ethernet cable for internet, stocked minibar, and complimentary coffee and tea. Iron and board available upon request. Why it was not worth it: The room is small. The living area is no more than 20 sq m. A room at the Crown Plaza Manila was 3x this size at less cost. At â‚¬170 I expected there to be a bellhop. Alas there was none. Breakfast is not included in the room rate and is an additional â‚¬16. Heating system is functional, but not instantaneous which is much desired in wet, frigid Amsterdam. I called the front desk to bring a pitcher of water and was told that room service was not available at 4am. Mind you this was just a request for water, not a meal. Understandable for a budget hotel, but again this is not a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Bluftut
Reviews.Content: In a city where year-round excess demand means hoteliers can get away with murder, the Eden Rembrandt still represents poor value for money. Rooms are cramped (but then I suppose you have to expect that in crowded Amsterdam) but the little details that make a good hotel were missing. It was difficult to get the coffee and tea replenished each day, bathroom facilities were poor, service in the bar could be painfully slow, the reception advertised public transport passes but never had any in stock each time I asked for one - and I was staying on business for a week!!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ethrell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my elderly parents and we all agree it was a very good experience. We arrived early (check in is from 3) but were able to leave our luggage in the luggage store. The concierge is very pleasant with a good sense of humour. The rooms were fine if a little on the small side but the beds were extemely comfortable. Breakfast was included for us and was excellent. There is a wide choice ranging from ham cheese and croissants to cereal, bacvon and eggs and unlimited tea/coffee. The location is good, just minutes from the trams in Rembrantplein or you can walk a bit further to Muntplein, depending on where you are going. The location is quiet and we were not disturbed by noise on any of the nights we stayed. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Realy nice hotel, enjoyed staying there”
Reviews.Author: gkel
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Modern, excellent beds, great location (even though is was near rembrandt square ti was very quiet), really helpful staff, breakfast ok, the bathroom was with glass walls so a little bit embarassing if you want your privacy. The price was a liitle bit high but i guess that's the standard price for amsterdam. The staff responsible for cleaning the room didn't do their best. I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average For Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NONE1
Reviews.Content: This is a well located hotel- with good rooms- we have stayed in much smaller in Amsterdam. The decor was modern- we didn't find the bathroom a problem at all. Good comfy bed- really soft- not the best though if you like a hard bed. We did not use any of the facilities in the hotel- on check in we were made aware of the Restaurant- but nothing else- so don't even know if there were any others. One day the maid turned up at around 5.30pm, as it happened we were in the room and asked them to come back in 10 minutes- which they never did. All in all- a good hotel- good location and sufficient for what we wanted, although the reception was a bit bland- and I would say it was the rooms that made it a 4 star- not the staff or reception.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hatt-away
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a short break (just two nights) with a friend. It was easy to get to from the cental station and the location was fantastic. It is about 10 minutes walk to Damm Square, but has lots of shops and restaurants very close to it. It is right on the canal side and has a lovely bar to enjoy a drink at either the beginning or end of an evening. We booked a superiour room and it was clean tidy and had a lovely large bathroom. The best thing of all though were the beds, probably the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel!!! It was my first time in Amsterdam and I would love to return for a longer break and would definately go back to the hotel Eden.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool0879
Reviews.Content: Located about 10 min walk from centre of amsterdam and 10 min walk to heineken museum etc. Room was small but adequate, decoration modern and very clean. Got an excellent price by booking on the hotel website on a no cancellation option.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel close to gay scene”
Reviews.Author: DuderInFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during Amsterdam Pride. It was well worth the price. Comfortable and modern and extremely convenient to gay events happening this weekend. But it would be a great location for anyone as it is close to the sights and can be reached easily via tram from Central Station. Will stay at this location again when I return to Amsterdam in October. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved it”
Reviews.Author: DVINFC
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel based entirely on online references. We could not have been happier with this updated, well appointed hotel. Near the flower market and many trams, it was quite easy to use a central jumping off point. I believe we had free wired internet in the room and kiosks available./wireless availabe in the lobby. The room was large, quiet, and very modern. We were thrilled with it. Of course we didn't spend much time in the room, but when we did were extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyFM
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I have stayed here a couple of times and have had a really good time. The standard rooms are quite small (although the upgraded rooms are huge) but have everything you need including free internet, comfortable beds, and great shower (no bath). There are direct trams from central station and it is right in the centre of Amsterdam. Rooms are clean and fashionably furnished (some looking very slightly warn). Breakfast is good but if it isn't in your room rate be warned it is about 17 Euros which is heafty. However, there is a nice coffee shop along the street. Will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel In Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: DarLyn24
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four-night stay at the Eden Rembrandt Square. The hotel was in a great location, just far enough from lively Rembrandt Square to be quiet at night time. We walked from Central Station as the weather was lovely, but if it was raining, you might prefer to take the tram which drops you off less than one hundred meters from the hotel's front door. The room was an adequate size and comfortable, with flat-screen TV with international channels. The glass doors into the bathroom and glass partition between the shower and bedroom are not a problem if you are staying with a spouse or partner, but may not be to everyone's taste. There is also a frosted panel across the middle of the glass. The beds are fantastically comfortable, and our room was quiet at night. The only things I could complain about were that housekeeping was a little noisy in the morning, and they only left one small bar of soap during the entire four-night stay, although other toiletries were replaced. We didn't really have any view from our room, looking into an internal courtyard, although this was compensated for by the fact that no street view meant no noise from outside. Staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel provides a secure room to leave luggage in once you have checked out.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ndnhrdy
Reviews.Content: Wow..from the minute we walked in, like entering 'hotel Babylon' Lovely reception, helpful staff, lovely rooms and gorgeous beds, bathroom doors not a problem, sharing with a friend and neither of us understood why people complain about them. Plenty of tea and coffee, lovely toilettries, nice towels, room cleaned next day, ice machine just outside door. Helpful concierge. Easy and friendly check out, even organised us a taxi to the airport instead of the train. Just off rembrandt square, so great for shops and bars, also quiet on a night time, due to good double glazing. Would we stay again..........deffinatley. Had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel let down by attention to detail and communication between staff”
Reviews.Author: DaveW_Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel just after Easter 2008. It's extremely well located in the heart of Amsterdam just off the bustling Rembrandt's Square. The place has a modern, minimalist style - with understated entrance lobby and nicely furnished rooms in the current trends of white walls, walnut furniture, slate tiles, and suede-effect soft furnishings. Our room was amply equiped - complete with small but functional flat-screen TV, fridge, internet access (assuming you've brought your own device). Also included were tea/coffee making facilities, something not that common on Amsterdam hotels. Our first call was to housekeeping to get some extra crockery - given that we only had one of everything! Okay, it's a small point - but it's a double room for goodness sake. Eventually a single small coffee cup arrived but it was late so we made do! Our 2nd and 3rd calls to housekeeping the next day - followed by a trip to reception after an hour's waiting - were because we'd been left no extra coffee and creamer supplies. Finally we got a couple of satchets of each handed in - perhaps there's some sort of tax on this in Amsterdam? The fridges in the rooms have electronic controls on EVERYTHING - which means it's totally impossible to even move them around a little to accomodate anything of your own that you want to cool. Never mind, we thought, there's an ice machine on every floor - but unfortunately no ice bucket in the room! Like so many hotels - even in the 21st centuary - the people who design the bathrooms obviously never have to use them. Is it really so much to ask for that the shower spray be contained in the bath or tray rather than flooding the floor? Or that you can sit on the loo without having to lean to one side to avoid the loo-roll dispenser? Or for sufficient ventilation and extraction that you don't feel like your shaving in the humidity of a a tropical rain forrest! However, the Eden Rembrandt manages one further design feature that I've never seen before - with its glass bathroom doors. Despite the partial frosting, anyone else in the room is not only treated to some interesting views when walking past the bathroom, but to every sound eminating too! We discovered and even better feature on night time visits to the loo - when the shadows on the wall opposite the bathroom cast a cinematic view on the opposite wall - leaving nothing to the imagination. We both liked the Eden, but it would be so much better for just a little extra thought and effort. Would I stay here again? Perhaps - but without these various niggles it would be a definite.

Reviews.Title: “Twas quite nice”
Reviews.Author: LittleEmmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 nights. On check in, the receptionist was very friendly and helpfully, explaining all fees and charges. The room was nice but quite small, it being a 4* hotel we expected more in size and quality. There was no real doors on the bathroom, only glass, shower like ones. This really got to me and I think its a terrible idea, the bathroom is a private place and you don't want your fellow traveller knowing what you get up to in there, even if it was my boyfriend! Our room was not cleaned so we didn't get clean sheets or towels. This is probably because we didn't put the "make up my room" sign until 3pm but I personally feel this is ok seen as its a 4* hotel, they obviously don't agree though! Overall an enjoyable stay, just don't expect too much from this one!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel i've ever been”
Reviews.Author: pmp007
Reviews.Content: To begin with...the check in staff. The are de Kings and you a slave, so be careful. Snobs, non efficients and not willing to serve you. At least during the night shifte. If by any chance you feel the need to speak to the Duty Manager at a improper hour (let's say by 00h30) they say it's not possible. Nevertheless you can read at tne in-room info that there s a Duty Manager 24h a day. Not true. Imagine yourself reaching an hotel by 00h30 with a sleepy child with the reservation made for a double bed and a baby cot. And when you get to the room, there's no baby cot. Not nice, no ? Even worst, the reception staff just tells you there there is not a chance to get one that same night ! Is this the service you expect in a 4 star hotel in Europe ? I couldn't accept it. The breakfast is just so poor, i didn't feel willing to eat. The bread finishes and you must wait a lot for them to replace. If by any chance you are the kind of people who lkes to come back to the hotel by mid-afertoon, and are expecting to have your room made, you are at thr wrong hotel. It happened twice in a row. By 15h30 and by 18h30. I dond't recomend this hotel to anyone, nevertheless being well located.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4-star, with one serious deficiency”
Reviews.Author: el-gringo1
Reviews.Content: This is one of the newly built interconnected hotels by the same group. Since the hotel is not at one of the canals, forget the view. Nevertheless a great location, in short walking distance to Rembrandt Square and downtown AMS. My room was luxurious, contemporary with a simplistic design. Very comfortable and cozy design. Free wireless LAN, hence a hotel for a solo business trip. However: The bathroom door does not shut completely and the bathroom has no real ventilation. Hence if you travel with somebody, this room would definitely become a nuisance/ impertinence.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rmat
Reviews.Content: Good Location for night life. Nice and Clean Room. The only coment is that the door between room and bathroom was a glass one, would be better having a real door.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, excactly what was required”
Reviews.Author: jojey
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Eden Rembrandt which was superb. On arrival staff were curteous and helpful and we checked in swiftly at 12 midday. The room was modern and spacious with a fabulous big bathroom as pictured in other photographs. However the view was not much to be desired and we were unable to have a room with a double bed, even though we had booked a deluxe room. We had friends staying in a standard room which was very small, no bigger than your average chain hotels. The hotel was situated in a lovely part of the city which was approximately 20-30 mins walk outside Dam square. There were a good few local bars and clubs nearby and the walk into Dam square gave us the opportunity to explore different areas of the city. Overall a good stay. Staff were attentive and polite at all times. the hotel was away from the bustle so a good nights sleep was had. A little pricey but would stay here again for a short stay. However for a longer stay i would go for somewhere with more on site amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: ygale
Reviews.Content: Good location, helpful staff, well maintained decent sized rooms, very large bathroom with underfloor heating. Not the cheapest choice but we felt were received good accomodation for the price. Plenty of cafes, restaurants and bars and a tram stop all within a 1 minute walk. Other reviewers have commented negatively on the glass bathroom doors. The glass is frosted and the large bathroom size means that from the bedroom we could only see the feet of someone in the bathroom. If feet embarrass you, the glass doors are a problem, if not, don't worry about the glass doors.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Francis F
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, convenient location, all of the main attractions shops, museums and red light district within walking distance. There is an excellent tram stop in Rembrandt Square about 150m away. There were also some problems that I would like to highlight. The carpet in our room was stained, the seats in the breakfast room were stained and a mouse in the bar\lounge area scared the crap out of my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Location”
Reviews.Author: Pooler757
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in March. Wanted to be near the gay and lesbian area and it was perfect location for that. If your not into that scene don't worry you would not know it was even there. Hotel very nice, bathroom is not the best for travelling with friends as it is a glass box and as a result very see through when dry or wet. However, not really a major problem. Just worth noting if you want your own privacy. Beds are very comfortable and the free internet access in the lobby is great. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Hope you have a fab holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but houskeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Nepean01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, between the Amstel River and Rembrandt square, on a main tram line and a short walk to the Metro. There is a wide selection of restaurants and cafes in the vicinity, but it is far enough from the main tourist areas that noise was never a factor. We did ask for, and received, a room away from the street which also helped. We had a double room that was fine for two with a good sized bath, working area, safe, kettle, fridge, free internet and comfortable bed. The front desk, bar and concierge service was excellent. We did not eat at the hotel. The breakfast was 17 euros and the hotel restaurant was both fancy and expensive. There is a cafÃ© that opens at 8 am Monday to Friday and 10 am on weekends 25 meters from the hotel, toward the square, where a continental breakfast cost us about 4 euros. The only issue we had was with the housekeeping. We had to ask twice to get towels. Not to have clean towels, mind you, just to get any kind of towels. We had to ask to get toilet paper. We asked for, and never received, clean glasses. We had to ask for coffee cups and creamer. At a 4 star hotel we should never have had to spend so much effort trying to get basics for the room. This is a nice hotel. It generally has good staff who provided 4 star service, but the housekeeping experience makes me want to rate it 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “hardly a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Dleonu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with 3 friends - I'll start with the pros: Its in a really good location especially for nightlife, the Escape nightclub is barely a minutes walk away and is really good. Plenty of other bars in the square as well (De Kroon is one of the most gorgeous bars I've ever been in). It's just a five minute walk to the main shopping street, and roughly 10 or 15 minutes from Dam Square and the Red Light District. All in all location could not have been more spot on. However the hotel itself was disappointing. Our problem started when checking in, the receptionist was unfriendly and seemed annoyed by our presence. The rooms were tiny, barely room to swing a cat and the bathroom was ridiculous - water everywhere after taking a shower and no privacy whatsoever, had to turn on the TV really loud to have a pee in comfort!! There was also zero wardrobe space, but the beds were great. The staff in the bar were really nice but again we had problems with the receptionist (not sure if it was the same one we dealt with when checking in) when I called for more towels. The housekeeping staff had cleaned the room and taken away the towels without replacing them - I phoned reception politely asking for towels and was told (gruffly) that towels would be sent. A half hour later 2 little hand towels were delivered. I explained that we had no towels in the room whatsoever and could we have the full set (bath towels, bath mat, hand towel etc) and the receptionist sighed and said 'you have towels', I explained again, she sighed again and said 'fine'. 1 hour later we were still waiting, my friend phoned and was talking to a different person and we got exactly what we wanted in 5 minutes. Does that sound like good service for a 4 star?? Don't think so. But the free internet in the hotel was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location loved this fab hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiCFrodsham
Reviews.Content: What can i say, this has got to be one of the best hotels i have stayed for in a long time! We arrived at 9am and check in time wasn't until 15:00 however the receptionist was extremeley helpful and had our room booked as a priority to clean meaning we could check in at 11:30. The room was absolutley stunning very clean and well presented and the bathroom was fantastic very modern and excellent bath and shower. We decided not to have breakfast included as there are loads of cafe's within walking distance one i would highly recommend id the 3 sisters cafe/bar this was a fraction of the price of what the Eden was charging and there was lots of choice. The location of this hotel is the best right within easy walking distance to the Rembrandt square the DAM square and the ever lively red light district is only a 7 minute walk however if you wanted to get the tram these are situated about 30 seconds away from the hotel and ruun every 4 minutes. I would highly recommend the Eden Rembrandt and look forward to visiting in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Elrainia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in February. Found the hotel to be modern, clean and comfortable. It's in a good location close to the main tourist places, but it is also quiet. The rooms are decorated in a modern style with solid grey, black and white colours and are not as small as some European city hotels. The bathroom was a decent size, with grey tiles and a good shower. The hotel has free wired Internet access, but no wireless. Breakfast is expensive at â‚¬17.50 per person. It's a buffet service, so you could eat a lot to get value for money, or go along to one of the cafes in Rembrant Square just down the street for a coffee and pastry for about â‚¬5. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and most of the major sights are with walking distance, or can be reached via the trams. We tried the restaurant next door (Flo), which was good but quite expensive (see www.diningcity.com/amsterdam for reviews of this and other Amsterdam restaurants), and also had dinner one night in the Cafe L'Opera in Rembrandt Square which was good value for money and a nice place to pass a couple of hours. Would recommend this hotel to people visiting Amsterdam as although it's not cheap, it is good value compared with other higher priced hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sav_sav
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a very convenient location, nice rooms and very friendly staff. Forget the taxi from the airport (52 euros) use the train (4.80 euros) which is underneath the airport and then a number 9 or 4 tram (1.60 euros) from straight outside the station to Rembrandtplein, the stops are announced on the tram, and then continue walking straight on for 200 metres or so to the hotel. Very easy to find. Got a great deal through www.hotels.nl on a non refundable basis, great bars and restaurants in and around Rembrandtpleain and have breakfast down by the flower market just a 5 minute stroll on Single (canal)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Goliath_UK
Reviews.Content: The Eden is a really nice hotel in a great location; being just off Rembrandtplein it'sonly 100 yards from a lot of bars and clubs but still manages to be extremely quiet. The room we had was very spacious, clean and well appointed and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely time!”
Reviews.Author: sossick
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here as a 30th Birthday treat and had a great time. The room was immaculate, and the bed amazingly comfortable to the point that we did not leave it until lunch time on the first morning! And was just as hard on day two..... Great location too. We paid for a cab from Central St on arrival but felt rather ripped of as it was â‚¬20 and was only a 5 minute ride. On the way back we caught a tram which was much cheaper (actually it was free as we did not realise you had to pay the driver when you got on!) and just as quick. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will hopefully be going back in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....superb bathtub ;-)”
Reviews.Author: CymroCarmarthen
Reviews.Content: Great place and location. The room was quite small and the bed took up most of the space but the bathroom was just fantastic. The bathub was like a jacuzzi and the mirror opposite was huge +++

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DC4ver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2007 and found it to be a great location. I found out just prior to my arrival that it was Gay Pride in Amsterdam--and this location was a great location to get to most festivities pretty easily. The canal pride parade is just outside the hotel (back doors). I thought this was a great hotel and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, perfect spot :)”
Reviews.Author: bunny_on_journey
Reviews.Content: I spend 2 night in this hotel, and im very happy with my choice. Perfect spot in city centre, a lot of restaurants and bars around. But hotel itselfs very quiet, you'd be suprised how silent it is inside, when the party going on outside :) Worth money, just 2 metro stations from Centraal Station (stop called Waterloo). Close to Flower Market and long shopping street. Really advise to choose this place, worth 4 stars and money :)))

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandWinnie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 5 nights with my partner and i was very impressed with this hotel. the staff was pleasent except for one who was rude when we were checking in. the bed was the best i have ever slept in. the room was very nice. the hotel is very central and within walking distance of everything. the only fault i have with this hotel is that its very expensive once you get there. it was 3.50 for a can of coke and 5.00 euro for a small bottle of water from the minibar. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Rhi&Paz,
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault anything about this hotel at all. We were fortunate to receive a 'free upgrade' to an apartment, this was wonderful and much appreciated. We travel to Amsterdam at least once a year and will ALWAYS stay in the Eden Rembrandt from now on. Thank you so much for an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic”
Reviews.Author: kekecutas
Reviews.Content: Great location (close to train station, walking distance to a number of sights), very stylish design. Rooms a bit small, breakfast quite expensive. WiFi included.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: Tortoise_n_Hare
Reviews.Content: Stay - 2 nights / 2 days. Location â€“ Just down the road from the Rembrandt Square, about 20 minute walk from the main station. Room â€“ Very modern interior until you looked at the detail. Our bath plug didnâ€™t work so we had to pull it out completely to let the water drain after a shower, the plate in the bathroom was chipped, the bathtub was plastic, so it had quite a few deep scratches in it. A lot of furniture in a smallish room. Food â€“ Breakfast was OK, didnâ€™t eat at the restaurant as there are about 50 others in a 500m radius. Staff â€“ So-so. Had a small problem checking out as the bill was prepaid (or so I though). They hit us with a deluxe room extra, and extra city taxes that I wasnâ€™t aware of. Housekeeping didnâ€™t replenish our tea/coffee or milk supplies. Overall â€“ I think this hotel is going for a chic and modern approach but doesnâ€™t quite make it. I wonâ€™t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RobKarpenko
Reviews.Content: A good hotel bang in the centre of Amsterdam. Rooms are clean and modern and I will be staying there again. A couple of things to note: My room had mosquitos (common for AMS this summer), they were fully booked so could not give me another room but did eventually find some fly spay so problem solved. Breakfast is expensive at EUR15, just take a walk down the street and have a better breakfast in one of the cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: panterarule
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really splendid. Everything is brand new, modern and funky. The cab driver dropped us off at the wrong side , to it's sister hotel(cant remember the name) and the receptionist had to let us through the back way, but once were at the correct place everything was fine. The room was a spacious kingsize on the 2nd floor (I think they may have upgraded us!) though the price in January is so cheap! The bed was so comfortable we didnt ever want to get out of bed, and the only thing we didnt like was the bath/shower- it had no partition or curtain, so we had to remove clothes from there before showering. All in all, we had a great time, the staff were friendly and helpful and we are going back there this coming January!

Reviews.Title: “Discounts unsurprising...”
Reviews.Author: KingOfThePond
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Eden Rembrandt, and booked it through an online hotel-booking service at a very good price. However, there were problems almost immediately. On arrival the receptionist was totally insensitive to the fact that our bank cards were not working, and was also very brisk with an Italian couple who were struggling to book a city tour. Such service continued through the week, with staff either treating us with indifference and laziness, or even blaming us for situations that clearly weren't our fault. I won't go into details but it did put a slight dampener on an otherwise great holiday. The room was very well furnished with comfy beds and free internet, if a little small and with not much of a view, but there was no shower curtain (so the bathroom was almost permanently flooded with water) and our tea/coffee facilities were rarely replenished - maybe they were trying to get us to pay the SIXTEEN EUROS for breakfast? Hotel's location is pretty central, and most of the city centre is within a 15-20 minute walk, but if you are staying here then be sure to print off a map, as it's not easy to find if you just get off the tram at Rembrandtplein. So, other options? I stayed in the city 4 or 5 years ago and the Tulip Inn Dam Sq was a nice and friendly hotel - right in the thick of things, if not quite as sophisticated (but at least you don't feel like a naughty child every time you dare to approach the reception desk or the concierge). Might be worth a look. All in all - well, I can see why most of the TripAdviser-ites ended up here with discounts, because as it stands this hotel would find it difficult to build up a repeat business market. 4-stars is more than a little ambitious. You could be lucky and have a lovely time here, but from our point of view the staff could definitely do with a kick up the...

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoB
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife traveld to Europe to have a second honey moon, and it couldn't start better staying on this hotel. The room is very spacious and the bath is wonderfull. Besides it is in a great location, much better and safe than near Central Station. The only little problem was the room luminosity, because there was no blackout.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacationer, Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: tabinotomo
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel. But, one thing that bothered me was the fact shower stall wall was half transparent and quite visible from bed room area. As I, a mom, traveled with my 14-year old son, it was not a comfortable arrangement. I had to ask for another room for the next day citing the room was too small (actually it was true too). The other room's shower stall was not so quite visible, but still bathroom door was a glass only whose middle part was opaque. You could see the person from the bed area when he/she steps out the shower or tub. I did not know the Rembrant Square was known for Gays. We happedn to have stayed at this hotel on Gay Pride Parade Day, which did not help with noise, crowd, and trash. Other than that the hotel was nice. Just not for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: bmills
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than 50 yards from rembrandt square. It took about 15/20 minutes to walk from central station, but you can get tram 4 or 9 to the square. The room has a TV with some english language channels, a hairdryer, tea and coffee making facilities, a mini bar, safe, toiletries, phones and air conditioning. Room is average size, the beds were two twins pushed together making a big king size, very comfortable bed. Clean and tidy room. All other reviews are correct, the bathroom has a frosted glass door. Rembrandt square has plenty of bars, restaurants and coffee shops to easily just stay here the night. Red light district, dam square, the zoo, anne franks house, rijksmuseum are all within easy walking distance. Check in at 3pm, check out at 12noon but the hotel will store your bags for you. All staff we encountered were pretty friendly/professional. Didnt eat in their restaurant so can't comment on that. I booked direct with their website and paid 109euros per night (for 2 people)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Clean Amenities”
Reviews.Author: iheartvacays
Reviews.Content: After doing research on trip advisor, as well as venere.com and hotels.com, I chose this hotel for four reasons: air conditioning, in-suite/private bathroom, location, and price. I was drawn to the modern amenites and accomodations in the pictures, and was even more impressed upon arrival. Room was not ready when we arrived (around 1pm), so we just put our luggage in the storage area and walked around to get a feel for the area. The hotel is in a great central location in Rembrandtplien. Plenty of restaurants, shops, cafes, coffeshops, bars and clubs to keep you entertained for days. Close to the tram, but we decided to walk everywhere instead. Front desk personnel were courteous and efficient. They were very helpful and made arrangements for us for a taxi ride to the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who is interested in a simple, modern and conveniently-located hotel at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: coolcar2000
Reviews.Content: This review is many months late, yet I wanted to take the time to thank my fellow TripAdvisors for their great reviews of this hotel. Based on their writings, I chose this hotel for a one night stay for my "Amsterdam in 24 hours" tour. I was not disappointed. The location is just great, just enough of a distance away from the noise, yet conveniently located to the tram lines. I arrived prior to normal check in time, but my single room was ready and I was allowed in. Ultra modern and chic is how I would describe this hotel and I agree with the others, the bed and pillows are just FANTASTIC! If I find myself in Amsterdam again, the Eden Hotel would be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Canceled my stay at this rude hotel”
Reviews.Author: PearlieLupita
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and when i was supposed to arrive a strike broke out at the Amsterdam Airport. We called the hotel to inform them that we couldn't make our first night because we would have to take a night train since all flights were canceled. They were so rude and confused that it was added stress to our already difficult situation. The manager told me to "talk to her attorney" when I asked if we would be charged for the missed night. Everyone was hostile immeadiately for no reason. Very strange management. We canceled our remaining nights due to this rudeness and picked another hotel which ended up being in a better location and cheaper! Be careful with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler518
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to stay the weekend in Amsterdam and after reading mostly good reviews about this hotel, we decided to stay here. We enjoyed it and really have no complaints! The location is good. From central station, you get on the 4 or 9 tram and get off at Rembrandtplein. The hotel is on that same street on the left. You can walk everywhere in the city on foot so this hotel was a good location for us. There are plenty of pubs, restaurants, bars and coffeeshops right around the hotel so whatever you are looking for, it is in that rembrandtplein square. The rooms were nice and clean. Not too big but just the right size when really all you do is sleep there. A nice flat screen TV in the room as well. Everyone is right about the bathroom situation so be prepared for that. There really is no room for the bathroom. It is a bunch of glass doors separating each, with the shower visible from the bed (frosted glass). Didn't bother my husband or I though. (See my photos from the room) Staff was friendly. We got to put our luggage in storage the day we checked out. They have computers with printers downstairs you can use. The hotel also has a conceirge with brochures and such on the city. We loved our stay in Amsterdam and would definitely stay here if we ever go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: phoenix_fqtv
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a great stay at this hotel. I was able to obtain a really good rate and was given one of their large rooms with a large bath (two separate showers, one in the bathtub and another one located next to it, neither being enclosed in any way). Most of the rooms, however, appeared to be smaller and contained smaller baths. Our room was very quiet and the hotel is air conditioned. The location is very good, just off of Rembrandt Square and within walking distance of most attractions. A tram stop is located just a block from the hotel. The public areas of the hotel are nothing to speak of; however, I don't spend time in the public areas anyway. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is shared with a sister hotel located just behind; consequently it can be a little hectic but it was certainly adequate. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are able to obtain a good rate and are not interested in a full-service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: UsaWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review before but after staying in this Hotel I felt responsible to alert the others. This hotel is not rated correctly; it must be 2 to 3 stars max, but absolutely not a 4 stars hotel. Front deck staffs are most unfriendly and likely there is management problem, every time I pass by the front desk a guest is arguing and shouting about something with the front desk staff. When I complained about the bathroom problem and requested to change the room I was asked to pay 20 Euro extra for upgrade room. The carpet is dark gray so you canâ€™t see the dirt but your feet feel sticky from walking in the room. If you are smoker you must pay additional fees for cleaning (written inside the room), house keeping are the most annoying ever, if you have the no disturb sign hanged it is useless, as they barged into the room regardless of the sign, like you are not there. Noise is major problem from the rooms around you and top of you. You will hear people and TV sounds. If you Last but not least the breakfast is cold thatâ€™s ok but too old you can tell from the milk, bread, etc. if you are looking for a view then this is not the hotel you want to be in.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomjanmatt
Reviews.Content: We booked this holiday as a weekend getaway pretty much last minute. We read all the reviews out there but still went with an open mind as we have discovered in the past that not everyone likes the same thing!!. We were certainly not let down. We arrived early morning and as the check in time was 2pm we decided to have a wander round. The hotel is really easy to find from Central Station, just follow the round ahead over the canal and down through Dam Square. You will see the Madame Tussauds Museum on right. Keep walking down there until you come to just before the flower market and you will see the sign posts for Rembrandt Square. There is a monument in the middle that cannot be missed. If you stand with the monument to your right look straight ahead and you will see just off Rembrandt Sq the Eden Rembrandt. The reception staff were exceptionally helpful and as we were early we asked if we could leave our bag there. This was not a problem, they were very helpful. When we were able to get to our room we were told that we had been upgraded which was a bonus. The room had a separate toilet and bathroom with power shower. Very modern decor thoughout. We had a corner room so there was a table and chairs in the bay window, dressing table and a massive bed. There is a plasma screen in the rooms (if you are boring enough to stay in and watch it!!!, why you would want to when there is so much to do in amsterdam?) Beware the minibar! If you pick anything up you will be charged on check-out. The trays are all sensored! There are tea and coffee making facilities and they are replenished if you stay for 2 nights or more. The hotel is in an excellent location for any of the main squares, the flower market and all the museums. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would certainly go back again! The sooner the better.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: KVA2007
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend NOT staying at this hotel. I made a reservation online, via hotels.nl. I was explicitly told that I was getting a queen-size bed or two single beds put together. When I arrived I was given a little hole for a room, with a tiny bed that was not even a twin. When I showed the woman at the reception my reservation, she replied that "Well, you made the reservation through hotels.nl, not through us, so you really need to contact *them* to get this straight". That was, of course, entirely absurd. It is the hotel's responsibility to make sure that whoever makes reservations ON THEIR BEHALF does so accurately and properly - not the paying customer's responsibility. I was promised a double bed and coughed up my credit card number to guarantee it. I was not given a double bed when I arrived. Ergo, I was not given what I paid for. The least they could do was (1) accommodate me immediately by switching me to a room with a double bed and apologizing, and (2) contact hotels.nl to make sure this is not repeated in the future. That is what would have happened in any professionally run establishment, certainly anywhere in the US. Instead, what I got was attitude, as if the situation was my fault. The reception staff were completely unhelpful, arrogant, aloof, and at times downright rude. I ended up getting an "upgrade" after talking to the manager, but even that took about 15 minutes of arguing, and the "upgrade" was really no upgrade - it was no more than what I had originally reserved. In general, the hotel advertises itself as four stars when in reality it is 2.5 or at best 3 stars. The rooms are small, poorly lit, and barely clean. But by far the worst aspect was the completely substandard and unprofessional service from the staff. I've stayed at hundreds of hotels in my life, throughout the world, and I NEVER, never saw such rude and unhelpful staff. I could not possibly recommend against this hotel in stronger terms.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right fit”
Reviews.Author: teeplew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 17-month-old granddaughter, have just returned from our excursion to Amsterdam. I'll attribute most of success of this trip to the stay we had at the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel. After reading the review of another member, entitled, "Stop wasting your time. Book this hotel now!" I did exactly that. Well, empecinado, was not lying. Here are the initial notes I've added on my trip advisor page: Esquisite accomodations in the ideal location. The Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel presents a modern blend of hospitality in a fascinating cultural setting. Located on the brim of Rembrandt Square, this hotel is located close to everything close to you when you think of Amsterdam. Simply put, with a number of accomodations available, you can find yourself almost anyqhere. After walking around a bit, I'd concluded I was right where I needed to be. Located in Rembrandt Square, we had our choice of dining, entertainment, and local culture throughout the stay. We'd arrived early, 10am to be exact, with a scheduled check-in at 2pm. No problem, a junior suite available for 40 euro more, was well worth the cost. Got a quick nap in before most could check in at 2pm (and a larger room), leaving us with Amsterdam city for the rest of the day. Location: Wonderful. Close to everything, quiet at night, access to parking a huge benefit. If you want to do yourself a favor, find yourself in this hotel, and enjoy Amsterdam!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jabei
Reviews.Content: Just back from Amsterdam on a work trip and stayed at the Eden. My review is tempered by the fact that someone else was paying the bill. If it had been my own Â£120 for a single room, I may have slightly different views concerning value for money. However, the points I note should be taken regardless of the cost of the room. Positive Staff absolutely fantastic...English speaking...very helpful Location great.....Right on the Remrandt square with some nice bars and Damm square and then the other areas very close Room very nice....It's small but very clean. The bed was fantastically comfortable and the bath was deep & wide.....great stuff. A nice flat screen tv as well Noticed two internet points in foyer...didn't use them but saw they had a printer, which is very useful for longer trips (I was there one night) if you need to print directions, timetables etc. Negative....Air con didn't go down low enough...was very warm There you go...I recommend highly for business & for pleasure if you have fairly deep pockets or can get a good deal

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Constant_Traveller99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about 4 times in 2006 for business. From a tourist perspective: It is a great place, funky decor, funky rooms - some rooms can be small. Good locations to the Opera house, flower market, and the independen artist market. They have a great restaurant (consider one of the tops in Amsterdam right next to it - called ELO). From a business traveller perspective: Internet in the rooms work great, they did not have WiFi. Location is not the best if you need to have access to Train station - it requires a taxi ride to get to the train station. In General: staff was always friendly and very helpful with everthying. I would stay again with my wife for fun, but; would not book it for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - best hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: J-onandJon
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely made our trip! It was just off of Rembrandt square, ideal location and on an EXTREMELY quite road considering how close to the night life it was! The room was absolutely spotless. The bathroom was amazing and the shower was outstanding - a rainfall shower AND a regular showerhead. The bed were THE MOST comfortable bed we have EVER EVER slept in. The whole hotel was absolutely fabulous. I have been to amsterdam 5 times now and this was THE best hotel I have stayed in (and I have been with more expensive). Ideal location, beautiful room. Don't listen to any bad reviews of this place (if there are any), this hotel is THE hotel to be in when visiting amsterdam!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Dib25
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4night stay. The hotel was fabulous. We had 2 rooms (265 & 270) both rooms were spacious and they were extremely clean. There was tea, coffee and hot chocolate provided in the rooms. The hotel also provided towels, shampoo, handwash and a hairdryer(not good for long hair as it overheats quite qickly and cuts out). The beds were very comfortable and hard to get out of in the morning. The location is superb, everything is just a short walk away . If you plan on going a little further a field the tram stops a few metres away from the hotel. There are plenty of boat trips around the canals or you can go by bike in and out of the many side roads. Overall i would recommend this hotel to anyone and on my next trip to Amsterdam i will be definitely checking back in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Snowdog999
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location in Amsterdam near Rembrandt Square. Room size was decent, beds were very comfy. Only thing that may bother some is the bathroom, which is separated from the bedroom by glass, not a solid wall. So as long as the couple is friendly, everything is fine - but if it's two on a business trip, may want somewhere that offers more bathroom privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jenniecat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very central location, particularly if you don't fancy wandering too far to eat in the eve as Rembrandt Square is surrounded by restaurants and bars. Rooms are very modern and stylish but agree with other reviews that the bed are too soft! The concierges were extremely helpful. The breakfast in the hotel is pricey (12 euros for continential) if you're not inclusive but just yards down the road is the Opera cafe which serves a great selection and the staff are all very friendly - as is the cat!

Reviews.Title: “Problems at the Eden Rembrandt”
Reviews.Author: DownSouthUS
Reviews.Content: Several problems during a recent stay would make it difficult to return and recommend to others. This hotel is unable to arrange shuttle bus transfer to the airport. Concierge said "disagreements" with the several companies made it impossible so I could take my bags (no bellmen) about a block and over brick streets and trolley tracks to another hotel and arrange airport transfers through them. Then I asked could they call a cab. . .they didn't do that either. . they had a private car service they used which they never were able to tell me an exact price but "around 40 to 42 Euros. .. Car service was very nice but cost a flat 45 Euros which was over three times what a shuttle bus would have been. i don't know of any hotel anywhere claiming Four Stars and not able to arrange airport shuttle service. Air conditioning was elusive. . .first room's unit blew warm air on the coldest setting so they moved me to a second room which seemed to function at times. i went down to report and came back to find window open. Other than noise from outside this was okay but could be a problem when temperatures heat up. And CNN had been removed from the hotel system replaced by the Travel Channel. Hotel has nice design but doesn't seem to know how to operate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel, nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: VespaLass
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews on this site and Expedia, with a real priority for me being its cleanliness and quietness. It didn't disappoint on either count and had the added bonus of being in an excellent location - far enough away from the slightly too brash touristy bits but near enough as not to be a long walk from anywhere useful. The modern room was nice and the bathroom was excellent, although some might be surprised at the European practice of having no shower curtain so the bathroom floor gets a bit wet. I'd definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a couple of flaws”
Reviews.Author: Stormfront5
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here including the annual Queens Day festival which was a great spectacle to witness. Hotel is very central which was great for sightseeing as we were able to walk everywhere. Close to Rembrandtplein and noise from partying during festival could be heard in hotel room (but that would be the case where ever you are in the city on 29-30 April - don't go to Amsterdam on any festival day if you aren't prepared for a party atmosphere). Loved the modern room, including flat screen tv, fantastically comfortable bed and 'wet-room' shower. Only gripes were (1) breakfast - hugely over-priced and refills of tea/coffee were extra so only ate in hotel once and (2) room not ready on arrival or on one day during our stay but on both occasions house-keepers acted straight away once reported to reception desk. Overall, loved Amsterdam and would certainly recommend hotel and stay there again (but find breakfast elsewhere)

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: loose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at Easter. Booked a few months in advance, but due to it being Easter the best rate we could find was about Â£130 a night, so not cheap! Location is good, right next to Rembrandt Square. Rooms were nice, but small & I found them to be lacking in character. They've tried to make them modern but really it feels very much like a standard business hotel. The first morning we tried to have a shower & found that the water was freezing cold. We rang down to reception & apparently it was a problem with the whole hotel. We accepted that, problems happen. However, the next evening I tried to run a bath & found the same problem again. I reported this to housekeeping but they didn't seem overly concerned. I said we would expect a discount & they agreed. Anyway, when we checked out the reception hadn't been told about this so we basically had to raise it all again. The Assistant Manager gave us a 5% discount & said we should contact the Manager by email for a further discount. I sent 3 emails & finally a week later got a reply with a further 5%. Overall, its a pretty nice hotel, but even with the discount I found it to be overpriced. Okay, the bed was very comfy, but the lack of hot water was a really big problem. Also, the teabags were not replaced on a daily basis & the shampoo & shower gel in the bathroom were not replenished. Not good enough - I would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: HectorNottingham
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great although the bedroom area was a little on the small side, the bathrooms and comfortable beds really made up for this. All sights within easy walking distance - 5 mins walk to the flower market and 15-20 mins to Museumplein. Near to metro, trams and canalbus stops. Just round the corner from the hotel is Utrechtsestraat which contains some of the best restaurants in Amsterdam. During our stay there was a lot of unexpected construction work (both to us and the hotel) which the hotel kindly compensated us for. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MacDougie
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 31 - April 3. Booked through hotel website and got a very good deal. Very nice hotel in an excellent location. Yes, rooms are small, but such is the norm in Europe. From Central Station take the 4 or 9 tram to Rembrandtspein. Stepping off the train, walk in the direction the tram is going and the hotel is about 50 yards on your left. Took the advice of previous reviewers and requested a room on the fifth floor, facing the back - Room 564. Much quieter than the front room on the third floor which my travel mates were staying (Room 380). Construction was occuring during our visit too, but given the hotel's location, one really can't complain - it is the city. My flight was cancelled so arrived a day late and extended the reservation an extra day before arrival by phone - Kathy in reservations was very helpful and accomodating. Same thing for the weekend front desk attendent - Crystal - very pleasant and anticipated our early check-in. Would stay at this hotel again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic engagement in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: burroontour
Reviews.Content: We booked at the very last minute for a romantic easter break. It was difficult to find any available rooms at this busy time, but found a double room at the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel. Much more than we would normally spend on a hotel, but rooms at a premium due to Easter. Walked from central station in about 15 mins, quite easy to find, very close to Rembrandt Square where bars, cafes, clubs, restaurants etc. An ideal distance away from the Red Light District and surrounding areas so can walk at night whilst staying in a nicer, more relaxed area. Room modern and nice, which would be expected from a new hotel. Can't comment too much on hotel facilities or food as only used room and didn't eat any food, staff friendly enough though. Room with comfortable bed, flat screen TV, mini bar (automatically charged!), nice bathroom with features such as warm mirror, frosted glass door, central bath taps. Lots of storage space. My main complaint was the noisy room as room faced main road. Traffic not a problem and didn't hear any construction noises as in previous reviews but quite a lot of noise from people leaving bars and clubs on square. I would stay again and would give a higher rating except for the very high charge due to easter. Next time I am more likely to stay on a hotel on a nearby canal as more romantic and less noisy. All that said a wonderful break in Amsterdam, a wonderful city with plenty to do for all ages and tastes, definitely a romantic place, my boyfriend even popped the question and bought me an Amsterdam diamond! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend”
Reviews.Author: bexma
Reviews.Content: I too stayed at this hotel during their restaurant construction. I was quite upset that there was no mention of the construction on their website when I made my reservation or when I checked in. As an aside, I had been scheduled to stay two nights, but due to a storm, my flight was cancelled and I only stayed 1 night. I gave them more than 24 hours notice that I wouldn't be there the first night, but had to pay for the room anyway. Again, when I wrote to tell them that I would not be there the first night, they didn't mention the construction. When I complained to the manager in the morning, I was told that they would give me a 50% discount for the second night. When it came to pay the bill, they would only take 45 euros off of the bill (nowhere near 50% of the second night.)
