When I pointed out what they had originally promised me, they acknowledged that they had said that but could only deduct 45 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: cmy
Reviews.Content: We knew we were in for a treat when our taxi driver told us that we were staying at a very nice hotel, in a good location. He wasn't wrong. The hotel is just off Rembrandt Square, in the heart of everything. Trams run directly from the square to the train station and the rest of Amsterdam. Everything that you need to see is within walking distance. If you feel like being more leisurely, as we did, you are close to canal boat stops. The square has lots of cafes and restaurants of varied styles and prices. Check out De Kroon - fantastic views of the square, Cafe L'Opera for it's great conservatory and Cafe Schiller for its art deco. There's also Cafe Smokey - the name says it all. As for the hotel itself. Well, we couldn't fault it, despite being there during renovations. The room was a good size for a short stay. The bed was large and extremely comfortable. The decor was modern and there was an lcd tv with English channels. The bathroom was fantastic with heated flooring, a brilliant shower and very well presented. The cleanliness was imaculate.Our room was on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel. The one downside of the location of our room was the noise from drunken revellers in the square. However, this was only a problem on Saturday night, and we did realise in the morning that our window wasn't quite shut properly which may have made things worse. We ate in restaurant FLO which is attached to the hotel. The food was fantastic, well worth the rather expensive price.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Sambo27
Reviews.Content: As most of the other reviews have said, the location of this hotel is very good. It's just off Rembrandt Square which has some bars, restaurants, a nightclub and a nice selection of less commercialised coffee shops near by. There is a tram stop about 200m away but if the thought of trams seems a bit scary as it did to us, the hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk from Central Station. Our room was at the front of the hotel with the trams going past between 6am -12am. The noise isn't much of a problem until they ring the bell to warn people to get out the way. Unfortunately no amount of double glazing will keep that noise out so I suggest asking for a room away from the front of the hotel. We were then woken at 8am (admittidly it was a Monday) by workman on the building site directly opposite which we had failed to notice upon our arrival on a quite Sunday afternoon. The quality of the room was very good value with modern fittings and clean although we did not spend much time there. Flat screen tv with a few english channels amongst others and v. comfy beds. The mini-bar is automatic so charges you even if you move something then put it back. Desk with chair and nice arm chair with foot stool but you should know that the bathroom door is mainly frosted but doesn't give much privacy so I wouldn't recommend for people who aren't that close to the person sharing the room! Lovely powerful shower and reasonable hair dryer. My main bug bear with this hotel is the housekeeping. On our first morning, we left the Do Not Disturb sign on the door until about 11am when we left for the day and turned it round to say Please clean our room. We returned from a day of sightseeing at around 7pm to find our beds have not been made (2 singles as I don't think they have doubles). I kept my cool and politely explained to the receptionist (who was a little abrupt unlike many of the natives) that despite being out for 8 hours during the day, our room had still not been serviced. She apologised and said she'll get someone straight on to it. Thinking our problem was being resolved, we went out and enjoyed the evening only to return at midnight to find the room was still untouched. I was too tired to make a fuss at that time of the night so we made them ourselves and went to sleep. Normally, I would have really kicked off about that because when you pay to stay in a hotel, you don't expect to have to make your own bed. However on this occasion, I just wanted to get out and enjoy the sunshine without getting myself in a bad mood and we were leaving later that day so there was nothing really to be done about it. (I'd already paid in full via Expedia so no use trying to get money off the bill!) Having said all of the above, we were only in Amsterdam for 2 nights and although incredibly irritating, it did not in any way ruin our trip. If you are just going for a few days, I would recommend this hotel to my friends and would stay there again myself due to the location and high spec rooms but just remember to get a room away from the front of the building and probably not a good idea if you're staying for any length of time.

Reviews.Title: “spot on!”
Reviews.Author: geordieinfrance
Reviews.Content: what can i say...booked at last min a day before we went...hotel was lovely...clean, nice staff...even got an upgrade to a junior suite (rm 585)...all in all very happy!

Reviews.Title: “What a complete Joke!! do yourself a favour and don't stay.”
Reviews.Author: bigwal
Reviews.Content: This place masquerades as a decent hotel, however don't be fooled!! As someone who is unfortunate enough to spend 75% of my life in hotels (some people even call me Alan Partridge) I certainly know what I am talking about on this subject. I have now stayed in this hotel from Monday to Friday and one weekend for a month. I have been in a number of rooms in this time. The first room I had was excellent, very good decor and a really nice bathroom with a bath and separate shower. This week was fine, however since then things have got progressively worse. The noise from the Trams and the drunks at night trundling past your window at 3am is a little irritating. Most of the other rooms I had although well decorated are all very small. The standard breakfast that costs an arm and a leg is exactly the same EVERY morning, a baguette, croissant, one slice of cheese and once slice ham served with of ONE glass of orange and one coffee or tea. You do have the option of some nicer stuff but all of that costs extra on top of the already very expensive basic price......even a top up of orange costs extra!!! You are probably bored by now, however the worst is yet to come. After working very late and arriving at 2am in the hotel I was very ready for bed. I managed to drop off at about 2:30am only to be awoken at 4am by drilling and hammering!!! In their infinite wisdom they decide to refurbish the restaurant directly beneath my and a number of other rooms and at 4am!. I called to complain twice but was fobbed off being told they could do nothing. After only getting 2 and a half hours sleep I eventually gave in and got up at 8am. I complained in the morning to the Manager and was treated with contempt, eventually she agreed to change my room..........to a much smaller room although at least it was now non smoking like I had originally asked for!! As I was already late for a customer meeting the hotel staff agreed to move my suitcase and clothes in the wardrobe for me, when I returned in the evening, you guessed it my clothes where gone. The hotel has now lost ALL of my clothes, I am left with one pair of jeans and one shirt!!! If you are coming here for a drunken weekend where you don't really intend sleeping and when you do sleep you do not intend to get out of bed for breakfast then you will probably have an OK time, everyone else should stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget luxury”
Reviews.Author: tigerfly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Eden last year. We actually arrived on the opening night! As we walked through the revolving doors at lunchtime to check in workmen were still frantically dashing around drilling light fittings and and hoovering the sofas. To be honest it all added to the excitement and the lobby was pristine by evening. The rooms were compact and functional, plenty of cupboard/drawer space. The bed was HUGE and super-soft. Wall mounted LCD TV and cool decor made the room feel very hip and boutique-y. Only major draw back to the room was the fact that the bathroom walls were glass, yes, glass. And only partially etched so actually not very private at all. Scarier than that was the fact that the bathroom door was salon-style so no noises were contained! We got used to it quite quickly, but we did feel quite uncomfortable at first as we really hadn't been together that long. Our room had particularly noisy air-con which I found really irritating, and on complaining I found the reception staff to be quite flippant and unwilling to help. Porters and cleaners on the otherhand were very courteous and responsive. There was an empty space where the mini bar and safe should have been, but I must stress that we were amoung the very first guests and that didn't detract from the experience. We didn't eat at the restuarant even thought it opened 1/2 way though our stay. The menu looked pretty good, some interesting fish dishes. Great location, fantastic urban-cool feel. If we ever go back to Amsterdam, the Eden is my 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Noise Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: LondonLass2006
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm at the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel as I write this review, and after a very long sleepless night, the noise is still ongoing from the hotel's renovation construction work. They stopped work at around 11pm, but started again at 4:30am, so the hammering has just not stopped really. The room is fine, very good in fact, very clean, with nice bedding and toiletries. Free high speed internet access by a cable is on a small desk, which is also very good. The room also has a kettle with coffee/tea packets, and a minibar as well. The lobby restaurant is closed due to the renovations. My opinion is that unless you can sleep through any amount of noise, you are probably better off waiting until this renovation work is completed. I know I won't be comng back here again until it's done.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: ercl
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here.We were presently surprised by the size and quality of the room although we had upgraded to a superior room.Modern style room with very spacious bathroom with a fantastic shower.No shower cutain but the bathroom is designed as a wet room so any splashes drain away.Not a problem for us but see previous reviews.We didn't opt for the breakfast as we felt it was quite expensive and the close proximity to Rembrantplein offers plenty of cafes where you can have anything from a croissant to a full english breakfast much cheaper.Unfortunately didn't get a chance to check out the hotel restaurant.Staff were really friendly and helpful.Tramline outside window to front of hotel, but we had no problem with any noise due to the quality of the double glazing.Most comfortable bed i've experienced in a hotel!Great after a night on the town.Hotel was in a great location ,15 mins walk in any direction would either take you to the museums or to the shopping area or to the quieter canals in the Jordan district.Only draw back would the lack of a view from the hotel as it is just off Rembrantplein.we would definitely use again!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny single room the only disadvantage”
Reviews.Author: BayWalkerScotland
Reviews.Content: I spent the nights of March 8 and 9 in the Eden Rembrandt Square while in Amsterdam on business. My room was tiny - the bathroom was almost equal in size. However, the bed was comfortable and the contemporary decor was pleasant. The multilingual staff at reception were bright and helpful. There's nothing wrong with the FLO restaurant downstairs but there are plenty of attractive eating-places nearby if you want a change. I would come back but I'd hope for a better room!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: telco
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Amsterdam for well over a decade for business, and this little hotel is one of the best values in Amsterdam. I was there for one night on March 2nd before a flight to NYC. Booked with a local hotel agency for under E100 for the night. The bad news - ludicrous single beds, a bed so small that you are literally afraid to move b/c you will fall off, but they did warn about the single bed at the time of the booking and offered to upgrade to a double bed for an additional E25. The good news. Everything is clean and new. Flat screen TV and a bathroom with a bathtub and easily as large as the (small) room itself. Definitely not a fancy 5star place. But, an extremely solid value for the money. Also worth noting that the restaurant attached to Eden, Flo is one of the top rated restaurants in Amsterdam, and while its culinary ambition (reach) exceeds its grasp, it is certainly head and shoulders better than any hotel and most stand alone restaurants. An additional plus is that you can charge the meal to your room, so it's convenient to settle all the bills at once.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: CorkSeanDubh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in this hotel. The loction was excellent and very easy to find. It is close to all the main tourist spots. The staff are very efficient with time to help custumers which is a refreshing change. The concierge Mohammed gives freely of his time and he is enthusiastic about his city. Check in is 1500 hours but bags are stored securely for you and tickets are issued. Rooms are clean and well designed. For 110 euro per night this was a bargain and I would return again without hesitation. Restaurant was a bit pricey at 12.50 e for continental breakfast but there are loads of brown bars who can provide a good breakfast for less. From wake up calls to arranging taxis for us to the airport the service was flawless. Beds were very comfortable, area was very quiet. No complaints. I am hesitant about giving this hotel such a gleaming review as it will make my chance of getting a booking here again even harder but credit where credit is due.

Reviews.Title: “Super Modern Hotel Well Be Back”
Reviews.Author: thebags99
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancee stayed here for 2 nights february 5-6th 2007! We have no complants at all with this hotels it was excellent from start to finish with a superb location on the corner of rembrandt square for easy access to wherever you need to go. I wont go on as you've probably read several reviews. All i can say is if you want a modern comfortable hotel stay here Its excellent and better than most 5stars in amsterdam as friends of ours were staying in a 5star wont mention hotel name (absoloutly no comparison) they were gutted they dint book in The eden rembrandt square with us. What made it even better was Gauchos steak house was within 5 min walk from hotel doors, you must go its amazing if you like a good steak washed down with a nice argetinian wine after a long day plodding round this great city. Plenty of coffee shops and pubs whatever takes your fancy within minutes of walking out of the hotel. Tram stop right outside the hotel for getting about if you dont like walking. Oh and the staff were very friendly and helpfull too. Beds are very very comfortable. Well definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: belof
Reviews.Content: So everyone goes on about the beds....not too many people mentioned that its two single beds pushed together in ALL the rooms. Thats why I was dissapointed. We were also on honeymoon, but didn't even get an upgrade even though we mentioned this when booking. Room quite small. I work as a front office manager in a hotel and am forever upgrading people!!Would not stay there again because of this...everything else was great, especially the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: tania&calvin
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel in Amsterdam! Like the other reviews have said, this place has the comfiest beds ever! Rooms are clean & modern, and the bathrooms are fab - ours only had half a door though, and that was made of glass, so would recommend only for couples or people who know each other very well! There is a proper door on the toilet though, so at least some things can stay private. As well as the comfy beds, the hotel is really quiet at night even though you are just off Rembrandt Square, so is great for a good nights sleep. FLO Amsterdam, the hotel's restaurant is also good - not cheap, but the food and atmosphere was great. Would recommend making reservations though as its packed even on a Monday night. One thing to note - if you are paying in cash for your stay, they require a 50euro deposit on arrival, in addition to the full cash payment upfront. You get this back on departure (unless you've drank it from the mini bar!) but its just something to be aware of. Overall was a great stay - great rooms, friendly, helpful staff, and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RegularTravellerUK
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed at this hotel from 26-28 January 2007; got a great price (room only) on easytobook.com. Our second choice was the Amsterdam American hotel, but we liked the fact that the Eden was easier to get to from the Central Station and the rooms are nice and modern. Free internet access in reception was handy for checking in on line when returning home. This hotel is in a great location, just off Rembrandt Square. It is also easy to get to from the Central Station after taking the train from the airport with a ride on tram 4 or 9 to the square. Trams are inexpensive and frequent and run to a very accurate timetable. 20 minute walk from the hotel to Dam Square, plenty of restaurants nearby but one thing to note: most restaurants close at 11pm so by the time we arrived and went to find a restaurant, a lot were closed or closing. Also recommend reserving a table at a restaurant if you find one you like as the ones we liked (Indonesian, Thai, Malaysian) were all full on the Saturday night as apparently, Dutch people eat out early and spend all night in the restaurant. Felt very safe walking about in the evening especially back from the Red Light District at 1am as lots of people were about. Would also recommend the Canal Bus Tour and the Van Gough museum for something to do. Plan to return to Amsterdam either in the summer or within the next year and will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: hen24
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from a 4 night stay at this hotel, booked via BMI BABY & apart from having to pay an extra 5% 'city tax' per person, per night when we checked out, we were very pleased with our stay. The location of the hotel is excellent - 5 mins left to the Jewish History Museum & 5 mins right to Dam Square. The hotel is on Rembrandt Square which I can highly recommend as there are plenty of quality restaurants & bars all set around the square & the area was very safe at night & much more upmarket & less crowded than the Leidesplein area. I can highly recommend L'Opera for food, it's also the perfect place to enjoy a coffee while watching the world go by & is very popular with the locals who dine here before seeing a show at the theatre. You must also visit the Chinese beauty salon next door to L'Opera as I can thoroughly recommend the full body massage, manicure & pedicure after a long day of sightseeing. There is plenty to do within a stone's throw of the hotel - 'Three Sisters' Pub, 'Rain' Bar/Club, 'Rembrandt Cafe', 'Subway' Sandwiches, Cinema & High Street Shopping - H&M, Body Shop, Diesel, Skechers & the Magna Plaza Shopping Centre are all within a short walk away. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful, the rooms are modern, clean, spacious, the beds are the softest I've ever slept on, the luggage room is safe & well organised & the concierge speaks every language imaginable. I couldn't fault this hotel, the staff, or the location, the only negative, is that Amsterdam is currently going through a major refurbishment, due for completion 2008, therefore, many major attractions are not fully open, or surrounded by scaffolding (ie. Dam Square, Jewish History Museum, Van Gogh Museum, Rijks Museum, Central Station & many of the cobbled streets are being renovated). Enjoy your trip, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Gret location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: emmaellie20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel feb 5th for 2 nights. We arrived at 10am and as checkin wasn't till 3pm so we left our bags in the lugage and went to explore. The hotel was in a great location, near dam square, about 15min walk, but not so near that you would get bothered by noise. We went back the hotel at 1:30pm and our room was ready so we could check in early. The room was lovely, v.modern, clean, tidy and the most comfortable bed in the world!! We ate at a restaurant near the hotel which was lovely. If you come out of the hotel and turn right its the second turning on your right, we can't rememder the exact name but bit begings with an s and is in green writing. Also on the main road heading towards Dam Square on the left is a restaurant is called Le monde de march which was absolutly gorgeous, they do such lovely and healthy food with a massive choice for lunch. We also did madam tusaude, amsterdam dungens, anne frank house, cannal cruise and the heineken experience which were all really good. We would recommend before you do any trips to go to an excursion ticket shop. There is one next to Madam Tusaude and the man in there was so helpful. The tickets you buy from him not only save you money but you get a fast pass ticket allowing you to avoide the queues. All in all a fantastic trip,loads to do and a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: pickledpepper
Reviews.Content: First we read reviews posted on TripAdvisor, and they were generally very good. The write-up on Expedia encouraged us to look more closely, and the price/package was good, though we were only there one night on a flying visit. Check in was at three (we arrived at 1200 midday) but the concierge stored our bags while we stepped out. The Hotel is one minute from Rembrandtplein and the same to the stop for Trams 4 and 9 for the Central Station via the Dam. Reception was efficient and professional, in keeping with the Hotel's modern ambience. Our room was surprisingly large, lots of room to move/spread out, a nice armchair and flat-screen TV with excellent menu of TV channels, films etc. Minibar with "intelligent" (rather scary) fridge that automatically "knows" what you've removed. Kettle, drinks, glasses (sparkling clean). The room was immaculate, though there was a vague tobacco smell (we asked for non-smoking). Bathroom super, gleaming, shower cap, ample space to lay out make-up stuff (my wife says all women appreciate a bathroom with shelves, good lighting etc). Check-out is an indulgent 1200 midday - what a boon. Beds super-soft, delicious. Room quiet, warm, sanctuary. This hotel deserves to be a well-kept secret, and we would like to return. Summit hotels (the chain) have hotels world-wide. Hope they are all as good. Native English-speakers should IMO never take for granted the skill and application of Dutch staff in meeting their needs so effortlessly. Congratulations to everyone concerned. A small concern, a disconcerting "step up" to the bathroom from the main suite, and "step down" when leaving it. It caused us both to stumble slightly, but you'd probably t used if you stayed a few nights, I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EvertoniansLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. Lovely room, not great view but who cares! Comfortable beds, clean rooms and lovely continental breakfast included in our special deal. Central for all tourist attractions and plenty of bars, restaurants. Our first time in Amsterdam but we will definitely return and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: csjnd
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Eden Rembrandt hotel - this week. All good things to say about the hotel: 1. Great location 2. Clean rooms 3. Great bed! 4. Great bathrooms - large and modern 5. Convenient free internet access (2 terminals in lobby) 6. Friendly and high service staff We would recommend this to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Eden in Rembrandt Square”
Reviews.Author: Erkmen
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Amsterdam visitor for business. I was always staying at Swissotel Amsterdam due to our company aggreement. However due to lack of space, I had to find an alternative for my first four days of my 10 days visit in November 2006. I have checked the reviews on tripadvisor and made a reservation to the hotel from the hotels website. The reviews on TA were describing something like a hotel in heaven. In this respect I was a bit disappointed, not because of hotel or the facilities it has, but just the tooo gooood comments increase my expectations. First thing I would like to tell, this is a real good hotel. As I have been to Amsterdam several times, I can easily name it, as a best buy you can get in Amsterdam. But dont expect the hotel of your dreams, just a nice, reasonable, modern and comfortable one The hotel is located at Rembrandt square, a very nice and convenient place. It costs around 10â‚¬ from the central station by taxi or you can take the tram 4, 16 or 25 from the CS to Rembrandt Square and walk 30 meters to the Hotel. The rooms are so comfortable. The bathroom is very nice and good quality soaps, shower gels are making a long bath very enjoyable. The beds, are marvellous. I can tell that I had one of the nicest beds after so many years. The only bad part is you wont even want to wake up. All rooms are equipped with an LCD tv with nearly 20 international channels and also pay tv channels. One very good thing of the hotel is that they offer a free internet connection. There are two desktops in the lobby and wireless network. If you carry your laptop, you can easily connect and also there is an LAN connection in the room free of charge. It is not easy to find free internet connection in Amsterdam in many places. After my stay at Eden, I passed to Swissotel again, but I suppose next time I will totally stay at Eden..

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed in in Europe”
Reviews.Author: sheda
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights on December 2006, and had the best time. I read the reviews here and booked the hotel because of them and the excellent price we got. but I was sceptic on how accurate the review were. well, they knew what they were talking about!!! 1. The beds, oh the beds. I didn't understand why people here were so excited about the beds, until I got to the hotel. It was the most comfortable sleep I can remember. 2. The rooms are clean, they provide shampoo etc. and refill every day if necessary. the rooms are always clean and tidy. 3. the hotel is in a great location, almost on remberandt square which is full of restaurants, bars and coffee shops, but just far enough for us not to hear ANYTHING in our room. it's 30 seconds walk and a whole different world. there are trums there to anywhere you want, though it's best to just walk :-). the Dam square is 10 minutes by foot and the road is through all the shops so it's nice... 4. The reception and concierge were very nice. we could leave our luggage in the hotel after check out. there is free internet with 2 computers in the lobby for the guests (were never busy) and even a printer. the internet for your laptop is not wireless (only in the lobby) but it's free, which was great in order to stay in touch with the family back home. 5. The breakfast was included so it was nice (we payed for extras like omletes which are not included). if i hadn't gotten it in the room price, I probably would have eaten out. but with the extras it was tasty and sufficient. 6. at the hotel you get quite a good map of amsterdam, so don't buy one if you don't have to. 7. There is a great bath!!! 8. As advised here I asked and got a room on the 5th floor. The room was very big (double bed, desk, chair, room for 2 huge suitcases). There are only double beds. there is a safe in the room which was great. all and all, this is THE place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Believe what you read - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nottytotty78
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay between Christmas and New Year at the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel. Central location, just off Rembrandt Square where there are loads of pubs, restaurants and clubs. Don't worry about noise, we didn't hear a thing although we were on the third floor. We had two rooms booked and there was quite a difference. Our room had a bath and shower and overlooked a busy call centre (had to keep the curtains closed!). The second room had disabled features and was more spacious but there was no bath. Bathroom and beds were great. The only fault I found was that the rooms were rather dimly lit as there was no central light. Just eat plenty of carrots and you'll be fine!!! Tip - there are four items sitting on the shelves (crisps, nuts and wine). Don't touch them as it trips off a wire and you'll get charged!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: schtuka
Reviews.Content: From main train station is about 15 euros, don't pay more. Great location, next to Rembrandt Square. I am writing this sitting in the lobby of this hotel. Room is very small, but with newer, modern amenities. Plazma TV, excellent bed and bedding, onlike other European hotels bed is sitting high. Bathroom is nice, but no shower curtain. There is a french restaurant, but we found a nice italian restaurant not far from hotel. Guess we will try french tomorrow. Stuff is helpfull, but there is no bar in lobby. Room is so small, you can't lay down a small suit case on the floor. Furniture is nice and we don't care about walking space in the hotel room. Recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hayzer
Reviews.Content: Like most people here we loved this hotel. It may not look much from the outside or have great views from the rooms but it more than makes up for it in other ways. The Rembrandtplein is a great place to stay quieter than the busy city centre, yet has plenty of bars and restaurants locally. It is a pleasant 5 minute stroll into the busier heart of the city. The hotel itself is great I found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them. The room was great well appointed and finished to a very high standard. And as a few people have mentioned the beds are so comfortable, in fact when we got home we went to buy a new mattress as we felt we had been missing out on real comfort for so long. As someone mentioned the toilet doors are fine if you are a couple but may not provide enough privacy for some situations. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and when we go back next year we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “great room at the Eden”
Reviews.Author: dinodeens
Reviews.Content: We just got back from amsterdam yesterday after a fantastic 5 day break. I booked the hotel from reading the previous reviews and I was delighted with the hotel...Our room was so comfortable..We had a lovely comfy bed and a great bath which filled in seconds. There were also a selection of movies that you could choose from to watch for approx â‚¬12 per movie..which is handy for watching after getting back from the pubs. I found all the staff very helpful and when I rang reception to see if they had an adapter they send one up straight away....We had dinner on the last night in FLO, which also was delicious... I would recommend this hotel and I'm sure I will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room and beds”
Reviews.Author: blue_eyed_1
Reviews.Content: Although the service was good, each staff member did not seem very happy. The beds and location made up for it though as we didn't want to leave the comfort of our mattresses. The rooms and bathrooms were semi-ultra modern, and the location was great - far enough from the center to be quiet, but next to the Rembrandstplein close enough to the Rijkmuseum and great restaurants. There is even a 5 start, expensive restaurant called FLO attached that is for the very glamorous spenders only. We found a great deal for 3 nights, and there is a Tram stop nearby that can get you to and from Centraal Station quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: mikep06
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern, from the flat screen TV, the furniture and the glass shower, which could be almost seen through when someone was taking the shower (hopefully someone you want to see). Comfortable beds, but for some reason two mattrasses in one bed. Looked really clean and nice. Just a short tram ride form the central station, right in the middle of the city. Short walk to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Eden Rembrandt”
Reviews.Author: dprocks
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. Location is perfect, within walking distance of everything, located just outside the Rembrantplein, its a short walk to the Leidseplein, Museumplein or Dam Square. You can walk to any destination within the center in no more than 20 minutes if you don't get lost. The rooms were very nice. Very clean, very modern. The shower wall was a little trippy with the frosted glass covering a major part of the shower but all in all the bathroom was nice and you still had your privacy. If you want to watch TV at the end of the day, I think you will be very pleased with the quality of the TV and screen. Beds as have been discussed, were very very comfortable. They were two twins pushed together but it really felt like one double bed. The staff was friendly. The bellman who handled the luggage while we waited for our room were very attentive and did an excellent job. The front desk is a bit unorganized, they have a couple of bugs to work out but it didn't have much of an impact on our overall experience. The maid service was great, they even folded some of our clothes. Overall this is a nice hotel and while not cheap, its not as pricey as some of its competition. Its not the Ritz Carlton but that's probably not what you are looking for anyway. I think you will be happy with this selection and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it unless you like having your belongings stolen!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamExplorer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of the great reviews on Tripadvisor (which in the past has always been spot on). However, we had items go missing from our room (designer jeans & aftershave). When we reported this to the manager they were dismissive & really did not want to know - stating that the hotel cannot accept liability & we should have used the mini-safe! We had of course used the mini-safe for valuables but how can you put ALL your belongings in a space that is 30x30cm?? All in all the staff were unhelpful & unresponsive - although they did offer a free breakfast - not really a substitute for Â£200 of stuff disappearing from your room though! I have never had any problem like this before & until recent years have stayed in some much less salubrious accomodation. The standard rooms are very, very, small and the first room we were shown to was not clean - pubic hair on the bed - yuck! AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pussygalore10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, great location, the room was lovely and the bathroom was amazing, I would stay here again, the best thing was the bed was so comfortable I didnt want to leave. The only thing I didnt like was that they swipe your credit/debit card on arrival and when I returned home I found they had actually reserved more money than they needed so it took me a couple of phone calls to sort it out plus a 3 day wait for my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shoooze
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for our Wedding Anniversary at the beginning of October. Booked after reading other reviews. Everyone right - beds extremely comfortable and room well equiped. Great location for exploring Amsterdam and not at all noisy. Hotel not attractive to look at but inside fine. Concierge helpful in booking restaurant, Zuid Zealand (excellent and expensive). We would defintely stay here again if visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Snug as a bug in a rug!”
Reviews.Author: toptourist
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights in this hotel and what was, on the whole, a really enjoyable stay. We arrived to discover that we had been upgraded to a junior suite, as we were celebrating a 50th birthday - the receptionist even wished my husband 'Happy Birthday' when we checked in! I was so pleased with the room, as others have stated, the beds were amazingly comfortable with great big soft pillows, and our room was sooooo quiet. The decor was very modern (in fact it was very grey!!!)) and we just had so much space. The bathroom was simply amazing.(I really like getting a nice bathroom when on holiday and I wasn't disappointed!!) We had a huge bath with and adjustable shower head, plus a wet room part with a huge rain shower and another adjustable shower head - incredible!!!! (there was even a bottle opener screwed to the wall of the wet room - a nice touch if you want a beer with your bath!!) Lovely toiletries, big fluffy towels, such luxury!!! Enough about the bathroom - the other facilities in the room included plasma screen TV, showing BBC1 and CBBies as well as a few other channels. Plenty of lights, plug points, hairdryer, very well stocked mini bar, desk, tea and coffee making facilities, .... the list goes on!! We had such a comfortable stay here. After walking around all day it was lovely to chill out in such luxury and such warmth,as the weather was cold outside. The location is also excellent - don't expect to be canalside, or to have a lovely view, or for the hotel to look pretty, but do expect to be within walking distance of most things that you will want to see. Trams run from Rembrandt Square to Central station ( 9 and 25 I think, from memory) and are so cheap. The Flower Market (which I adored) is less than ten mnutes away, and other attarctions such as Museum Square and the Anne Frank House aren't more than about 15 0r 20 minutes once you get your bearings. There are numerous lovely restaurants nearby for evening meals, and the concierge was most helpful with bookings, recommendations, directions etc. The only downside to all of this was the breakfasts. On arrival we were told that our breakfast was included, so we took it, in the restaurant (flo's) that adjoins the hotel. It was more like 'bread and breakfast' than bed and breakfast. We were presented, with, well, a huge plate of ...bread, basically. Croissants, Danish pastries and freshly baked baguettes. (the take 'n' bake kind)Also you got orange juice and tea or coffee, butter and jams. Eggs, fruit, cereal etc were extra. Some people would like this kind of food, I know - so, if you do, take no notice of me!! As I say, because I thought it was included, we stuck it out. Although by the thrid day I couldn't really face another danish pastry. However, on checkout we were charged for it, and no amount of negotiation could persuade the receptionist that we had been told it was included. If I had known we would be paying, I would have gone elsewhere for breakfast - tried out some local cafes, etc. It cost 19 euros for two people, which was quite dear for what it was. All that said, I would recommend this hotel unreservedly, for it's great location and amazingly comfortable (and quiet) rooms .

Reviews.Title: “Awfull, never again”
Reviews.Author: trav_often
Reviews.Content: It smells of smoke the moment you get into the lobby. The room was on non-smoking floor but very tiny and had a problem. The only room that was offered in exhange was smoking. And even though it was the hotel's fault the duty manager wanted to charge extra... If you really want to have nice time in Amsterdam, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Roomy and Quiet Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: beekay1943
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a three-night stay at this classy establishment and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Although being allocated Room 577 (on the top floor) next to the elevator, ice-making machine and the shoe polishing machine, we never experienced any noise from both inside or outside the hotel which pleased my wife who is a very, very light sleeper. The beds are extremely comfortable and the only observations I would make to improve the facilities would be to move the flat screen TV from the wall at the foot of the bed (where you were likely to bang your head on it) and also a trouser press would be of great value. Otherwise, the facilities and staff were excellent. Only a short 15 minute walk to Dam Square or a 5-minute ride by tram (almost right to the door). Will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice and Modern!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chupa
Reviews.Content: Facts: -Very modern, clean, comfortable room. (We went there with our friends, so we have seen that not all the rooms are the same in size, Our friends told us that we had the biggest room. It was a corner room, no. 594, fyi.) -I just loved the bed! It's incredibly comfortable. -Bathroom has a glass door, but the toilet has a seperate door inside, so nothing to worry about :) -Coffee,tea maker in the room -Plasma TV in the room -Safe in the room -Nice and always helpful staff, helpful concierge. (Ask the concierge to reserve a taxi to take you to the airport (if u plan to go by taxi) , which is a little bit cheaper than the normal taxis. This one costs 48â‚¬) -Very close to Rembrandtplein, which is a very popular square. There are clubs and bars in Rembrandtplein but because of the location of the hotel, you hear nothing! U can have very quiet sleeps. -Very close to the main attractions of the city. But the area is more upscale compared to Dam and surroundings. So is a great place to stay. -Price: Nothing is really cheap in Amstedam, hotels are overly priced. Eden Remb. Sq. Hotel is not cheap either. We paid 520â‚¬ for 3 nights for a double room,breakfast not included. But we were really very happy about the hotel ! Strongly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab beds!”
Reviews.Author: stimpywoo
Reviews.Content: We got back yesterday from our weekend stay at the Eden Rembrandt Square and loved every minute of it. The location was great, not literally on the square but almost which made it great for not hearing anything outside whilst we were sleeping. We arrived quite early and the girl on reception was very helpful, giving us our room number for later, checking in our luggage etc. We had a few hours to kill before our room was ready so we wandered around for ages and visited the Anne Frank house. When we returned to the hotel, a different person was on reception who was not as helpful and insisted on answering the phone whilst we were talking to him! He didnt have any record of our booking even though we had already been given our room number. Not too much of a problem, he gave us another room straight away and we ended up with a room with disabled access with actually left us with a bigger room. The concierges here were very very helpful and very friendly if you need anything. The rooms were very comfortable with lovely beds and pillows - after a long day walking they were very hard to get out of!! Flat screen TV's were a nice touch with a couple of BBC channels to watch while we got ready to go out in the evening. Not too sure about the glass doors to the bathroom! They looked good but the toilet was located just inside the door so I could pretty much see what my husband was up to!! Overall, a good clean and modern hotel in a great location with helpful staff. We are already wanting to book to go back here!

Reviews.Title: “They get the important stuff right”
Reviews.Author: bigbat44
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Amsterdam, didn't know what to expect, what a pleasant gem of a hotel! Would definitely stay there again. Although the lobby has all the ambiance of a Red Roof Inn, our room had all the comforts of the Ritz Carlton. 5-star bedding and pillows! Room was suprisingly large by European standards. Arrived at 1030AM exhaused from flight and curtly told our room would not be ready until standard 3PM (turned out 3PM was more like 430PM and front desk staff could use a weekend retreat at charm school, but this is the only negative). Asked for a room on the 5th floor, per suggestions from previous reviews on TripAdvisor, and was not disappointed. Wound up with a junior suite, with no attempt to upcharge us. Free high speed internet access made checking emails a breeze. Americans may wish to consider bringing a roll of TP as the Kleenex in the bathroom was a bit tough to handle. Can't figure out why there was no shower curtain, by design, but it all worked out. Chambermaid staff was first rate. Location of hotel was 50 yards off Rembrandt Square, which is just as active and interesting a location as anywhere else in town. Experienced the "Invasion of the Orange People", as soccer fans descended upon the square in ever increasing droves to "tailgate" (a difficult task without cars) before the game. Expected deafening levels of revelry and debauchery after the victory; if they occurred, we did not hear a thing in our room. Avoid the restaurant adjacent to hotel for breakfast; they got everything wrong on our final day there. The cafes on the square much more charming with better food.

Reviews.Title: “The best beds”
Reviews.Author: Sue29
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a three star rating but it is far better than any three star we stayed in. After a very long flight to Europe, we were so pleased to have a couple of nights to recover from jet lag in this place. The location was great, very central, clean, quiet and by far the best beds we have slept in. Would stay there in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “classy but resonable!!”
Reviews.Author: DANNYC
Reviews.Content: got a taxi from the schipol, with a great woman Monika, she gave my partner some perfume and did us a deal on the taxi if we booked our return with her, which we did and it worked out a good deal. the hotel from the outside doesnt look much but when you step in...wow very nice..clean...modern and everyone is so nice and helpfull! checked in no probs a went to our room on the 5th floor.....exceptional, very comfy beds and love the glass looking into the en-suite shower and bathroom area. walking around was fine we had a trip on the canal-bus which was very good and our guy was soo funny with his WOWS every other word! went down to the RLD and had a walk round found a few good bars and shops very entertaining, although missus was a bit shocked ha ha ha. went to the rijkesmuseum not as good as i was expecting, but the heineken museum was a good laugh especially the "send a clip of you singing home" section very interactive and well worth the 10 euro's. some great food especially recommend the Teppanyaki nippon if you like japanese, just ask concierge he will guide you in the right direction and book you a table...we were gonna go to the osaku hotel but he mention this place within walking distance and we werent disappointed. coco's aussie bar was good aswell with happy hour 5-6 and 10-11pm on the cocktails. in all a very enjoyable 4 days and we will definately be going back there and staying at the eden again. very helpfull and very clean. definately go for a 5th floor room and non smoking if you can they are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Elber
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a great time. Hotel is modern, clean and quiet. Rooms are comfortable though some lights did not work and the open glass toilet/shower is a bit OTT. Amsterdam was really lively and lots to do. For a good value on-the-run lunch try La Place next the VB Dept Store at the Munt Tower - an amazing variety of freshly prepared food and self service. Would also recommend "de jaren" at 20-22 Nieuwe Doelenstraat - it feels like an ex university bar but the upstairs is very modern and the food was excellent and mostly organic and reasonably priced. The downstairs is a trendy bar with a great selection of newspapers and you can sit outside next to the canal if the sun is out.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, nice rooms, small breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bashdem
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here 29th - 31st August. Location is just off Rembrandt Sqaure which is about 15 mins walk from Cental Station. Everything is within walking distance, Dam Square, Red Light District, museums, bars, clubs and restaurants. Its a nice clean location. The hotel seems pretty new and is very modern in design. We arrived around 2pm and although check-in was specified as after 3pm we were shown to our room. Polite reception staff and concierge. Room was very modern design, nice shower/bathroom. The beds were VERY comfortable - the most comfortable I've slept in. Nice plasma TV on the wall with some UK channels as well, mini-bar (expensive) although the view was of the back of hotel its not something I'm that bothered about. Basically, the hotel photos and traveller photos are exactly how we found the hotel - the rooms, shower/bathroom and even the picture of the breakfast. Breakfast was a bit of a let down. The staff were pretty poor. They were uninformed and service was slow and you often had to ask for service. This is a complete contrast to the rest of the hotel staff. Strange. The actual breakfast was included in the price but all you get is OJ, Tea/Coffee, Pan au chocolat, pan au raisin and a plain baguette. This is quite filling although all hot food was extra. Scramble eggs with smoked salmon is lovely! Not over priced at 4 euros but it would have been nice to have hot breakfast included in the price. There is free internet access in the hotel reception (nice touch) and the concierge was helpful and knowledgable about the area. He does go missing quite a bit though. There was a luggage storage room if you needed to store luggage after checking out and before leaving the hotel. Overall I would definitley recommend this hotel. If you have a look on the web you can get very cheap deals. 2 people for 2 nights cost us 193 Euros (including 4 hot breakfasts). <50 Euros pppn for a 4* hotel in the heart of Amsterdam is great value!!! Though I fear this may go up as the hotel becomes more well known. I think the cheap prices are because it is new and needs customers. Get in while you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CaptinEO7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel very quickly with the main criteria being the relatively good price & excellent rating from this very web-site. It turned out that I'd made an excellent choice. For four nights over the Bank Holiday Weekend the Eden Rembrandt cost approx Â£85 per room per night which, although not inexpensive, made for an excellent deal compared to other hotels of a lesser standard in Central Amsterdam. The location is excellent. Not quite perfect but not far off. It's a simple 10/15 Euro Taxi ride from the Central Station, 50 paces from the lively Rembrandt Square & 10/15 minutes walk from Daam Square. Even though Rembrandt Square may not be to everyone's tastes myself & my girlfriend thought it was great to be able to finish a meal and sit & enjoy a drink or two in one of a number of cafe's with huge streetside seating area's watching the hustle & bustle of this superbly vibrant city pass by then retire to the hotel only a minute or two away. The street that the hotel entrance faces onto is anything but glamourous but a large part of Amsterdam is similar to this and whilst there was a lot of people around both entering & leaving Rembrandt Square's night-clubs, there was never any feeling of unease that you can sometimes feel in other parts of the city. The hotel lobby is pretty basic & amenities are few although this is again similar to much of the city's hotels. It's the rooms that make this hotel stand apart from the others. Our room was quite simpy massive for a city centre hotel with a very large main bedroom area with a decent size area off to a right angle with writing desk, minibar, wardrobe & very nice touch of free electronic safe. Brand new flat screen wall mounted LCD Tv on wall (although the cables were dropping and exposed). The bathroom sat behind very classy frosted glass doors and was decked out in stylish granite tiles with very good quality fixtures & fittings. They taps & shower fittings were highly poilished every day by House Keeping which added to the quality of stay. The bed itself was luxurious with supersoft bedding and a very cool touch were the flexible reading lights - very futuristic. The only negative aspect of the room was no view but this wasn't an issue as, quite often with hotels in the city centre it's better to be facing the central core than the street with noise possibly being an issue. Amsterdam itself provided us with a perfect 4 day break - from shopping to food to culture and all things in between. Anne Frank's house was exteremly emotional and shouldn't be missed. The boat trip was enjoyable if not a little repetitive as most of the larger canal's in the centre all look the same. We took a train ride to Holland's Major Theme Park "Efteling" which was a great day out & even Madame Tussaud's was enjoyable when it rained non-stop and was certainly a lot cheaper than London !!! All in all Amsterdam provided us with exactly what we were looking for in a short break and the Eden Rembrandt was the perfect base to explore from and retire to after a long day and night. NB - be careful not to mix this hotel up with it's sister hotel, the "origninal" Eden which directly backs onto this hotel although is apparently nowhere near as nice. Make sure you also clarify with your taxi driver that it's the Rembrandt Eden and get him to confirm that he understands. Even though it's best to get a train from the airport and then a taxi to the hotel we managed to get a taxi direct from the hotel to the airport for 32 Euro's which is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: kiboko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in August in the Eden Rembrandt Square. I booked a Non-Smoking room. During check in I was advised that no non-smoking room is available although I booked the room several month in advance. The receptionist just told me that this is only a request and nothing more. Not very friendly. Room a very trendy and nice and clean. Don't expect to much from the breakfast. They treat you like in a prison camp and you have to pay in addition for anything above jam. Even for cheese and that in the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “geat hotel”
Reviews.Author: claire&james
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here 25-28th August, this hotel was as good as the other reviews stated, we arrived early and the room wasnt ready so we left our luggage there and went for a look around to find that everything was within walking distance of the hotel - dam square, too many bars and restaurants to choose from and the red light district which is a must - very surreal. when we got to the room it was worth the wait, the room was lovely, very clean and modern, the beds were the most comfortable ive ever stayed in and the bathroom was great, with geat shower - strange glass door which was a little frosted and didn't lock, which might be a bit stange if your staying with a friend or family. tip - the mini bar in the room was very expensive so we bought water/drinks from the shop and kept them in the fridge to keep them cool, we then realised that whenever we took our drinks out we got charged as they must have thought we were taking their drinks. we told reception of this and they sorted it for us, the staff were very helpful, there was an ice machine just outside our room so we just used that in future to keep our drinks cool. amsterdam was a geat place to stay, and when i come next time i will definately be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDean
Reviews.Content: In the midst of a horrible heat wave, we arrived at the Eden a day early unannounced seeking air-conditioning. They were gracious and accommodating, giving us a very nice upgraded room because we were staying for 7 nights. The square is great with loads of restaurants, bars, exchanges nearby. You can stroll a few blocks to the Flower market or catch trams to anywhere right in front of the hotel. Nice rooms with great bathrooms...though it took awhile to figure out how to work the shower! Safe, Flat Screen TV with English channels, very sleek and contemporary stying. Although it did not have an internet available, if you let them know at the desk, they take you through a door to their sister hotel (Best Western) and give you a card for free internet access. You can get as many as you want during your stay. Very nice restaurant attached to the hotel. You may take breakfast there (we didn't), go to the bar or dine. Apparently it is one of Amsterdam's new ritzy places to eat, so you need to make reservations. If I go back to Amsterdam, I'll stay here again. Great bargain for a major city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna&ryan
Reviews.Content: I have just return from a long weekend stay at the Eden Rembrandt Square hotel and it was perfect, the staff were lovely, the room was gorgeous and the bathroom was really modern! it was in a very good location close to all bars, coffee shops and resturants but still quiet! I would definately recommend people to stay here and would definately return again! This hotel is ideal for a weekend away to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Verona29
Reviews.Content: As many other reviews said before this hotel is extremely nice and centrally located. The hotel entrance is very close to Rembrandt square and from there you can walk to all the monuments and tourist attractions in Amsterdam. It is also very close to bars, restaurants and clubs. Tram stops are a few steps away from the hotel entrance if you don't like to walk too much. The train station is a 25 minutes walk from the hotel and a 10 euro taxi ride. A tram line also connects the hotel to the train station. The hotel is in a modern style, the staff is kind and helpful. As you can see from the pictures, my room was huge! It was also very clean, with comfortable beds and a wonderful bathroom. In the room there are also a minibar and a safe. The only negative elements I could find about this hotel were: 1) Breakfast is nothing special. If you want eggs and cheese you have to pay. You get coffee/tea orange juice, bread and a croissant with jam. The rest needs to be paid. 2) The day I checked out I've heard a couple telling to the front desk that someone had entered into their room the previous night and stole some of their belongings. I don't know what exactly happened but I saw the person at the front desk directing these two people to the duty manager office. So the hotel was taking care of what happened. 3) The windows are not 100% soundproof. There were people celebrating in Rembrandt Square during my stay and the music was loud. I could hear the music from my room. But when I arrived the hotel informed me with a letter that it was gay pride week end and I had to expect some noises. Looking at my whole experience at the Eden Rembrandt Square hotel I have to say that it was a positive one. I would certainly return but I would always lock everything in the safe!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Suprise!! Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night here just last week because the houseboat we were renting was not ready yet. This hotel was such a wonderful surprise! very clean, very modern, the beds and pillows were COMFORTABLE, nice flat screen TV, the bathroom is very modern and has a great rain shower. the staff was very nice and helpful. we had a piece of lost luggage that we were still waiting on from the airline, and they took it in for us ever after we had checked out. ALSO fast internet access for those interested. LOCATION is excellent. In Rembrantplain, close to some great bars and good company. Price is very reasonable for europe prices. only inconvenient thing is when coming back to the hotel late at night - you have to wait for the receptionist to open the door for you. it's not a big deal, except when there is no receptionist in sight! i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Find”
Reviews.Author: Chris1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden Rembrandt Hotel for two nights midweek. The hotel is very new, and obviously this is reflective in the decor and general feel of the place. The rooms are very contemporary in design with plasma screen, AC, large bath and mini bar. The beds are amazingly comfortable - so much so we missed breakfast one morning as we slept in. Breakfast was included in our price, this was okay - nothing special, just included some bread rolls, croisants etc and jams. If you want cheeses/ham/salmon/eggs etc you have to pay extra for these - a bit cheeky if you ask me, but considering the price we paid anything was better than nothing! The location of the hotel is excellent, aprox 50 metres from the lively Rembrant square, where there's lots of restaurants bars etc.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampshire Hotel - Rembrandt Square Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Amstelstraat 17, Amsterdam 1017 DA, The Netherlands
